She feels so happy that she has been able to keep earning their own income regardless of the job market that has been fierce from all the competition. When she first started her stand was the only one but now there are many located near her.

Nancy wants to keep her level of success and she wants to always be busy with the work that she loves to do. She will invest this loan in the purchase of stacks of paper and notebooks that are of great necessity in her store.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase merchandise for her store, especially paper and notebooks.

loan.name: Magali

texts.es: Magali tiene 26 aos, vive con su esposo y su pequeo de 6 aos, en casa de su suegro y cuados. Ella y su esposo se dedicaron por varios aos al transporte pblico en microbs, su esposo era el chofer y ella la cobradora, pasaron as los aos, y sus ahorros le permitieron adquirir un auto de segunda mano, para trabajar haciendo taxi todos los das, los aos de experiencia en esta actividad, ya suman 6, les permite tener bases slidas en su economa.Adicionalmente, Magali es niera, esto es un ingreso extra para ella y su familia. Esta pareja de esposos se esfuerza porque desean tener un hogar estable y su casa propia. Magali solicita este prstamo el cual invertir en la reparacin del motor de su carro, para que de esa manera tenga una larga vida su motor.
texts.en:
Magali is 26 years old and lives with her husband and little 6-year-old in her in-laws house. She and her husband worked in public transportation for several years; her husband was the driver of a minibus and she was the fare collector. Their savings enabled them to buy a second-hand auto which they work as a taxi service every day. The years spent in this activity, which now number 6, have enabled them to solidify their economy. In addition, Magali is a nanny; this is extra inome for her and her family. This couple works very hard because they want to have a stable home and their own house. Magali requests this loan, which will be used to fix their taxis motor so that this way the motor will last for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Repair vehicle used for taxi service.

loan.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Ibrahima N. est n le 18 janvier 1956 Bambey. il s'active dans le mtier de la photographie depuis cinq ans. il veut acqurir un nouveau appareil avec ce pret.
texts.en:
Ibrahima N. was born on January 18, 1956 in Bambey. He has been working as a photographer for 5 years. He wants to acquire a new camera with this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of photographic materials

loan.name: Mijail Jose

texts.es:
Mijail es un joven que desde muy pequeo ayuda a sus padres en el negocio de la venta de frutas, pero hace 2 aos que empez a estudiar su carrera se vio en la necesidad de independizarse del negocio de sus papas para poder tener mas ganancias y as poder pagarse sus estudios, al mismo tiempo que seguir ayudando al gasto familiar.

El necesita un prstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercanca y poder ofrecerles frutas de la temporada a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mijail is a young man who has been helping his parents in their fruit selling business since he was a kid. Two years ago he started college and had to leave his parents business to establish his own so that he could increase his income to allow him to pay for his studies and to contribute to the family income.

Mijail needs a $250 loan to purchase products so that he can offer fruit that is in season to his clients. He will pay this loan in three months.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase fruits.

loan.name: Yenny Judith

texts.es:
Yenny es maestra de secundaria pero como en un principio no le alcanzaba con su sueldo, decidi vender cosmticos y zapatos por catalogo en la escuela entre los mismos maestros. Ahora ya es muy conocida entre los maestros y los mismos alumnos que tambin le compran, y sus ventas han ido incrementando cada da ms.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para tener ms mercanca para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yenny is a high school teacher. When she first started working her income was not sufficient to pay her expenses so she supplemented her income by selling cosmetics and shoes by catalog to her co-workers. Her business is now well known among the teachers and students and her sales have been increasing each day.

Yenny needs a $250 loan to purchase more merchandise to offer to her clients. She will repay this loan in three months.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise.

loan.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen desde hace 18 aos se dedica a la venta de productos naturales, ella desde muy joven se ha encargado del cuidado de su madre, es por esa razn que siempre se ha visto en la necesidad de tener un negocio para poder solventar tanto sus gastos como los de su mama, ahora entre su misma clientela le han empezado a pedir que venda otras cosas esa por eso que ya vende cosmticos y quiere invertir en ello para complacer a sus clientes.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercanca y tener ms opciones para sus clientes.
texts.en:
For the past 18 years Carmen has sold natural products. Since she was very young she has taken care of her mother and for that reason she has always had the need to have a business, to pay not only her expenses but also her mother's. Now her clientele has started asking her to sell other things and because she already sells cosmetics, she wants to invest more in that to please her clients. She needs a loan for US$250, which she will repay in three months, to buy merchandise and have more options for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Gloria Aracely

texts.es:
Gloria empez el negocio de la repostera para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, ya que sus hijos empezaron a estudiar y se dieron cuenta que no les alcanzaba con lo que su esposo ganaba, y ya que ella es una mujer muy emprendedora decidi empezar su propio negocio de repostera hace 6 aos.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima suficiente, ya que la demanda actual sobrepasa su capacidad de produccin
texts.en:
Gloria started the bakery business to help her husband with the expenses because their children started school and they realized that what her husband earned was not enough. Because she is a very enterprising woman, she decided to start her own bakery business six years ago. She needs a loan for US$250, that she will repay in three months, to buy sufficient raw material because the current demand surpasses her production capacity.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase raw material

loan.name: Iliana

texts.es:
Iliana desde muy pequea ha sido una persona muy trabajadora, y desde hace 4 aos que se caso empez a dedicarse a la venta de edredones, para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, y para tener sus propios ingresos.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercanca y as incrementar su inventario y estar preparada para la poca de fro.
texts.en:
Since she was very little, Iliana has been a very hardworking person. Four years ago she married and began selling quilts to help her husband with the household expenses and to have her own income. She needs a loan for US$250, which she will repay in three months, to buy merchandise and thereby increase her inventory to be prepared for the cold season.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Angel Abad

texts.es:
Angel es transportista, brinda sus servicios en el Trufi 88 del sindicato Eduardo Avaroa. Dicha actividad es su nica fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutencin de su esposa y su pequeo de 4 aos. Paga el alquiler de una casa ubicada en laa Zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crdito ser invertido en el mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo (movilidad), puesto que la mquina necesita con urgencia una revisin.
Es su segundo crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada le califica de manera ptima
texts.en:
Angel is a taxi driver, working through the Trufi 88 section of the Eduard Avaroa syndicate. This is his sole income to maintain his wife and 4-year-old son. He rents a house located in the Pasankeri Zone of the city of La Paz. The loan will be invested in the maintenance of the tool of his trade, since the vehicle urgently needs an inspection. This is his second loan through Impro, his successful loan completion is his best qualification.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Vehicle repair

loan.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 8 aos, su esposo es comerciante. Ella inici el negocio por la necesidad de apoyar en el gasto familiar, siempre le han gustado las ventas, por lo cual se dedico a esto, empez vendiendo joyera entre su amigos y conocidos y poco a poco fue haciendo una cartera de clientes.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercanca y as poder cumplir unos pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Francisca is married and has two children who are ten and eight years old. Her husband is a salesman. She started the business to help with household expenses. She has always liked sales and for that reason started selling jewelry to her friends and acquaintances and little by little built a client base. She needs a loan for US$575, which she will repay in six months, to buy merchandise and thereby be able to fill orders that she has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Enedina

texts.es:
Enedina inicio su negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que ella es la que se hace cargo de la manutencin de sus hijos. Comenz hace 7 aos vendiendo comidas en su casa posteriormente rento un local y se amplio, y poco a poco ha salido adelante.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar materia prima. Con tu apoyo ella podr continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Enedina started her business to help her children get ahead because she is the one responsible for supporting them. She started seven years ago selling food in her home and later rented a locale, expanded and little by little she has come out ahead. She needs a loan for US$350, which she will repay in four months, to buy ingredients. With your help she will be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase ingredients

loan.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa inici el negocio porque se quedo sin empleo y tenia que darles de comer a sus 2 hijos de 5 y 3 aos, as como ayudar a su mam que se encuentra enferma de diabetes y ya no puede caminar debido a que le amputaron ambas piernas. Ella se dedica la venta de colchas y zapatos por catalogo y gracias a esta actividad ha podido salir adelante.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para compra de mercanca y un estante para mostrarla y as incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa started the business because she was out of work and had to feed her two children who are five and three years of age, and also help her mother who is sick with diabetes and can't walk due to the fact that they amputated both of her legs. She works selling bedspreads and shoes by catalog and thanks to that has been able to come out ahead. She needs a loan for US$475, which she will repay in six months, to buy merchandise and a shelf to display it on and thereby increase the sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Yaliou

texts.fr: Yaliou A. est g de 29 ans, clibataire sans enfants. Il tient de puis 2 ans une boutique dalimentation gnrale Kpalim, une ville situe environ 120 kilomtres de Lom, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite augmenter la capacit de son commerce avec ce crdit en achetant des sacs de riz, des cartons de savons, laits de sucres et dautres botes de conserves. Ceci fera augmenter ses ventes qui, par ricochet entraneront une augmentation de ses profits.
texts.en:
Yaliou A., 29, is single and has no children. For two years, he has been tending a little general store in Kpalim, a town located about 120 km from Lom, the capital of Togo. He wants to bolster the capacity of his little business with this loan by buying sacks of rice, cases of soap, milk, sugar, and tinned goods. This will increase his sales which will lead to an increase in his profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: buying sacks of rice, cases of soap, milk, sugar, and tinned goods

loan.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a great Mom with two grown children, a husband and a happy family. She has invested much of her life in her most precious endeavor, raising her children. However, she could always successfully balance work and family without any damage to either. That has probably been one the secrets of her success. Olga launched her own venture only 7 years ago. However, she already has about $2000 in inventory. Her net profit is about $500 a month.

Olga is a very reliable client. She has been prompt with all her payments to Nadiya Ukraine and has never had a late payment. Today, as Olga and her husband are both retired, their business provides a stable source of income and security in life. Olga is hoping to continue keeping this business stable. She is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to construct a vending kiosk and increase the assortment of merchandise she offers for retail sale in her stand. She is hoping to keep her business running and bringing her a profit in the future as well.

loan.use: To construct a vending stall

loan.name: Luis Francisco

texts.es:
Luis Francisco inici el negocio porque no alcanza con su sueldo para poder solventar los gastos de sus hijos tanto en sus estudios como en los problemas de salud de dos de ellos. Por lo que se empez a dedicar a reparar pulidoras y aspiradoras, y gracias a esta actividad ha podido sacra adelante a su familia.

El necesita un prstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar herramienta para dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes y as obtener mayor ganancia para el sustento de la familia.
texts.en:
Luis Francisco started his business because he was not able to afford his two children's educational or health care expenses on his salary. This is the reason he began to repair polishing devices and vacuum cleaners. Thanks to this activity, he has been able to help out his family.

Luis needs a loan of $475 to buy tools that will allow him to provide better service to his clients and will therefore increase the contribution he makes toward supporting his family; he will repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy tools.

loan.name: Novinyo Yao

texts.fr: Novinyo Yao E. est g de 42 ans, mari et pre de 5 enfants. Il est revendeur de sodabi , une boisson locale tant apprcie par la population, Kpalim, une ville situe environ 120 kilomtres de Lom, la capitale togolaise. Yao dsire par ce crdit faire de stock en sodabi afin deviter des ruptures de stocks en priode de pnurie. Il compte sur cette opportunit pour gagner sa vie. 200 000 12 mois
texts.en:
Novinyo Yao E., 42, is married and the father of 5 children. He sells "sodabi," a local drink much appreciated by the populace in Kpalim, a town located about 120 km from Lom, the capital of Togo. Yao wants to use this loan to stock up on sodabi so as to avoid running out of it when there is none to be had. He is counting on this opportunity to support himself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying "sodabi" for re-sale

loan.name: Valeryi

texts.en:
Valeryi offers taxi services in Ivano-Frankivsk. He has been working in this sphere of business for 2 years. Valeryi admits he has benefited a lot from financial assistance he has received from Nadiya Ukraine. Currently, his business has grown to the point where he receives about US$ 40-50 daily.
Valeryi is hoping to buy a better and trendier vehicle in the future to offer more high-class services to his clients. At this point he is only saving some money to make his dream come true. Valeryi thinks this 5000 Grivna loan will help him move closer to the fulfillment of his plans. He is hoping to spend this amount on painting the body of his vehicle to give it a fresh look. Some day when he saves enough, he is hoping to buy a newer but affordable vehicle.

loan.use: to paint his car, used as a taxi

loan.name: Eva Alicia

texts.es:
Eva inici el negocio porque su hijo sufri un accidente al caerle agua hirviendo en su cuerpo y deba de costear los gastos del tratamiento ya que su pequeo duro mucho tiempo en el hospital por lo que ella perdi su empleo; movida por las necesidades econmicas ella empez con la venta de perfumes y ropa lo que le ha permitido salir adelante.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercanca nueva y perfumes para el desarrollo del negocio y tener ms ventas. Con tu apoyo Eva saldr adelante.
texts.en:
Eva started her business after her son was scalded in an accident involving boiling water. She had to pay for the cost of treatments for the extended time her young son spent in the hospital. For this reason, Eva lost her job. Driven by financial need, she began to sell perfumes and clothing; this activity has enabled her to improve her situation.

Eva needs a loan of $475 for the purchase of new merchandise and perfumes that will allow her to develop her business and increase sales. She will repay the loan within 6 months. With your help, Eva will succeed in her mission.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise.

loan.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is running a transportation services business in Ivano-Frankivsk. He is married with a teenage daughter who is 16. Sergey has been in this business for 9 years already. He rents a car and uses it to offer taxi rides to his customers. His daily income is about US$ 30-40.

Sergey would like to purchase the vehicle he's renting at this point to be able to manage his time and efforts more efficiently and become full owner of business. We believe Sergey's focused approach to business and his diligent hard work will help him repay this loan on time and expand his business as a result.

loan.use: To purchase a vehicle to use as a taxi

loan.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi T. est revendeuse de pagnes au centre commercial de Kpalim, une ville situe environ 120 kilomtres de Lom, la capitale togolaise. Age de 29 ans, elle est marie et mre de 2 enfants. Elle opre dans ce secteur depuis 5 ans. Akouvi dsire par ce crdit augmenter la capacit de son activit en achetant des balles de pagnes pour la revente. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouvi T. sells "pagnes" (lengths of African print cloth) in the commercial center of Kpalim, a town situated about 120 km from Lom, the capital of Togo. At 29 years old, she is married and the mother of 2 children. She has been working in this sector for 5 years. Akouvi wants to use this loan to bolster her business by buying bales of "pagnes" for re-sale. This will allow her to earn more so as to better support her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of "pagnes" for re-sale

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 26, 2008)

loan.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mnica inici el negocio porque falleci su esposo y se quedo desamparada con tres hijos y necesitaba solventar los gastos del hogar, as como pagarles la escuela y las deudas que le dejo la enfermedad de su esposo y el pago de su casa. Ella se dedic a la venta de ropa nueva y usada y le ha ido bien hasta la fecha.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercanca nueva y seminueva para el desarrollo del negocio y tener ms ventas.
texts.en:
Mnica started a business when she lost her husband and was left with three children and the dilemma of how to pay for houshold expenses. These expenses include her children's schooling costs and the debts resulting from her husband's illness as well as house payments. She began selling new and used clothes and the business has been going well up until now.

Mnica needs a loan of $675 to purchase new and almost-new merchandise for the development of her business and to increase sales; she will repay the loan within six months.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase merchandise.

loan.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa G. est revendeuse de crales au grand march de Kpalim, une ville situe environ 120 kilomtres de Lom, la capitale togolaise. Age de 47 ans, kossiwa est marie et mre de 5 enfants. Elle souhaite par ce crdit sapprovisionner en mas, mil, haricots et arachides. Elle compte sur cette opportunit pour amliorer ses conditions de vie. 100 000 12 mois
texts.en:
Kossiwa G. is a reseller of grains in the central market place at Kpalime, a town located about 120 kliometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. Kossiwa is 47 years old, married and is the mother of five (5) children. She is requesting this loan to purchase corn, millet, beans and peanuts. She expects that this opportunity will improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of sacks of corn, millet, beans, and peanuts

loan.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira inicio el negocio por la falta de dinero y que no le ayudaba el papa de sus hijos con la manutencin de los pequeos. En aquel entonces su necesidad principal era la salud de su hija menor por que tenia pegado el labio con la enca y se necesita una operacin, aunado que tenia que darles de comer a sus hijos y solventar los gastos de la casa. Entonces ella encontr en la venta de zapatos una fuente de ingresos que le permita generar ganancias y no descuidar a sus hijos. A travs del tiempo a adquirido muchos clientes y ha crecido su negocio, no solo separa en los mercados con su carro para vender, sino tambin en su casa vende y ha acondicionado un cuarto para negocio. Ahora sus hijos estn mas tranquilos por que no les falta casi nada y esta juntando para la operacin de su hija,

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar estantes para exhibir sus productos y ms mercanca. Con tu apoyo Elvira saldr adelante.
texts.en:
Elvira started her business for lack of money and because she was not receiving financial support for her children from their father. At that time, her priority was the health of her youngest daughter, who had a deformity and needed an operation, even though she needed to feed her children and pay household expenses, too.

Elvira discovered a source of income in shoe sales, which allowed her to make financial gains without neglecting her children. With time, she has acquired many clients and has grown her business. She not only drives to the market to sell her products, but she has outfitted a room in her house to sell from home. Now, her children are more calm because they lack almost nothing that they need and are facing her daughter's operation together.

Elvira needs a loan in the amount of $400 to purchase shelves to display her products and to buy more merchandise; she will repay the loan in six months. With your help, Elvira can achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy shelves and merchandise.

loan.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla A. est g de 35 ans, mari et pre de 3 enfants. Il est mcanicien Kpalim, un village situ environ 120 kilomtres de Lom, la capitale togolaise. Il dsire par ce crdit acheter des outils de travail pour mieux rpondre aux exigences de la clientle. Il compte sur cette opportunit pour changer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komla A. is 35 years old, married and the father of three (3) children. He is a mechanic in Kpalime, a town located about 120 kilometers from Lom, the Togolese capital. With this loan he would like to buy work tools so that he could better respond to the needs of his customers. He is expecting this opportunity will improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of work tools to respond to the needs of his customers

loan.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
Martha inici el negocio por la falta de trabajo y por que nadie le ayudaba en los gasto de sus hijos y de la casa, ante la necesidad de solventar los gastos del hogar y de sus pequeos ella busco una actividad que le generara ingresos y en su casa empez a vender refrescos y frituras, poco a poco fue creciendo hasta tener una pequea tienda de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar vitrinas y estantes ya que le esta yendo muy bien y quiere tener buena imagen en su tienda.
texts.en:
Martha started her business for lack of a job and because no one was helping her with the costs of raising her kids and paying for her house. Confronted with the necessity of resolving the expenses associated with her home and her small children, she sought an activity that would generate income. From her house, she began to sell refreshments and fried finger foods. The business grew little by little to the point of having a small grocery store.

Martha needs a loan of $950 to be repaid within six months in order to buy display cabinets and shelves; her business is going well and she wants her store to have a good image.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy display cabinets and shelves.

loan.name: Issaka

texts.fr: Issaka M. est g de 33 ans, mari et pre de 2 enfants. Il est revendeur dhuile moteur Kpalim, une ville situe environ 120 kilomtres de Lom, la capitale togolaise. Issaka espre avec ce crdit acheter beaucoup plus de marchandises pour la revente afin de mieux rpondre la demande de ses clients et de gagner aussi plus dargent pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Issaka M. is 33 years old, married and the father of two (2) children. He is a reseller of motor oil in Kpalime, a town situated about 120 kilometers from Lom, the Togolese capital. With his loan Issaka plans to buy much more merchandise for resale so that he can meet the demands of his customers. Also, he will earn more profit to support the needs of his family.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase containers of motor oil for resale.

loan.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra A. tient depuis 3 ans une boutique dalimentation gnrale Kpalim, une ville situe environ 120 kilomtres de Lom, la capitale togolaise. Elle est ge de 55 ans, marie e mre de 5 enfants. Elle espre par ce crdit approvisionner sa boutique en achetant des sacs de riz, des cartons de sucres, de laits et autres botes de conserves. Cet approvisionnement va entraner une augmentation des ventes et par consquent une hausse des gain ; ce qui lui permettra de bien subvenir aux besoins de la famille
texts.en:
For three years, Abra A. has been tending a general store in Kpalim, a town located about 120 km from Lom, the capital of Togo. She is 55, married, and the mother of 5 children. She hopes to use this loan to replenish the inventory of her store by buying sacks of rice, cases of sugar, milk, and other tinned foods. This improved range of goods will lead to increased sales and thus, an increased profit, which will allow her to better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of sacks of rice, cases of sugar, milk, and other tinned goods

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 26, 2008)

loan.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo inici el negocio para poder ayudar a su familia ya que falleci su papa y su hijo mayor naci con problemas de asma. Su principal necesidad era la de mantener a su mam ya que se haba quedado viuda y con hijos pequeos que mantener y pagarles su estudio; adems que su hijo presentaba mayor al momento de su nacimiento presento problemas de bronquitis y asma los cuales se le complicaba muy seguido. El se dedica la compra y venta de llantas negocio que le ha redituado buena ganancias y le ha permitido salir adelante.

El necesita un prstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar ms llantas para el negocio y as hacer crecer las ventas y tener ms ingresos.
texts.en:
Gonzalo started his business to be able to help his family, given that he had lost his father, and because his oldest son was born with asthma problems. His primary concern was to support his widowed mother, who had young children to care for, and to pay for their school. Additionally, his son demonstrated breathing problems from birth in the form of bronchitis and asthma; the complications soon worsened. Gonzalo works in the purchase and sale of tires, a business that has brought him good earnings and has allowed him to get ahead.

Gonzalo needs a loan of $400 to be repaid within 6 months to purchase more tires for his business and thereby increase sales and have more income.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase merchandise.

loan.name: Nogaye

texts.fr: Ngone N. est ne le 01 janvier 1954 Bambey.Elle habite au quartier DVF.Elle s'active dans le commerce d'pices depuis plus d'un an.elle a sollicit ce pret pour renforcer son Activit.
texts.en:
Ngone N. was born on January 1, 1954 in Bambey. She lives in the DVF district. She has been working in the trade of spices for more than a year. She requested this loan to strengthen her business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Sale of Spices

loan.name: Lesbia Elvira

texts.en:
Lesbia Elvira F. Martnez 37 years old Q3665,- / $500 This is the story of a young woman who, just as so many others, struggles to find her way in life. Perhaps more than for others, her work plays a major role in helping her find her life's direction. This woman is called Lesbia and she lives in the Guatemalan City Prison called Santa Teresa.

I get the opportunity to meet with Lesbia when I accompanied Sergio Roberto Gonzalez, the director of FAPE, on a special day organised by FAPE to teach the women how to run a business. Entering the prison is relatively easy, and the two stamps on my arm ensure that I can rejoin the outside world. Obviously for the women here, it is another story. This facility is a place where most of the inmates await their trial. The slow process of the courts means that some of them have been waiting for more than four years. Sitting together in the prison's enclosed patio area, we begin our chat and Lesbia tells me that she has been there for four years and one month.

Before she began her time in this facility, Lesbia was living in Guatemala City. Her family is from a nearby area called San Miguel Petpa. She is trained as a teacher and has a 20-year-old brother.

In prisons in Guatemala, like many other developing countries, authorities supply only the most basic essentials. Beyond shelter, food and water, the standard of a prisoner's life depends on what their family can provide them with. Items such as clothing, books, and toiletries are all given by the inmate's families. Because Lesbia's mother is ill at the moment and cannot visit her, she has no one but herself to rely on.

Living circumstances within the prison are far from easy. The women live in a single room with 24 other inmates. The beds are made out of concrete. In order to give a semblance of privacy, the prisoners hang sheets between adjacent beds giving each woman has a solitary square metre of her own. Currently there are about 225 people live in the facility.

Last year, students from the University Rafael Landivar (URL) came to the prison and to teach interested inmates how to run a small business. There were courses given in all kinds of business related subjects, such as credit control, writing a business plan, etc. Inspired by the course, Lesbia decided to make all kinds of small decorative items for books and pens by hand. These charming products gave an outlet to Lesbia's talents and a focus to her life while incarcerated. But it has become more than that now.

The course organisers successfully petitioned the facility to allow inmates that performed very well in the course the chance to sell their wares at a market stall in the university for a day. Lesbia was one of those chosen. She tells me with pride how she was able to sell all of her goods, and that it proved to her how well her business could perform in the outside world. The experience has inspired her to pursue her entrepreneurial dream and more than just a distraction from her mundane existence in jail.

In the picture, Lesbia is holding a big bag of her products that she hopes to sell at a local church. I am amazed when she mentions to me that it has taken her only two days to produce so many items. There's nothing else to do in prison, she admits; there are no books, no televisions, and so days are very long there. She focuses her entire life upon her business. In order to work in the evening times, Lesbia had to seek special permission for the use of a lamp. She's even allowed to own a scissors, a necessary item for her work. Privileges like these are only available to women that show that they are dedicated entrepreneurs and participate in all of the offered social programs.

Lesbia initially sold her products to friends that came to visit her in jail. However, since the facility recognises Lesbia's responsible behaviour, they now approve her non-family visitors more readily. This has proved very useful, as Lesbia is now able to use these visits to send out her products to clients as well as to receive materials. Many of her suppliers she has never met in person, only over the phone. It is certainly a challenge to run her business from this facility, but she is able to manage.

Before her business, Lesbia didn't believe that she was very creative. Now, however, she actively seeks out inspiration for new product designs wherever she can. Some of these designs shall be part of the new selection of products that she hopes will be ready in time for Christmas. Lesbia realises very well that her customers like her products, but in order to maintain their interest, she needs to offer them something new and keep her products fresh. A brilliant commercial thinker, if you ask me.

I ask Lesbia if there is something that she wants me to write in her story, and she tells me that she wants to thank FAPE for giving her this life-changing opportunity. She tells me how she knows that funding women in prison may have been seen as a risky investment and that FAPE was the only organisation who thought it worthwhile. Having FAPE believe in them has given her back a large part of her dignity and self esteem.

Towards the end of our interview, when I ask Lesbia about what her dreams are, she becomes a little emotional. She explains to me how being in prison can change a person's way of thinking. She feels that she has grown, spiritually and as a person. Her biggest wish now is to be able to have a little shop somewhere in the city where she can sell not only her own products, but also the products of people that find themselves in situations similar to the ones that she herself faced. Her experiences have taught her much about herself, she tells me, and she hopes that the lessons that she has learned she will be able to teach to others. This is what she is working for now: the new life she wants to build after prison and the credit will help her with this!

loan.use: To buy materails for making handicrafts.

loan.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa A. is 50 years old, married and the mother of five children, two of whom are currently in school. For the last 12 years, she has made a living and supported her family by selling grocery products and yams. She says business is slow because she lacks enough money to buy supplies. That's why she has applied for a loan to increase her inventory. She believes the loan will help her increase her savings and provide for her last two children, who are now in school. She is a member of the group called Partners. Members agree to support one another to repay the loan.

loan.use: To buy more products like tin fish, canned tomatoes, cocoa, skimmed milk and body pomade.

loan.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert N. is a 55 year old businessman who sells hardwares. He is married with six children, who are all currently in school. Robert is very hardworking and provides for his family's daily needs. He sells items like radio sets, batteries, touch lights, screwdrivers, machine oil, door locks, and lanterns in Dunkwa, where he lives with his family. He also supports his wife's business selling used clothing, which helps provide for the family.

With this loan, he wants to purchase more goods in order to increase sales. He hopes to rent a container shop that can accommodate all his products. This will ease his cost movements and risk of theft. He is a member of the community group called Anointed Trust Group. In this group, Members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loan.use: To purchase more stock of hardwares to sell.

loan.name: Ataa

texts.en:
Ataa P. is in business in the local market of Dunkwa, a suburb of Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is a 46-year-old woman, married with six children who are currently in school. She is a busy petty trader who sells tomatoes, spices and other vegetables on top of a table in the market. Ataa says the sale of vegetables provides her with income to put food on the table for her family. However, she does not have sufficient working capital to run the business well and this retards her business progress.

She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loan.use: To purchase tomatoes, spices, vegetable oil, etc. for re-sale

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 26, 2008)

loan.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 24 years old. She is married and has a little child. To support her household, she has been selling foodstuffs like maize, plantains, beans, groundnuts, and gari in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She enjoys selling foodstuffs and takes pride in serving her customers.

Alberta says the sale of these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make a good income to support her family. Alberta is a member of the group called Anointed Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan

loan.use: To buy food stuffs like maize, plantains, groundnuts, gari, and beans for re-sale

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 26, 2008)

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary H. is a 44 year old widow and mother of four children. From the income she's earned from her business, Mary has been able to support all her children in completing high school.

She is a petty trader who sells vegetables and fruit in the local market and she enjoys selling goods. Mary has good customer care and because of that many customers buy from her stand. However, she buys her supplies on credit at relatively high prices due to lack of adequate working capital.

With this loan, she wants to purchase supplies of vegetables, salt, and fruit in bulk to better serve her customers. She belongs to the community group called Progress Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay their loans.

loan.use: To purchase vegetables, salt, and fruit in bulk.

loan.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is thirty-nine years old. She is married with five kids, of whom two have successfully completed high school and the other three are still in schooling. Ellen enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her kids.

Ellen owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. However, she is constrained by low capital from making meaningful progress. She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to make increased profits. She believes with her good customer relations, the loan will enable her to realize her dream. She is a member of the community group called Esther Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and assist one another to repay the loan.

loan.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loan.name: Sopey Saliou Tour Group

texts.fr: La communaut rurale de ndoulo est situ dans l'covillage Keur Goumak (http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php). Comme le village a souffert de longues annes de scheresse et dsertifictation, les femmes se sont constitues en groupement pour s'activer dans les travaux de petit commerce. L'activit repose sur la capacit du Groupement acheter des denres de premire ncessit (des sacs de mil, tablettes de Maggi, des sachets de lait en poudre, bidons dhuile, des cartons de savons, des sacs de sucre, des sacs de riz, des paquets de biscuits) au moment o les prix sont trs bas sur le march et de les stocker. Se faisant, elles vont satisfaire la demande en organisant la redistribution vente continue pendant toute lanne au niveau des marchs hebdomadaires, des communauts rurales voisines, tout en vitant les ruptures de stock de ces produits.
texts.en:
The rural community of Ndoulo is located in the Keur Goumak ecovillage (http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php). Since the village has suffered from many years of drought and desertification, the women grouped themselves together to start small businesses. The group's business consists of buying essential food products (bags of millet, Maggi cubes, dried milk sachets, cans of oil, cartons of soap, bags of sugar and rice, and boxes of biscuits) when the market prices are very low, and storing them. Once this is done, they will be able to meet the demands by organizing a continued redistribution sale year round at weekly markets and neighbouring rural communities, while avoiding stock shortages of these products.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase and sale of consumer products

loan.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Delia es casada, tiene 37 aos y 5 hijos, Delia viaja a dos ferias de la regin como Pampamarca que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho y Trigopampa que se ubica a 1 hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde Delia vende ropa variada, verduras y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, que luego de acopiar vende a los comerciantes de los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Delia necesita un prstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que ser invertido en la compra de chompas, pantalones, casacas. Delia suea con tener una tienda en su casa, tener capital propio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Delia is a partner in the Rainbow Communal Bank.

Delia is 37 years old and married, with five children. She travels to two regional markets: one is in Pampamarca, two hours away from Ayacucho and the other is in Trigopampa, one hour away from Ayacucho. Delia sells a variety of clothing and vegetables at the market and buys grains and cheese. She later sells these to local merchants in Ayacucho.

Delia needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll use to buy sweaters, pants, and jackets. Delia dreams of having a store in her home, of having capital of her own, and of her children growing up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Delia needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll use to buy sweaters, pants, and jackets.

loan.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena F. is 24 years old. She is a wife and the mother of one kid who is now schooling. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her daily source of livelihood. She has been selling yams for the past seven years to support her family. Yams are one of the favorite staple foods that supply carbohydrate components in diets.

Abena takes delivery from farmers who provide her with a direct supply. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and re-sell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk to better serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kid in school. Abena is a member of a community group called Dorcas Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loan.use: To purchase more yams directly from the farmers

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loan.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Victoria es separada, tiene 43 aos y 3 hijos, Victoria vive en una casa alquilada en el barrio de Wari Accopampa, Victoria viaja a 5 ferias de la regin, en das distintos, en donde vende mantas, abarrotes variados y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, que luego de acopiar traslada a la ciudad de Ayacucho y lo vende a los comerciantes de los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Victoria necesita un prstamo de 2000 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra de mantas, azcar, arroz, fideos. Los sueos de Victoria son que sus hijos sean profesionales mejores que ella, mejorar su negocio y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Victoria is a partner in the Rainbow Communal Bank.

Victoria is 43 years old and separated, with three children. She lives in a home that she rents in the Wari Accopampa neighborhood. Victoria travels to five different markets in the region, each on a different day. She sells blankets and various groceries at the markets, and buys grains and cheese, which she brings back to Ayacucho. Victoria then sells these products to the local merchants of Ayacucho.

Victoria needs a loan of 2000 soles which she'll use to buy blankets, sugar, rice, and noodles. Victoria dreams of her children growing up to be better professionals than herself, of improving her business and of owning her own home.


Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Victoria needs a loan of 2000 soles which she'll use to buy blankets, sugar, rice, and noodles.

loan.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Rayda es casada, tiene 32 aos y 3 hijos, Rayda viaja a la feria Sallalli que esta a 3 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho y Niobamba que queda a 2 horas, Rayda vende abarrotes surtidos y de las ferias compra cereales, quesos y animales que beneficia en su casa y lo vende de casa en casa. Adems Rayda en los das que no viaja a las ferias vende comida por las noches en el estadio cercano a su casa en el barrio de Cuchipampa.

Rayda necesita un prstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que ser invertido en la compra de quesos, animales menores. Los sueos de Rayda son salir adelante con sus hijos, mejorar su casa y brindar una buena educacin a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rayda is a partner in the Rainbow Communal Bank.

Rayda is 32 years old and married, with three children. She travels to the Sallalli market, which is three hours away from Ayacucho, and Niobamba market, which is two hours away. At the markets, Rayda sells groceries and buys grains, cheeses, and livestock. She keeps some of these for her home, and sells the rest door to door. On the days that Rayda doesn't go to the markets, she spends her evenings selling food in the stadium near her home, in the Cuchipampa neighborhood.

Rayda needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll use to buy cheese and small animals.

Rayda dreams of getting ahead with her children, improving her home, and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Rayda needs a loan of 1000 soles which she'll use to buy cheese and small livestock.

loan.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Elena es casada, tiene 43 aos y 4 hijos, Elena tiene una tienda muy surtida en su casa ubicada en el barrio Wari Accopampa, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, cereales, frutas, carnes, especeras que ella prepara por las tardes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija y tambin de un personal. Adems Elena tiene cabinas de Internet que esta ubicado al frente de su tienda en un local alquilado y esta atendido por un personal.

Elena necesita un prstamo de 3000 soles dinero que fue invertido en la compra de arroz, azcar, fideo, aceite. Elena suea con seguir adelante, ampliar su negocio, brindar una buena educacin a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elena is a partner in the Rainbow Communal Bank.

Elena is 43 years old and married, with four children. She owns a well-stocked grocery store, where she sells vegetables, grains, fruits, meats, and fresh spices. She prepares the spices every afternoon with her daughter and an employee. Elena's store is located in her home in the Wari Accopampa neighborhood. She also runs an internet cafe, located in a rented space across the street. The internet cafe is tended to by an employee.

Elena needs a loan of 3000 soles, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and cooking oil.

Elena dreams of getting ahead, expanding her business, and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Elena needs a loan of 3000 soles, which was invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, and cooking oil.

loan.name: Ana Jacinta

texts.es:
Ana, D. 40 aos D. edad, socia del Banco Comunal Virgen D. Asuncin D. Carhuaz, espera tener un restaurante ms amplio donD. pueda atender a ms clientes, ya que tiene L. ayuda D. su esposo como cocinero y el apoyo D. sus 5 hijos adolescentes.
DesD. hace 6 aos, el restaurante Las Delicias sirve a diversos comensales en L. ciudad D. Carhuaz, departamento D. Ancash y es atendido por los hijos D. Ana, quienes cumplen labores D. meseros.
Con el prstamo D. S/ 200, el cual pagar en 4 meses, comprar sacos D. arroz, y D. azcar, 1 caja D. aceite y con lo dems pagar L. academia preuniversitaria D. su segundo hijo.
texts.en:
Ana is 40 years old and is a member of the community bank Virgen D. Asuncin D. Carhuaz. She hopes to have a bigger restaurant where she would be able to serve more clients. She already has a restaurant with the help of her spouse as a chef and the help of her five adolescent children. For the past 6 years, the restaurant Las Delicias has served diverse food in the city of Carhuaz, in the department of Ancash. It is attended by Anas children, who work as waiters. With this loan of S/ 200, which she would repay in 4 months, she would buy sacks of rice and sugar, 1 box of oil and with the rest she would pay for a college-prep academy for her second son.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loan.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Cusi Urpi que significa Palomita Feliz en quechua.

Esther es casada, tiene 45 aos y 3 hijo. Esther tiene un cafetn ubicado dentro del local de un instituto superior de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Esther vende golosinas, galletas, gaseosas y comida, el horario de atencin es desde las 7 de la maana hasta las 7 de la noche, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de un personal. Adems Esther los das sbados y Domingos viaja a las ferias de la regin donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias compra cereales que vende a los comerciantes de los mercados.

Esther necesita un prstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que ser invertido en la compra de gaseosas, arroz y azcar. Esther suea con ampliar su negocio, tener una casa comercial mayorista y brindar una buena educacin a su hijo.
texts.en:
Esther is a partner in the Cusi Urpi Communal Bank. Cusi Urpi means "A Happy Approval" in Quechua.

Esther is 45 years old and married, with three children. She has a small cafe locted on a college campus in Ayacucho, where she sells sweets, cookies, sodas, and food. Esther's cafe is open from 7am to 7pm, and she has an employee who helps her in the cafe. On Saturdays and Sundays Esther travels to regional markets where she sells groceries and buys grains, which she later sells to local merchants.

Esther needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll use to buy sodas, rice, and sugar. Esther dreams of expanding her cafe, owning a wholesale business, and providing a good education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Esther needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll use to buy sodas, rice, and sugar.

loan.name: Hannah

texts.en:
For the past eleven years, Hannah A. has been trading in the local market of Obuasi in Ghana. She is a fifty year-old woman, married with three children who at school.

Hannah is busy trader who sells yams and fish on top of a table in the local market. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital. She therefore wants this loan to buy more tubers of yams and fresh fish to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children's education.

She belongs to the trust group called Dorcas Trust Group. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling the repayment.

loan.use: To buy yam and dried fish in bulk.

loan.name: Basilica Ortencia

texts.es:
Baslica, de 44 aos de edad, socia del Banco Comunal Seor de Martha II suea con tener un local propio donde pueda vender anticuchos, pancitas, rachis a los clientes que ha ganado desde hace 18 aos. Tiene 3 hijos y vive junto a su esposo, el cual es profesor.
Su domicilio est ubicado en el jirn Julin de Morales N 618 en la ciudad de Huaraz, al cual tambin lo utiliza como centro de trabajo. Todas las tardes sale a su puerta con una carpa y se establece para expender los anticuchos que ella misma prepara horas antes.
Salir a vender siendo profesora fue mi mas grande reto que por los prejuicios mucha gente me observaba con recelo afirma.
Con el prstamo de S/.200, el cual pagar en 4 meses, comprar un baln de gas y dar un adelanto para su nueva parrilla.
texts.en:
Baslica is 44 years old; she is a member of the Communal Bank "Seor de Martha II". She dreams of owning her own shop where she can sell kebabs, tripe, 'rachis' to the clients she has earned over the course of 18 years. She has three children and lives with her husband, who is a professor. Her home is located on Julin de Morales street, Number 618 in the city of Huaraz. She also uses her home as her workplace. Every afternoon, she sets a tent next to her front door and sells the kebabs that she makes herself hours beforehand. She says that "to go out and sell while being a teacher was her greatest challenge since people with prejudices looked down upon her". With this loan of $75 USD, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy a gas canister and will make a downpayment on her new grill.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase a new gas canister and make a downpayment on a new grill

loan.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena, de 32 aos de edad, socia del banco comunal Unin Pedregal, quisiera que su negocio creciera ms, ya que junto a su conviviente se dedican hace cuatro aos a la venta de hamburguesas y sndwich en un pequeo local en el jirn la mar, una zona cntrica de la ciudad de Huaraz.
Elena prepara los insumos y con la ayuda de su hija de 14 aos, quien cuida a su hermanito menor, se dedican a este negocio.
El prstamo de S/. 500, el cual pagar en 4 meses, implementar el negocio comprando embutidos al por mayor y sillas para ambientar mejor el local.
texts.en:
Elena is 32 years old and is a member of the communal bank Union Pedregal. For four years, she and her partner have been selling hamburgers and sandwiches in a small stall in jiron la mar, a central neighborhood in the city of Huaraz. Her hope is to expand her business.

Elena prepares the ingredients with the help of her 14 year old daughter who also takes care of her younger brother. The loan of $175 - which she will pay in four months - will be used to purchase meats and to purchase chairs to improve the environment of business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of meats and chairs for restaurant.

loan.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris K. is a 38-year-old woman who is divorced and has two children in school. Doris works very hard to provide food for herself and her children.
Doris has four years of experience selling goods, such as ladies' bags, shoes, materials and other footwear, in a market center at Obuasi, Ghana. She believes that, with her good human relations skills, and her proximity to the market area, the loan would help her to purchase the right quantity of goods demanded by her loyal customers. She says this would help her make more profit to expand her business and also finance her children's education.
Doris K. is a member of the Prince trust group. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment. Her picture was taking when she was visited at her shop.

loan.use: To buy more women shoes, bags, slippers, cloths and materials.

loan.name: Elidia Santa

texts.es:
Elidia, de 37 aos de edad, socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Asuncin de Carhuaz, espera tener una tienda de venta de regalos en Carhuaz para poder mantener mejor a sus dos hijos, ya que su conviviente gana muy poco en los trabajos temporales que tiene.
Elidia vende abarrotes en una tiendita al frente del Hospital de Carhuaz, en el Jr. Unin 230 en el departamento de Ancash. Los das viernes lleva productos a la capital (Lima) donde vende de manera ambulatoria y es en estos das que sus hijos se encargan del negocio.
Con el prstamo de S/ 1,700, el cual pagar en 8 meses, comprar 2 sacos de arroz , 2 sacos de azcar y tambin lo invertir en comprar productos de la zona para llevar a la ciudad de Lima.
texts.en:
Elidia is 37 years old and is a member of the comunal bank Virgen de Asuncin de Carhuaz. Her hope is to have a gifts store in Carhuaz in order to better support her children since her partner does not earn much in his seasonal jobs.

Elidia sells groceries in a small store facing the Carhuaz hospital. On Fridays, when she travels to Lima to sell her products as a street vendor, her children take care of the business.

With this loan of $575 - which she will pay in eight months - she will purchase two sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar and she will also invest in purchasing products to sell in Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase rice, sugar and other products.

loan.name: Elisa Benjamina

texts.es:
Elisa, de 49 aos de edad, socia del Banco Comunal Unin Pedregal, suea con tener un negocio propio, como un restaurante.
Debido a que ella realiza actividades en su barrio, la venta de alimentos como las tamaladas, polladas y otros, beneficia en parte a su familia, a pesar de contar con ingresos que genera su esposo, tambin (su esposo) colabora junto a sus tres menores hijos con la realizacin de este negocio.
Elena prepara los alimentos en su casa, el cual est ubicada en el barrio de pedregal alto en la ciudad de Huaraz, luego lo distribuye a pedido de los clientes. La mayor dificultad est en que a veces los clientes no le pagan a tiempo, pero an as, ella espera tener un local donde pueda tener un negocio de servicio de restaurante.
Con el prstamo de S/. 500, el cual pagar en 4 meses, invertir en insumos para sus polladas, platos y tenedores descartables que lo almacenar para las prximas actividades.
texts.en:
Elisa is 49 years old and is a member of the communal bank Union Pedregal. Her dream is to have her own restaurant.

She works selling food such as tamaladas and polladas in her neighborhood in order to benefit her family. Even though they count on her husbands income, her husband and her three small children also help Elisa with her business.

Elisa prepares the food in her home which is located in the pedregal alto neighborhood in the city of Huaraz. She then distributes her clients orders. Her biggest difficulty is that her clients sometimes do not pay her in time. Even so, she hopes to be able to have her own business space where she can establish a restaurant.

With this $175 loan - which she will repay in four months - she will purchase ingredients for her polladas, plates and disposable forks.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of ingredients for her buisiness.

loan.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
Lastenia, de 56 aos de edad, socia del Banco Comunal Seor de Cautivo II de Huaraz, manifiesta tener muchos altibajos en su negocio, pero a pesar de ello sigue adelante ya que L. venta en su bodega le permite colaborar con el sostn del hogar junto a su esposo, que es profesor en una Institucin Educativa estatal.
Por 21 aos, L. seora Lastenia ha sabido mantener el negocio de venta de abarrotes, ofreciendo a sus clientes todos los productos de primera calidad, mas bien debido al alza actual que han sufrido todos los alimentos, se ha visto en L. necesidad de solicitar un financiamiento.
Con el prstamo de S/ 300, el cual pagar en 4 meses, comprar un saco de azcar, un saco de arroz y dos cajas de leche, los cuales le servirn para implementar el negocio.
A pesar que ya ha pasado mucho tiempo desde que perdi a sus padres, elL. an considera que fue su peor momento y espera que su nico hijo de 15 aos no sufra ese dolor.
texts.en:
Lastenia is 56 years old and is a member of the communal bank Seor de Cautivo II in Huaraz. In spite of the many ups and downs in her business, she has been successful and the sales in her store allow her to contribute to the support of her family. Her husband is a professor in a state educational institution.

Lastenia has had her business selling groceries for 21 years. She offers her clients first rate products. With the increase in the price of food she has been forced to look for a loan. With the loan of $100 - which she will repay in four months - she will buy a sack of sugar, a sack of rice and two boxes of milk.

Even though it has been a long time since she lost her parents, she still considers that to be her worst moment and she hopes that her only son who is 15 years old will not suffer that pain.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, milk, etc.

loan.name: Lorenza Maria

texts.es:
Lorenza, de 40 aos de edad, socia del Banco Comunal Virgen De Asuncin de Carhuaz, le gustara comprar chacras y sembrar maz en grandes cantidades para poder distribuir a los mayoristas que llevan el choclo a la capital.
Lorenza es conviviente y tiene seis hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos depende de ella ya que los otros se han ido de su casa, son independientes y tienen sus propias familias.
Lorenza se dedica a la venta de verduras, que con ayuda de sus tres menores hijos, trata de sacar adelante el negocio, el cual se encuentra ubicado en las puertas del mercado modelo de Carhuaz.
Con el prstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagar en 6 meses, comprar choclo de la chacra y lo vender al por mayor, ya que con 12 aos de experiencia ella tiene clientes fijos.
texts.en:
Lorenza is 40 years old, and is a member of the "Virgen De Asuncin de Carhuaz" Communal Bank. She would like to buy a farm and plant maize in large quantities to distribute to wholesalers who take the corn to the capital. Lorenza lives with her partner and has six children, 3 of whom depend on her support; the others have left home, are independent and have their own families. Located at the front of the Carhuaz market, Lorenza sells vegetables with the help of her three younger children while trying to advance the business. The loan of S/. 1,000 that she will pay in 6 months, it will buy corn that she will then sell at wholesale; with 12 years of experience she has many regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase corn from farms

loan.name: Fagarou Group

texts.fr: Le Groupement FAGAROU situ dans l'covillage(http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php) est un groupe de petits vendeurs au dtail trs dynamique qui tournent dans la priphrie des grands marchs hebdomadaires. Avec le contexte conomique trs marqu par une anne hivernale dont les prvisions sont en baisse en terme production agricole ; un systme de vente de proximit dans le milieu rural et pri-urbain peut rapporter beaucoup de bnfices. Avec ce prt, ils pourront acheter et vendre et des produits comme l'arachide, le riz et le mil suivant les opportunits des marchs de la rgion du centre. Ce qui leur permettra non seulement de satisfaire la demande, mais aussi de renforcer leur stock, diversifier leurs produits, gnrer des revenus pour les membres en vue d'une garantie d'une activit durable.
texts.en:
The FAGAROU group, located in an ecovillage (http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php), is a group of very dynamic small-retail salespeople who work on the periphery of large weekly markets. With an economic situation affected by a winter year whose forecasts are poor in terms of agricultural production; a system of sale in proximity to rural and peri-urban environments can bring back many benefits. With this loan, they will be able to buy and sell products such as peanuts, rice and millet and take advantage of the central region's markets. This will not only enable them to satisfy the demand, but also to build their stock, diversify their products, and generate income for the group's members with a goal of securing a long-term business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase and sale of foodstuffs

loan.name: Dialki Djigue Group

texts.fr: Dans le cadre de la lutte contre la pauvret, les femmes de notre groupement pour amliorer la qualit de leur vie ont dcid de s'adonner des activits gnratrices de revenus en demandant un prt Kiva. Cette activit est la vente de fruits (pastques, oranges, manques etc.) et lgumes (carottes, choux, patates, courges, etc..) que nous rcoltons de nos champs et allons vendre dans les marchs hebdomadaires qui regroupent des milliers de personnes mais aussi de transporter notre marchandise vers d'autres horizons d'o venir les vendre en ville particulirement Dakar l o le besoin se fait sentir le plus.
texts.en:
In the fight against poverty, the women of our group, in order to improve their quality of life, decided to devote themselves to businesses in applying for a loan at Kiva. This business is in selling fruits (watermelons, oranges, mangoes, etc.) and vegetables (carrots, cabbages, potatoes, squash, etc.) that we harvest from our fields and either go to sell in weekly markets where thousands gather or take it elsewhere to sell in the city, especially in Dakar, where there is great need.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to sell fruits an vegetables

loan.name: Dental Group

texts.fr: Le GIE Dental de Kael est localis Mback dans la rgion de Diourbel (http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php). Il est constitu de cinq membres dont deux femmes. Le GIE a pour but le dveloppement socio-conomique de ses membres. Ses principales activits sont le commerce, llevage, lembouche bovine.Le projet dembauche bovine se situe en ligne droite des activits du Groupement. Le GIE fait le commerce de buf, de mouton, de chvre dans la zone de Mback. Chaque jour de march hebdomadaire, un membre prospecte les bonnes affaires, achte le btail et celui-ci est vendu sur dautres marchs notamment dans les villes comme Mback. Cette activit est trs lucrative mais le volant dargent disponible comme fonds de roulement limite les capacits du Groupement dans son commerce de btail. Lopportunit quoffre Kiva dans le cadre du micro-crdit devra permettre de renforcer le fonds de roulement et financer lachat de plus de moutons et de bufs.
texts.en:
The Economic Interest Group, Dental, of Kael, is located in Mback in the Diourbel region (http://www.sem-fund.org/keurgumaggfr.php). It consists of five members of which two are women. The goal of the Economic Interest Group is the socio-economic development of its members. Its principal businesses are in the commerce, raising, and fattening of cattle. This project is line with the associations businesses. The Economic Interest Group does its business in ox, sheep, and goats in the Mback area. Every day at the weekly market, one member prospects good deals, buys the livestock and sells it at other markets, especially in cities like Mback. This business is very lucrative but the funds available as working capital limit the capacity of the association in its livestock business. The opportunity that Kiva offers in the realm of microcredit should help reinforce the working capital and finance the purchase of more sheep and ox.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: raising cattle

loan.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mara, tiene 61 aos de edad, socia del Banco Comunal Seor de Martha II, que a pesar de su edad desea tener un puesto para poder vender todas las polleras (vestimenta tpica de la regin), aunque afirma que la salud ya no le permite coser como antes lo haca. Su esposo la abandon con sus 4 hijas pequeas. Vive en el malecn norte del Ro Quillcay s/n, distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz. En dicho lugar elabora afanosamente los trajes tpicos, elaborando mandiles, fustanes y polleras.
Mara logr crecer en el negocio. Ha comprado cuatro mquinas de coser y una remalladora que ahora, con tristeza, no sabe quin utilizar sus herramientas ya que ninguna de sus hijas ha deseado practicar su oficio. Los jueves vende en la av. Raymondi, los das de feria vende en la ciudad de Huaraz.
Con el prstamo de S/. 300, el cual pagar en cuatro meses, adquirir telas, blondas y ovillos para continuar la produccin.
texts.en:
Maria, is 61 years old, a member of the "Seor de Martha II" Communal Bank. Despite her age she wants to have a stand to be able to sell all her skirts (traditional regional clothing), although she says her health no longer allows her to sew as she did before. Her husband abandoned her and left her with 4 small daughters. She lives on the jetty north of Ro Quillcay, in the Independence District, in the Province of Huaraz. In that place she painstakingly makes traditional attire, aprons, slips and skirts. Maria managed to grow the business. She has purchased four sewing machines and an overlock. Sadly enough, she does not know who will use her tools as none of her daughters wanted to practice her craft. Thursdays she sells on Raymondi Avenue, on fair days she sells in the city of Huaraz. With a loan of S /. 300, which will be repaid in four months, she will acquire fabrics, lace and yarn to continue production.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase fabric, lace, yarn, etc.

loan.name: Marina Florentina

texts.es:
Marina, de 45 aos de edad, socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Asuncin de Carhuaz, junto a su esposo, el cual es chofer y radica en la ciudad de Lima por motivos de trabajo, busca hacer crecer a sus dos nicas hijas, que ambas sean profesionales y puedan enfrentar a la vida con xito. Vive en malecn norte, distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.
Marina es nombrada en el hospital de Carhuaz en el rea de contabilidad. En las tardes se dedica a tejer los pedidos de los clientes desde hace 23 aos en su casa donde vive con sus hijas.
Con el prstamo de S/.1,000, el cual pagar en 6 meses, implementar su pequeo negocio comprando lanas al por mayor y otra parte ser destinada para pagar la academia preuniversitaria de su hija.
texts.en:
Marina, 45 years old, is a member of the Virgen of Asuncin de Carhuaz village bank with her husband. He is a taxi driver and lives in Lima for work purposes. She hopes to raise both of her daughters to be professionals who can be successful in life. She lives in the northern district of Independence, in the province of Huaraz, Ancash, Peru. Marina works in the Carhuaz hospital in the accounting department. For the past 23 years, she has spent the afternoons weaving the orders of her customers in the house where she lives with her daughters. With this $350 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will grow her business by purchasing wholesale wool, while the rest will go towards paying for her daughters pre-university tuition.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of wholesale wool

loan.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Jose V., mi unico trabajo desde nio es y ha sido la zapateria, tengo 3 aos de tener mi propio taller, esto me ayuda a salir adelante con mis hijos, actualmente necesito tener una mayor produccion de zapatos ya que las exigencias de mis clientes son grandes, pero no tengo el capital para poder comprar mas materia prima, por tal razon necesito una ayuda para poder salir adelante con mi negocio y con mis hijos. gracias
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Jose V.; my only job since I was a child has been that of a cobbler. For the past 3 years, I have worked in my own workshop which helps me to move forward with my children. Currently, I need to increase my shoe production since I have many orders from my customers, but I dont have the necessary capital to purchase more raw materials. This is why I need financial assistance in order to grow my business and take care of my children. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of raw materials for the repair and manufacture of shoes

loan.name: Noa Aalia

texts.es:
Noa, de 28 aos de edad, socia del Banco Comunal Unin Pedregal, quisiera tener un negocio independiente, talvez una boutique, donde pueda atender a los clientes y as poder tener ms ingresos. Tiene una hijita pequea, junto a su conviviente cubren los gastos de la casa, aunque ella maneja los ingresos que le proporciona el negocio. Vive en Jr. Ins Huaylas, distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.
Aunque es profesora de profesin, no lo ejerce y es por esta razn que desde hace tres aos se dedica a la venta de ropa y tambin a la venta de abarrotes en la casa de su madre. La ropa que ella vende lo trae de Lima y lo distribuye a clientes fijos, aunque lo ms difcil, como ella menciona, es cobrar, porque muchas veces los clientes se demoran en pagar.
Con el prstamo de S/.500, el cual pagar en 4 meses, comprar pantalones, jeans, blusas, chompas y casacas que ya los clientes les han pedido.
texts.en:
Noa, 28 years old, is a member of the Unin Pedregal village bank. She would like to have an independent business locale, perhaps a boutique, where she can attend to customers more easily and improve her income. She has one small daughter and together with her partner, they are able to pay the family expenses, though she manages the finances of her small business. She lives on Ines Huaylas Street, in the province of Huaraz, Ancash, Peru. Though she is a teacher by profession, she does not currently work in that arena and for the past three years, she has worked selling clothing and groceries in her mothers home. She brings the clothing she sells from Lima and she distributes it to her fixed customers; though her customers are fixed, she still finds it difficult to collect her payments as often the customers are slow in paying. With this $175 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase pants, jeans, blouses, sweaters, and jackets that her customers have ordered.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of pants, jeans, blouses, sweaters, jackets, etc.

texts.es:
Rosa, de 37 aos de edad, socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Asuncin de Carhuaz, suea con tener un recreo campestre para poder atender y tener ms clientes. Ella junto a su esposo intentan sacar adelante a sus seis hijos menores. Vive en Jr. Unin s/n, distrito y provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash.
Despus de la muerte de su prima hermana, a quien ella vio como una hija, intenta salir adelante de las diversas dificultades que le presenta la vida, como cuando su esposo ingres a la crcel por una calumnia y luego fue absuelto, el que su ltima hija de un ao es muy enfermiza. Pone ahora sus fuerzas en la venta de comida en un puesto del mercado modelo de Carhuaz. Ella junto a dos ayudantes prepara la comida desde hace un ao, su esposo, que es albail de oficio, la ayuda los das domingos donde tiene ms clientes.
Con el prstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual pagar en 8 meses, comprar gaseosas al por mayor, servilletas y cambiar sus sillas que no la tiene en uso.
texts.en:
Rosa is thirty-seven years old and is a member of the Community Bank Virgen de Asunsion de Carhuaz. She dreams of rustic playground to meet and make many friends. She along with her husband are trying to raise their six little children in Jr. Union s/n, District and Province of Carhuaz, in the village of Ancash.

After the death of her cousin, whom she treated as a daughter, Rosa was intent on breaking away from all the adversities presented to her life, like when her husband was jailed for slander then later acquitted, or when their youngest daughter was very sick last year. Now they are putting all their energy towards the sale of meals in the Model Market at Carhuaz. She along with two assistants prepare meals for the year and her husband, who is a mason by trade, assists on Sundays when they have the most customers.

With a loan of $500 US Dollars, to be repaid in eight months, Rosa and company will buy gas at wholesale price and will also replace dining utensils and furniture that are not in use.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase gas at wholesale and replace dining utensils and furniture.

loan.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La seora Teresa, tiene 47 aos, es madre soltera, estudi hasta 3er ao de secundaria, despus estudi corte y confeccin durante 06 meses en el Instituto Elizabeth Harden en la ciudad de Trujillo, no continu estudiando porque tena que cuidar a sus hijas porque eran muy pequeas, tiene 03 hijos, 02 estn casadas y 01 estudia en el colegio, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.
Para ayudarse econmicamente empez hace 15 aos, en el negocio de venta de cocinas elctricas en Tacora, ahora se dedica a vender abarrotes en su casa, en las tardes vende mazamorra, a veces no vende porque tiene que lavar ropa a particulares, adems cose sabanas para un hotel. Tiene 01 ao trabajando con Manuela Ramos, una amiga la invit a participar en el Banco Comunal MUJERES AL XITO II ella decidi participar en este Banco porque quera implementar el negocio y con el primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibi compr mantequilla, galletas, arroz, azcar, 01 vitrina para colocar la mazamorra, etc. Con este prstamo de S/. 1200 que cancelar en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertirlo en la compra de 01 andamio, 01 balanza, leche, papel higinico, ace, cocoa, aceite.
