La socia suea con tener un minimarket, ya que toda la ganancia la invierte en el negocio, ayudar a su hija para que termine de estudiar y sea una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa is a 47 year old single mother. She studied through her 3rd year of high school and afterwards studied fashion and clothing production for 6 months in the Elizabeth Harden Institute in Trujillo, Peru. She could not finish studying because she had to take care of her daughters while they were small. She has three children: two are married and one is still in high school. She lives in the city of Trujillo, in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad, Peru. To improve her economic situation, fifteen years ago she started a business selling electric stoves in Tacora. Now she sells groceries in her home; in the afternoons she sells mazamorra (a local dessert); however, sometimes she does not have time to sell her mazamorra because she has to wash clothing for neighbors. She also works by sewing sheets for a hotel. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos institution for a year after a friend invited her to participate in the Successful Women II village bank. She decided to participate in the bank because she wanted to grow her business, and with her first loan of $175, she purchased butter, cookies, rice, sugar, and one display case where she could show her mazamorra. With this $400 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she would like to invest in the purchase of one display case, one scale, milk, toilet paper, cleaning supplies, cocoa, and vegetable oil. She dreams of having a minimarket, since all the money she earns through her business helps her daughter to finish studying so she can become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purhcase of a display case, a scale, and various groceries

loan.name: Abdulia

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Abdulia E. me dedico a la produccion de ropa para damas como ser ropa formal para trabajo, trajes, pantalones, blusas, etc. soy joven y muy dedicada a mi trabajo, tengo varios aos de estar en esta actividad, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les hago la ropa a la medida y esto es de mucho agrado porque es muy dificil encontrar ropa que tenga la medida casi exacta, gracias a este detalle mi negocio a crecido mucho me ha ayudado en muchos aspectos en mi vida personal. pocision que no ha sido facil lograr ya que esto lleva varios procesos y limitaciones las cuales he logrado superar mediante a pasado el tiempo y la dedicacion a mi trabajo. en estos momentos necesito de ayuda monetaria para poder salir adelente con un proyecto que tengo en mi negocio, por tal razon estoy pidiendo ayuda. gracias
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Abdulia E. and I work manufacturing clothing for women such as formal work clothes, suits, pants, blouses, etc. I am young and very dedicated to my work. I have worked in this field for many years and my customers are very grateful for my work since I tailor each piece to themthey appreciate this aspect of my work since it is very difficult to find clothing that fits their size perfectly. Thanks to this, my business has grown a lot which has helped me in many aspects of my personal life. It has been difficult to achieve what I have but I have been able to overcome many obstacles over time due to my dedication to my work. Currently, I need financial assistance to continue growing my business and that is why I am requesting your help. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of raw materials to make dresses, pants, blouses

loan.name: Elizabeth Esther

texts.es:
La seora Elizabeth Esther, tiene 38 aos, es madre soltera, estudi educacin secundaria completa, no sigui estudiando porque siempre se ha dedicado al negocio, tiene 01 nia de 06 aos, estudia 1er grado de Primaria, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo, en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.
Para ayudarse econmicamente, antes tena un negocio de verduras en el mercado La Hermelinda, lo dej hace 06 aos porque tena que cuidar a su hija. Ahora trabaja en las maanas en el mercado Maribel, en el cual vende verduras y por las tardes ofrece mazamorra, adems lava ropa a particulares. Tiene 09 aos trabajando en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, una seora la invit a participar en el Banco Comunal MUJERES AL XITO II ella decidi pertenecer a este Banco porque quera incrementar capital, del mismo modo hay facilidades para poder trabajar y con el primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibi compr verduras, maz, azcar, arroz, leche, etc.
Con este prstamo de S/. 500.00, que cancelar en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra de verduras, azcar, pasas, maz, etc. La socia suea con tener un puesto propio de verduras porque siempre alquila.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth Esther is a 38 year old single mother. She graduated from high school but could not continue studying because she had to begin working. She has a 6 year old daughter who is in the first grade of elementary school. They live in the city of Trujillo in Trujillo, La Libertad, Peru. To improve her economic situation, she used to have a small business selling vegetables in the Hermelinda market; however, she had to leave this business 6 years ago in order to take care of her daughter. Now she works in the Maribel market in the mornings selling vegetables, and in the afternoons she sells mazamorra (a local dessert) and washes clothing of neighbors. She has worked for 9 years with the Manuela Ramos movement after a friend invited her to participate in the Successful Women II village bank. She decided to join the bank because she wanted to increase her capital in order to facilitate her business. With her first loan of $175, she purchased vegetables, corn, sugar, rice, milk, etc. With this $175 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she would like to invest in the purchase of vegetables, sugar, raisins, corn, etc. She dreams of having her own vegetable stand since up to now, she has always rented one.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of vegetables and other food items

loan.name: Maria Genoveva

texts.es:
La seora Mara Genoveva, tiene 61 aos, est casada, estudi secundaria completa, no sigui estudiando porque sus padres no tenan recursos econmicos para poder ayudarla, despus la socia se cas, al poco tiempo estudi corte y confeccin, bordados a mquina, repostera, ahora tiene 05 hijos, se encuentran trabajando, vive en el Distrito D. Trujillo en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad. La empresaria tiene 20 aos en el negocio D. repostera y costura. En repostera prepara tortas, arroz con leche, panqueques, mazamorra, los distribuye a sus vecinas y en costura, elabora faldas y pijamas, los ofrece en Chiclin, Chimbote. Tiene 3 aos en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, una seora la recomend en el Banco Comunal MUJERES AL XITO ella decidi participar en este Banco por la facilidad D. tener capital, ser independiente y con el primer prstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibi compr tazones, arroz, leche, maz, azcar, pasas, guindones, etc.
Con este prstamo D. S/. 1700.00, que cancelar en un plazo D. 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra D. maz, telas para hacer cortinas, hilos. La socia suea con tener un negocio D. repostera en su casa
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Genoveva is 61 years old, married, finished secondary school, but could not continue her studies because her parents did not have the resources to support her. After marrying her husband, she studied design and tailoring, machine embroidery, and pastry-making. She has 5 children and lives in the Trujillo District and Province in the Libertad Department (like states). The businesswoman has worked in pastry-making and tailoring for 20 years. In her bakery she makes cakes, rice with milk (a regional favorite), pancakes, and mazamorra (a pudding-like dessert maD. of corn), which she distributed to her neighbors. In tailoring, she makes dressed, skirts, pajamas, that she sells in Chiclin, Chimbote.

She has been a member of the Manuela Ramos Movement bank for 3 years. A woman recommended the community bank "Successful Women" and she decided to become a partner in order to obtain capital and be independent. With her first loan of $100 she purchased soup bowls, rice, milk, corn, sugar, raisins, cherries, and the like. With this loan of $575, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will invest in corn, materials to make curtains, and string. The businesswoman dream of having a bakery business in her home.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of supplies. Purhcase of material in bulk.

loan.name: Juliana

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Juliana C. me dedico a la venta de comida y golosinas, actividad que realizo desde hace mas de 15 aos, lo que me ha permitido sacar adelante mi negocio y mi hogar, este negocio gracias a Dioa me ayudo a cubrir con todas las necesidades de mis hijos en los aspectos de alimentacion y vestuario. en estos momentos necesito hacer crecer mi negocio ya que en estos ultimos dias no me doy abasto para cubrir las necesidades de mis clientes y rapido no tengo producto para vender, necesito inyectarle un capital para incrementar mis inventarios y asi tener mayor produccion de comida. y con las ganancias que obtenga poder seguir con el sstento de mi hogar. esta es la unica actividad que puedo realizar ya que al uno cumplir con la tercera edad es bien dificil conseguir trabajo.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Juliana C.. I work selling food and sweets, an activity that I have been involved with for more than 15 years. It has permitted me to improve my business and my home. Thanks to God, this business has helped me pay for all my childrens necessities in terms of food and clothing. At the moment, I need to grow my business, as in recent days I have not been able to cope with the needs of my clients and soon I will not have products to sell. I need an injection of capital in order to grow my inventories and so enable more food production. And, with the income I would get from this, I would be able to continue with improving my home. This is the only activity that I am able to do, as once one becomes elderly it is very difficult to find work.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy the things necessary to make food and sweets

loan.name: Betty Gladis

texts.es: La seora Betty Gladis, tiene 60 aos, est casada, estudi hasta 2do ao D. secundaria, despus estudi costura y repostera, tiene 05 hijos, se encuentran trabajando, vive en el Distrito D. Trujillo en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad. Para ayudarse econmicamente empez a coser desD. que era joven para mantener a sus hijos porque el sueldo del esposo no alcanzaba, la socia cosa champuneras, pero despus cambi D. negocio porque comprarlo hecho le resulta mas cmodo, tambin hacia queques. Tiene 02 aos trabajando en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su amiga la invit a participar en el Banco Comunal ESPERANZA DEL MAANA, ella decidi pertenecer a este Banco porque quera comprar la materia prima para dedicarse a vender hamburguesas y con el primer prstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibi compr carnes, bolsas, mayonesas, ketchu en baldes, hot dog, gaseosa. Con este prstamo D. S/. 800.00 que cancelar en 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra D. tazones, coladores, moldes para hacer tartas. La empresaria suea con tener un restaurante, pero falta un local granD. y que sea comercial.
texts.en:
Betty Gladis is 60 years old, married, and completed her education up until the 2nd year of secondary school. Afterwards, she studied sewing and baking. She has five children who are working. Betty lives in the Trujillo district of La Libertad. To help herself economically, she started to sew from a young age in order to support her children given that her husbands income did not cover their living expenses. She sewed champuneras, but later changed her business because it was more comfortable to buy them maD. and she also baked pastries. She has 2 years working in the Manuela Ramos Movement; her friend invited her to joing the communal bank Hope for Tomorrow. She decided to join this bank because she wanted to buy ingredients to dedicate herself to selling hamburgers. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received, she purchased meats, bags, mayonnaise, ketchup in bulk, hot dogs and sodas. With this loan of 800.00 soles, which she will repay in four months, she plans to invest in the purchase of bowls, colanders and molds to make cakes. This businesswoman dreams of having a restaurant, but she needs a large location in order to be commercial.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase kitchen utensils.

loan.name: Sara Isabel

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Sara A. me dedico a la venta y produccion de donas, actividad que realizo hace varios aos atras, soy madre de 4 hijos y junto a mi esposo hemos decidido trabajar juntos cada uno de nosotros desarrollando nuestras actividades para asi hacerle frente a todas las necesidades de nuestro hogar. ahora necesito una ayuda monetaria para comprar mas materia prima para poder producir mas donas y tener una mejor venta y ganancias, las cuales las ocupamos para sacar adelante a nuestros hijos que son lo mas importante en esta vida. gracias
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Sara A.. My work is producing and selling donuts, a business I have been running for many years already. I am the mother to 4 children and my husband and I have decided that we will each keep working at our business so that we will be able to cover the necessities of our household. But now I require financial help to purchase ingredients to produce my donuts, and therefore have improved sales and better earnings. We require our earnings to support our children, who are the most important thing in this life.

Thank you.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase flour, baking soda, sugar, shortening, salt, and flavorings.

loan.name: Luz Martha

texts.es:
La seora Luz Martha, tiene 55 aos, actualmente se encuentra separada, estudi hasta 3er grado de primaria porque su madre estaba enferma en la Provincia de Julcan y necesitaba cuidarla, despus se dedic de empleada donde su ta en una panadera y un restaurante, tiene 02 hijos, son independientes, vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse econmicamente, empez desde que era joven a tejer toda clase de ponchos, chompas, bolsas de nailon a base de crochet, palitos, adems hacia bordados. Tambin trabajaba en la fabrica de Esparrago donde era seleccionadora, se retir porque tena que cuidar a sus hijos. Tiene 08 aos trabajando en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su prima la recomend en el Banco Comunal MUJERES AL XITO II ella decidi integrarse a este Banco para apoyarse, salir adelante y con el primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibi compr conos de hilos de nailon, lanas, agujas.
Con el prstamo de S/. 1,200.00 que cancelar en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra de lanas, hilos de tejer. La empresaria suea con exportar tejido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Martha is 55 years old and seperated from her husband. She studies until 3rd grade because her mother was sick in the Julcan Province and she had to take care of her. Afterward, she found employment in her aunt's bakery and restaurant. Luz has two children, who are adults. She lives in the El Porvenir District of the Trujillo Province in the Libertad Department (like a state). In order to support herself economically, she has worked since her youth sewing all types of jackets, coats, and handbags, from nylon to crochet, plastic, and recently embroidered. She also works in the Esparrago factory where she worked in human resources. She retired in order to take care of her children. For 8 years, she has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement. After her cousin referred her to the Community Bank, "Successful Women II" she decided join in order to support herself and move ahead. With her first loan of $100 she purchased bolts of Nylon, wool, and also sewing needles. With this lona of $400, which will be repaid after 4 months, she will invest in the wool and thread. The businesswoman's dream is to export fabric.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of wool and thread in bulk.

loan.name: Karina

texts.es: La seora Karina junto con su esposo el seor Cornelio tienen tres hijas y son pequeas, estn en edad de escuela, ellos estn solicitando este prstamo para construir una barda en el frente de su casa y darle a su familia mas proteccin, ya que la seora trabaja como supervisora en una maquiladora en el turno de noche y el trabaja en una fabrica en diferentes horarios, para salir adelante, y demostrando que nunca hay que darse por vencidos, ella al igual que su esposo le quieren brindar mas seguridad a sus hijas y saber que cuando ellos esten trabajando y su familia se quede en casa no corran ningn riesgo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karina, together with her husband, Mr. Cornelio, has three young daughters who are in school. Karina and Cornelio are requesting a loan in order to construct a fence in front of their home to give their family more protection since Karina works as a supervisor in a factory and at night her husband works various hours at a factory in order to move ahead. To show that she never gives up, "she, the same as her husband, wants to provide more security to her children and know that when they are working, and when her family is at home they are safe."


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To construct a fence in front of their home.

loan.name: Mara Elena

texts.es: La seora Mara Elena, tiene 42 aos, es madre soltera, estudi enfermera tcnica en el Instituto Trujillo, no sac titulo, posteriormente el instituto desapareci, despus ella viaj a la sierra para trabajar en primeros auxilios, luego vino a Trujillo para cuidar a su hija. Tiene 01 hija de 15 aos, vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse econmicamente, empez hace 04 aos a vender comida, papa rellena, despus tambin venda productos cosmticos, al mismo tiempo trabajaba en la ciudad de Trujillo en un grifo, pero renunci porque no tena tiempo para cuidar a su hija. Tiene 03 aos trabajando en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su ta la recomend en el Banco Comunal ESPERANZA DEL MAANA ella decidi pertenecer a este Banco porque era un apoyo ms y con el primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibi compr esmaltes, colonias, cremas, gaseosas. Con este prstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelar en 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra de fideos, azcar, verduras, arroz, harina, atn, etc. La empresaria suea con tener un minimarket, techar su casa, y ayudar en la educacin a su hija.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Elena is a 42 year old, single mother. She studies technical nursing at the Trujillo Institute. She did not receive a title and later the institute disappeared. Later she traveled to the mountains to work in first aid, then came to Trujillo to care for her 15 year old daughter. She lives in the El Porvenir District in the Trujillo Province in the La Libertad Department (like a state). In order to support herself economically she began selling prepared foods, like fried Rellenas (peppers), and cosmetic products. At the same time she worked in Trujillo, but left the job because she did not have enough time to take care of her daughter. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. Her aunt recommended the community bank, "Hope of the Morning," and she decided to become a member because it was another support for her. With her first loan of $100 she purchased, nail polish, colognes, creams, and carbonated drinks. With this loan of $500, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase noodles, sugar, vegetables, rice, flour, tuna, and the like. The businesswoman's dream is to have a minimarket, roof her house, and help her daughter get an education.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of general products.

loan.name: Xochiquetzalli

texts.es: Xochiquetzalli al igual que su esposo el seor Hctor tienen una nia pequea, a la que aman mucho y por eso buscan salir adelante, por su parte la seora Xochiquetzalli tiene una tiendita en su misma casa, lo cual no le impide ver por la seguridad de su hija, el cuidado de su esposo y los quehaceres del hogar, por lo mismo esta solicitando este prstamo para comprar mas mercanca para su negocio y hacerlo crecer, as darle a su hija y a su familia un mejor estilo de vida, demostrando que en la vida uno puede lograr sus sueos
texts.en:
Xochiquetzalli and her husband, Hector, have a young daughter, whom they love very much. She is the reason why they are always looking for a way to get ahead in life. Ms. Xochiquetzalli owns a general store that she runs from home, which does not prevent her from looking after her daughter, taking care of her husband, and getting the household chores done. For this reason, she is requesting this loan in order to purchase more merchandise for her business and make it grow, thus, she can give her daughter and her family a better lifestyle, proving that one can reach his/her dreams in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase goods for general store

loan.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan,a 37-year-old married man with one child, lives in the region of Baalback, in the Bekaa Valley of Lebanon. Ghassan is a hair designer. Because of the insufficient electricity power supply in his region, Ghassan has to turn on his generator each time clients arrive to his salon. Hence, he needs a loan of $US1,000 to purchase a stock of fuel to be able to use the generator at any time in order to guarantee more comfort to his clients. This step up will allow Ghassan to expand his business and therefore to improve the livelihood of his family. This is the first time Ghassan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loan.use: Purchase a stock of fuel for the electric generator

loan.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 30-year-old, single man who lives in a small village situated in the West Bekaa, on Lebanon's border with Syria. Mohamad owns a "take a break" restaurant in the same area where he lives. The location is perfect for this type of business. His amazing hospitality and generosity attract clients of both nationalities to Mohamad's restaurant.

Mohamad needs a loan of $US1,200 to conduct maintenance for his restaurant and thereby expand his business. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loan.use: Proceed with maintenance for a restaurant

loan.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 38 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She lives in a small village in the West Bekaa where she owns a grocery shop. Amina is a very responsible mother whose priority in life is the improvement of her business, which is the only source of income for her family.

With the beginning of the "back to school" season, there is an increased demand for stationery products. Amina needs a loan of $US1,200 to purchase more goods to attract more clients and thereby expand her business. This is the first time that Amina has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loan.use: Purchase inventory

loan.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled, 27 years old and single, lives in a small village in the Bekaa Valley. He runs a nice clothing shop where he sells a variety of shirts, pants, and dresses for all types of clients. Khaled wants to earn additional income to provide a better livelihood for his family. He requests, for the first time, a loan of $US1,000 to purchase additional inventory. The timing for this loan is particularly important to him as there is a high demand for clothes for the "back to school" period and important holidays ahead. The loan will allow him to maintain an adequate amount of inventory on hand and will give him the flexibility to easily update his product selection if an item is selling well or not.

loan.use: Purchase additional inventory

loan.name: Marleny Santos

texts.es: La seora Marleny Santos, tiene 34 aos, est casada, estudi corte y confeccin en el Instituto Perpetuo Socorro en la ciudad de Trujillo, tiene 02 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse econmicamente, empez a trabajar en un taller de costura, donde confeccionaba mandiles, pedidos para colegios, servicios. Su ta la recomend en el Banco Comunal MUJERES AL XITO II ella decidi pertenecer a este Banco porque quera independizarse, tener un negocio propio y con el primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibi compr tela, ella dispone de una mquina recta. Con el prstamo de S/. 1200.00 que cancelar en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra de tela polar para hacer buzos, los cuales lleva su to a la sierra para vender. La empresaria suea con tener un taller propio, comprar una mquina remalladora, disponer de personal que trabaje para ella y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marleny Santos is 34 years old, married, and studied design and production in the Socorro Perpetual Institute in Trujillo. She has 2 children, who are students, and they live in the El Porvenir District, Trujillo Province, of La Libertad Department (like a state). In order to support herself economically, she started working in a tailoring shop, where she made aprons, uniforms and other special orders. Her aunt referred her to the community Bank, "Successful Women II" and she decided to become a member because she wanted to become independent and have her own business. With her first loan of $100 she purchased material to use in a straight sewing machine. With this loan of $400, which she will repay over 4 months, she will purchase fleece materials to make coats, which her uncle with take into the mountains to sell. The businesswoman dreams of having her own shop, purchasing a weaving machine, and employing someone to work for her, and for her children to become professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of material in bulk.

loan.name: Afif

texts.en: Afif is 53 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in a small village of the West Bekaa. Afif owns a small restaurant and also has a small piece of farmland next to his home that he cultivates. Because of the high cost of the raw materials needed for his business, Afif decided to further develop his farm to raise animals, in particular poultry breeding. He needs a loan of $US1,200 to finalize construction of the chicken farm. This is the first time Afif has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loan.use: Construct a poultry farm

loan.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias, 38 years old, is married and the father of one child, standing next to him on the picture. Elias lives in a small village in the West Bekaa. He uses his truck to distribute and sell various merchandise around his town and from his village's market to another.

Elias needs $US1,200 to purchase more goods. This loan will help his business to be successful and will provide much needed income for Elias and his family. This is the first time Elias has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loan.use: Purchase inventory

loan.name: Carlos Rafael

texts.es:
Carlos Rafael M. M. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi . Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.
This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances. El es una persona de mediana edad esta trabajando en una empresa de bebidas y su esposa la seora Sarai labora en una empresa como cajera y juntos como familia estn solicitando este prstamo para construir un bao para su casa, as en un futuro brindarle una comodidad a su familia y tener un mejor modo de vivir.
texts.en:
Carlos Rafael M. M. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan. This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances. He is a middle aged person who is working in a drink business. His spouse, Seora Sarai labora, works in a business as a cashier. Together, as a family, they are asking for this loan in order to build a bathroom for their house, which in the future would offer convenience to the family and enable them to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To build a bathroom

loan.name: Lucila Migdalia

texts.es: Doa Lucila M., tiene 44 aos de edad, es casada, tiene una hija que estudia el quinto ao de la universidad, su esposo se desempea como chofer. La actividad economica de la seora es la venta de cosmeticos, teniendo en el negocio mas de 6 aos trabajando con cosmeticos de la linea AVON, a traves de una amiga que le ayudo en el proceso de la comercializacion de cosmeticos a la fecha tiene una gran clientela, teniendo como deseo tener un poco mas de capital de esta manera tener una variedad de mercaderia a fin de satisfacer la demanda. Su sueo es poder instalar una pequea tienda de cosmeticos en su casa ya que actualmente esta comercislizando de forma ambulante ofertando en empresas establecidas, al mismo tiempo poder ir acondicionando su casa y obtener un poco del fruto de su arduo trabajo, confiando en que con el apoyo de nuestra institucion pueda prosperar en su sueos e ideas. Ademas de dedicarse al comercio de cosmeticos simultaneamente comercializa con ropa nueva, la cual compra en managua dependiendo de los encargos que tenga que cumplir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila M., is 44 years old and married, has one daughter who is in her fifth year of college, her husband works as a driver. Mrs. M.s business is the sale of cosmetics; she has been in this business for over 6 years working with the Avon line of cosmetics. Through a friends help she was able to learn the process of selling cosmetics, to date she has a great clientele. She would like to have a little more capital that way she can offer a variety of merchandise to meet customer demand. Her dream is to install a small cosmetics shop in her home since she is currently a traveling salesperson offering her products at already established businesses. At the same time she would like to repair her home and enjoy some of the fruits of her hard work. In addition to selling cosmetics she also sells clothes (pictured above), which she buys in Managua and then resells in her community. She is confident that with the support of our institution she will thrive in her dreams and ideas.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Elizabeth Leticia

texts.es: La seora Elizabeth solicito el prstamo para remodelar el techo de su casa ya que se encuentra muy daado y para terminar de construir la ampliacin de su cocina, ella es una persona que se dedica a la venta de seguros, para sacar adelante a su hija y a su mama, juntas conforman una familia de puras mujeres que son muestra del valor que poseen.
texts.en:
Elizabeth applied for the loan in order to remodel the roof of her house because it is already damaged as well as to finish the enlargement of her kitchen. She works selling insurance so that her daughter and mother can advance in life. Together they are a family of just women, which shows the value that they possess.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To enlarge her kitchen and remodel her roof

loan.name: Silvia Oralia

texts.es: La seora Silvia tiene dos hijos uno pequeo y uno de edad de escuela, su esposo es empleado de una fabrica, pero luchan dia con dia para salir adelante, por su lado la seora tiene un puesto de pulga llamado OMAR Y KEVIN esta solicitando este prestamo para la compra de mas mercancia para su negocio, le quiere dar un mejor futuro a sus hijos ya que desea que crezcan en un mejor modo de vivir.
texts.en:
Ms. Silvia R. has two childrenone school age and another pre-school age. Her husband works at a factory, but they both struggle each day to get ahead in life. Silvia owns a booth called OMAR Y KEVIN at the local flea market. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase more merchandise for her business. She would like to offer her children a better future because she wants them to grow up in a better lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase more merchandise

loan.name: Juan Ortiz

texts.es: El seor Juan Ortiz, tiene 56 aos de edad, es casado tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos ya estan casados y sus otros dos hijos le ayudan en el desempeo de su negocio, siendo este la comercializacion menor de chatarra como es lata, aluminio, hierro, teniendo un pequeo negocio que su sueo es poder incrementar y crecer economicamente al mismo tiempo generar fuentes de empleo. Ademas de esta actividad el seor se dedica al comercio de cerdos en pie actividad que tambien realiza en conjunto con un hijo. Su proposito es poder establecerse como un acopiador de chatarra dentro de lso mas fuenrtes en el mercado para ello requiere un capital lo suficientemente para establecerse en el mercado o negocio de chatarra.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Ortiz, is 56 years old, is married and has 4 children of which two are already married and his other two sons help him in carrying out the business. Through his small business he resells scrap metal such as tin, aluminum and iron. His dream is to be able to enhance and grow economically while generating jobs. In addition to this activity, Mr. Ortiz is a wholesaler of pigs which he also performs together with his son. His goal is to establish himself as a scrap metal collector within the strongest market but this requires enough capital to become established in the scrap metal market.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Maria Fabiola

texts.es: La seora Maria Fabiola V., tiene 31 aos de edad, es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 8 aos de edad que cursa el tercer grado de primaria, no tiene ayuda economica del papa de su hijo, la actividad economica de la sora es la comecializacion de cosmeticos como perfumes para hombres y mujeres y ropa variada como pantalones, blusas trajes, actividad que tiene seis aos de desarrollar la cual da inicio como una alternativa al desempleo y aprovechando el apoyo de un familiar en el exterior ha ido creciendo poco a poco en capital, siendo su sueo poder instalar un tiene de ropa para nios y adultos, y su proposito poder satisfacer la demanda, y darle un mejor porvenir a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Fabiola V., is 31 years of age, is a single mother of an 8 year old child who attends the third grade. She does not receive financial help from her sons father. The economic activity she engages in is the marketing of cosmetics such as fragrances for men and women; she also sells a variety of clothing such as trousers, blouses and suits. It has been six years since she developed this business which began as an alternative to unemployment. She has been slowly growing her capital by drawing on the support from a relative that lives abroad. Her dream is to install a clothing store for children and adults to meet the demand from her customers; this will allow her to give her son a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Justa Consuelo

texts.es: La seora Justa Consuelo A., tiene 58 aos de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos los cuales ya estan en la universidad, su esposo es propietario de una pequea discomovil, su proposito en la vida ha sido ver desarrollados profesionalmente a sus hijos con el sacrificio de su trabajo lo han logrado, su mayor sueo es poder brindarle a sus hijos condiciones un poco mas dignas de vida, su mayor deseo es poder acondiconar su casa donde tiene una pequea pulperia donde se ofrece productos de uso y consumo diario para el hogar como es leche, arroz, azucar aceite frijoles, gaseosa, huevos, detergentes, dicho negocio tiene 23 aos de realizarlo y con el cual ha sacado a delante a sus hijos, su negocio surge como una opcion de ingresos para el nucleo familiar ya que ella se desempeaba como profesora pero con el tiempo sumado su edad ya se le fue imposible dar clases por lo que con su liquidacion o pago de su trabajo puso su pequea pulperia a la fecha es su mayor fuente de empleo contando siempre con el apoyo moral de su esposo y de instituciones como la nuestra que le ha vendio a apoyar en sus prpyectos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Justa Consuelo A. is 58 years old, is married and has three sons whom are already in college; her husband owns a small party bus. Her purpose in life has been to see her children become professionals and with the sacrifice of her work they have done so. Her biggest dream is to be able to give her children more dignified living conditions. Her greatest wish is to be able to arrange her home which has a small shop that offers products for daily use and consumption such as milk, rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, soft drinks, eggs, detergent. This business has existed for 23 years and has helped her advance her children. She worked as a teacher but eventually was unable to teach due to her age, so this business became an income option for the family. With her severance pay she established this small shop. To date, it is her largest source of income while counting on the moral support of her husband and institutions like ours that have supported her projects.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Gloria Luz

texts.es: Doa Gloria Luz M., tiene 35 aos de edad, es casada, tiene una bebe de meses de nacida, su esposo es comerciante, la actividad economica de la seora es la venta de ropa nueva y cosmeticos actividad que desarrolla en conjunto con su esposo ya que ambos estan sin empleo y al ver esta una opcion de autoempleo a la fecha se ha constituido como su fuente de ingresos familiar. Su negocio lo lleva a cabo por encargo y en su domicilio ya que tiene clientes que le buscan en su casa, su idea de nogocio se da como una necesidad de poder salir adelante, por lo que su sueo es poder ofrecer un mejor futuro a su hijo, acondicionar su vivienda y con un poco mas de apoyo instalar una tienda en su casa de esta manera ella atenderia directamente el neogcio en casa y su compaero de vida atenderia los pedidos a sus clientes externos como son personas de los mercados, y del sector domiciliar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Luz M. is a 35-year-old married mother of a newborn girl. Her husband is a businessman. She and her husband sell clothing and cosmetics for a living because they are both unemployed and this opportunity for self-employment has thus far constituted their source of family income. They carry out their business by taking orders from home because their customers seek their services at their house. The idea to have her own business came out of a necessity to get ahead in life, which is why she dreams of being able to offer her child a better future, remodel her house, and with a little more support, set up a store in her house so that she and her spouse can run their business directly and serve their outside customers, such as the people from the markets and from the home sector.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Work capital

loan.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long C. Khim is a villager in Damnak Pring in the Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small grocery store at the local market. Her husband, Mr. Moth Him, is a policeman in the town and he earns only a small salary, just barely enough to support his family. Mrs. Long C. Khim is 34 years old and the mother of three children. Two of her children are attending school while the third is still too young to work or attend school. Their family lives together in a old and run down house. Mrs. Long C. Khim is asking for a loan to help buy a new house. Mrs. Long C. Khim has previously taken a loan of $700 to buy piece of land to grow vegetables and she has fully paid it back.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to buy to add to her saving to build a new house for her household.

loan.name: Kong

texts.en: This is the third cycle of Mrs. Kong D.'s loan request to improve her living conditions in the Pour Mras village in the Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a pig breeder and her husband, Mr. Em Vannarith, who is a rice wine maker that processes wine from rice. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it, so his wife, Mrs. Kong D., has decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice for her husband's business. Mrs. Kong D. is 20 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Kong D. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her husband's current business. She has fully paid it back. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loan.use: to ask for a loan to buy more rice to process into rice wine.

loan.name: Yot

texts.en: This is the second loan Mr. Yot Youen has asked for to improve his business activity. He raises chickens and pigs in Kbal Thnol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Since his second business is going well, Mr. Yot Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy more pigs for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Sun Beang, helps her husband with his business. Mr. Yot Y. is 37 years old and the father of five children, who are all attending school. Previously, Mr. Yot Y. had obtained a loan to buy chickens for breeding. He has succeeded to pay off the loan. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loan.use: To buy more pigs for breeding.

loan.name: Neang

texts.en: This is the third time that Mrs. Neang K. S. has requested a loan . She is a farmer in Trapaing Skor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. York Yeth, is a pig breeder. Since his business is going well, he wants to sell his pigs door-to-door. Because of his success, Mrs. Neang K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her current savings to buy a motorbike in order to transport his husband pigs to sell. Mrs. Neang K. is 37 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the remaining two are attending school. Previously, Mrs. Neang K. had obtained a loan to build a new house. She has succeeded in paying the loan off.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to add to her saving to buy a motorbike in order to transport his husband pigs to sell.

loan.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch K. is a farmer in Trapaing Sronge Village in the Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Chin Choeun, is a lumberjack who gathers firewood to sell in the local village. He also helps his wife in the fields. In Mrs. Touch K.'s plantation, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough work animals to plow the rice field. She decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy one more ox to plow the rice fields. Mrs. Touch K. is 49 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending school.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to add to her saving to buy one more ox to plow with the old one in order to cultivate rice.

loan.name: Mrs. Teng Sokcheng Group

texts.en:
This group that desires to get a loan is located in Ponlai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and consists of four people. They plan to use the loan for many different purposes. Mrs. TE. S. is the group leader and this will be her third loan. She is a farmer and poultry breeder in the local village. Her breeding poultry business raises a lot of chickens. Since this business is succeeding, she wants to expand it, so she has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more chickens for breeding. Mrs. TE. S. is a 51-year-old widow, her child is a bed maker who earns to little income to support himself and his family. Mrs. TE. S. hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.
All the members have end-of-term loans and these members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to purchase more chickens for breeding.

loan.name: Ni Made Riniasih

texts.id: Bu Made Riniasih seorang isteri yang mengerti akan pentingnya peranannya sebagai ibu rumah tangga yang wajib membantu suami dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga terutama dalam masa-masa krisis aeperti sekarang. Memelihara babi adalah bukti dari ketulusannya membantu suaminya. Saat ini Made Riniasih memelihara 2 ekor penggemukan dan memiliki rencana memelihara penginduk untuk bisa mendapat hasil yang lebih baik. Usaha beternak ini sudah dijalaninya cukup lama yaitu sejak menikah sehingga hasil dari usaha ini sebagian besar dipergunakan tambahan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga. Karena sebelumnya usaha yang ditekuninya ini dikelola dengan cara sederhana sehingga hasilnya belum maksimal, tetapi cukup bisa dibanggakan karena mampu menunjang pendapatan keluarga. Keuntungan yang biasa diperolehnya dari 2 ekor penggemukan berkisar Rp 500.000,- sampai Rp 6.00.000 dalam waktu 5 bulan. Ibu Made Riniasih berharap usahanya bisa lebih dikembangkan lagi mengingat biaya hidup semakin meningkat, sedangkan pendapatan keluarga tidak mengalami banyak peningkatan. Itulah sebabnya Ibu Made Riniasih berencana memelihara penginduk dari pinjaman modal yang diperolehnya dari DINARI. Ibu Riniasih mengikuti program ternak babi dari Yaysan DINARI dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama 6 bulan dan pembayarannya dilakukan setelah akhir periode.
texts.en:
Made Riniasih is a dutiful wife who understands her responsibility in helping her husband to ease the family's economic burden. In doing this, she is raising 2 piglets and she is planning to buy a breeding pig to get a better result.

She has been doing this pig farming business for quite a while. All of the proceeds are used to help the family. She can earn IDR 500 thousand to IDR 600 thousand (around USD 55-65) by raising 2 piglets for 5 months.

She wants to further improve her family welfare and therefore she is participating in the DINARI's foundation's pig farming program where she can get a loan and repay it after 6 months period.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to buy breeding pig (Membeli induk babi)

loan.name: Ni Ketut Niliwati

texts.id: Sebagai istri seorang petani dengan penghasilan yang pas-pasan membuat Ni Ketut Niliwati berpikir keras untuk bisa membantu suami dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Krisis ekonomi yang semakin meluas membuat sebagian besar masyarakat mengalami kesulitan untuk bertahan dengan kehidupan yang serba sulit. Namun bagi Ni Ketut Niliwati hal itu justru membuatnya semakin terpacu untuk bisa lebih banyak mengambil peranan dalam membantu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga. Ni Ketut Niliwati memilih menjalankan usaha ternak babi yaitu penggemukan yang berjumlah dua ekor. Setiap pagi dan sore hari kedua ekor ternaknya diberikan perawatan seperti memberi pakan, dan juga membersihkan kandangnya. Dalam waktu enam bulan dari dua ekor babi tersebut bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 800.000 Rp 1.000.000 per ekor sesuai harga pasar pada saat dijual dan mendapat untung sekitar Rp 300.000 Rp 400.000. Dengan hasil dari usaha inilah Ibu Ketut Niliwati membantu suaminya dalam menyekolahkan dua orang anak mereka sampai akhirnya anaknya yang pertama bisa menamatkan pendidikannya di bangku SLTA. Untuk meningkatkan pendapatan dari usahanya ini Ni Ketut Niliwati mengikuti program ternak babi yang di kelola Yayasan DINARI dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama enam bulan dan pembayarannya dilakukan pada waktu periode pinjaman berakhir.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Niliwati is a farmer's wife. Her husband is having difficult time due to the economic crisis and this makes Ni Ketut to work to earn extra income to support the family. She decided to try the pig farming business. She is raising 2 piglets at the moment. In 6 months period she can sell these 2 piglets for IDR 800 thousand to IDR 1 million (around USD 85-110). She can earn a net profit of IDR 300 thousand to IDR 400 thousand from this (around USD 32 - USD 43). With this she can help her husband and also to finance their 2 children education.

To further improve her business, she is participating in DINARI Foundation's pig farming program where she can repay the loan after a 6 months period.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to buy piglet (Membeli anak babi)

loan.name: Mrs. Chhak Nam Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This bank of 14 members is located in Thmey Khmer Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Chhak N. is the village bank president. This is the second time she has to asked for a loan to improve her business activity. Mrs. Chhak N. is a farmer who cultivates two times a year and her husband, Mr. Duong Tork, is a cow and chicken breeder. Aside from this business, he sells firewood. Since his second business is going well, he wants to expand it so his wife, Mrs. Chhak N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more firewood to re-sell. Mrs. Chhak N. is 35 years old and the mother of four children who all currently attend school.
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eleven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to buy more firewood to re-sell.

loan.name: Ni Made Mertini

texts.id: Tinggal di daerah pinggiran kota dengan pemukiman yang padat tidak mengurungkan niat Ibu Made Mertini untuk menjalankan usaha beternak babi. Dengan lahan yang terbatas Ibu Made Mertini membuat kandang sederhana yang bisa menampung 2-3 ekor babi. Walaupun kandangnya terletak berdekatan dengan rumah tetangganya namun limbah dari kandangnya tidak sampai mengganggu lingkungan sekitarnya karena ternak dan juga kandangnya dirawat dengan baik. Hasil dari memelihara babi penggemukan tersebut dipergunakannya untuk mencukupi kebutuhan rumah tangganya baik itu untuk di dapur maupun keperluan lainnya seperti biaya pendidikan anaknya yang berusia 14 tahun dan saat ini masih duduk di bangku SMP. Walaupun hasil yang diperolahnya dari usaha ini tidak terlalu banyak tapi hal ini tidak mengurangi semangatnya karena usaha ini sudah ditekuni cukup lama dan terbukti bisa membantu menopang kehidupan keluarganya. Ibu Ni Made Mertini saat ini mengikuti program ternak babi yang dikelola DINARI dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama enam bulan dan pembayaran akan dilakukan kembali setelah periode pinjaman berakhir, dan selalu berharap usahanya bisa lebih maju dan keuntungan yang sebelumnya hanya Rp 300.000 per ekor bisa bertambah sehingga kehidupan keluarganya bisa lebih sejahtera lagi.
texts.en:
Living in the suburb with dense population does not hold Made Mertini to run pig raising business. Having limited space, she build a simple pigpen for 2-3 pigs. The pigpen is closed to her neighbour house, however the waste is not a problem as she cleans the cattle and the pigpen regularly. The income from raising fattening pig is used for meeting her daily needs and for education of her 14-year old child in junior high. Although the profit is not that much, but it is proved to be able to support her family livelihoods and, therefore, inspire her to keep the spirit for the business. Made Martini joins pig raising program of DINARI with 6-months loan term and repayment is started after the loan period is over. She hopes for the development of her business and for her profit from USD 33 per pig to be increased for the prosperity of her family.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Persada Madaze, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy piglet

loan.name: Mrs. Ro Mao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Our village bank which consists of fifteen members is located in Thmey Khmer Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, and they plan to use the loan for maN. different purposes. Mrs. Ro M. is the village bank president who raises two cows and thirty chickens. In addition to running the village bank, she is a tailor in the local village. So far her business has been extremely successful so she has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy more fabrics. Without the loan she will be unable to meet the need of her consumers' demand. Mrs. Ro M. is a 45-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the remaining two are attending school.
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay aN. principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments maN. months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fabrics in order to meet the need of her consumers' demand in order to process into clothes.

loan.name: Mrs. Mar Sokun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province make up the village bank loan. Mrs. Mar S. is the village bank president who owns a small restaurant where she sells Chinese noodles in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to cook the delicious food for her customers. Her husband, Cheng Mao, is a policeman who makes a small salary to support his family. Aside from this business, he breeds twenty chicken and two pigs when he has free time from his position. Mrs. Mar S. is 36 years old and the mother of two children who are all attending in the local school.
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients stA. to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to cook the delicious food for her customers.

loan.name: Mrs. Phai Sreymum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank, which is located in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, consists of fifteen people and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Phai S. is the village bank president and she is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes to re-sell in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Chhing SoP., is a cow breeder who raises two oxen for cultivating rice. Mrs. Phai S. is 24 years old and the mother of two children aged 1 and 3.
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To purchase more fashion cloches to re-sell in the local market.

loan.name: Mr. Loem Khroeurn Group

texts.en: Mr. Loem K. is the group leader in Kuy Village and this group consists of four members who plan to use the loan for different purposes. For instance, Mr. Loem K. is requesting a loan to buy fishnets for catching more fish. His wife, Mrs. Em Noeurn, is a farmer and she also raises four cows in order to re-sell them later at a better price. Mr. Loem K. is 44 years old and the father of three children who are all attending school. All the members have end-of-term loans and these members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: to buy fishnets for catching more fish.

loan.name: Mrs. Sem Roem Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem R. is the leader of a group of six which is located in Thmei Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. All the members of this group pL. to use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Sem R. is a farmer who cultivates two times a year. During the rainy season, she cultivates rice and during the dry season, she grows vegetable. Since it is now the rainy season, Mrs. Sem R. decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer to sow the rice seeds. Additionally, she would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to support her rice when it grows. Her husband, Mr. Seng Uon, helps his wife with the rice cultivation. Mrs. Sem R. is 55 years old and the mother of four children two of whom assist their parents on the plantation while the remaining two are attending school. Mrs. Sas Y. does not come to take the loan because she is busy with her work so her husband comes to take a loan instead so he is presented in the photo.
This is the group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the other one has monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To hire a laborer to sow the rice seeds in order to cultivate rice.

loan.name: Thi Thanh Tam

texts.vi: Tham gia vo Qu tnh thng nm 2003, ngay t vng vn u tin ch Tm s dng u t cho chn nui. Tn dng ngun thc n sn c ca gia nh v kinh nghim chn nui c tch lu trong nhiu nm nn d n cho kt qu rt tt. Cc vng vn tip theo ch Tm u s dng vo chn nui ln, n nay gia nh ch c khu chn nui tiu chun vi khong gn 20 con ln. Hin ti ngoi cng vic chn nui hng ngy ch Tm cn i ch bun bn rau. Cng vic bun bn cng em li ngun thu kh n nh cho gia nh ch. Ch Tm c mt ngi con gi hin ang i lm v c thu nhp n nh 2.000.000/ thng nn hng thng ch u nhn c s h tr thm t con gi. Vi mong mun cuc sng ca gia nh ngy cng n nh v pht trin, ch mong mun c vay thm 15.000.000 u t vo chn nui.
texts.en:
Joined the TYM Fund in 2003, Mrs. Tam used the first loan to raise livestock. With the readily available animal feed in her house and her experiences in raising livestock, the project was very successful. The subsequent loans were also used to invest in rearing pigs. Now, Mrs. Tam's family has a pig sty up to standard with about 20 pigs. Beside raising livestock, Mrs. Tam also sells vegetables in the market everyday. This also brings about a stable income for her family. Mrs. Tam has a daughter who is working with a stable monthly income of 2,000,000VND (about 125USD) so every month, Mrs. Tam receives financial support from her daughter. Wishing to improve her family's standard of living, Mrs. Tam would like to borrow 15,000,000VND (900USD) to invest in raising livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Raising livestock

loan.name: Do Thi

texts.vi: Ch Yn nm nay 25 tui, ch l thnh vin tham gia Qu tnh thng khi tui i cn rt tr. L mt ngi ph n sng vng nng thn nn sau khi lp gia nh cng vic em li thu nhp chnh cho gia nh ch l chn nui v trng trt. Nm 2002 ch xin tham gia vo Qu tnh thng v vay vn u t cho vic chn nui ln. Vi ngun thc n sn c v kinh nghim chn nui hc hi c t cha m, cng vic chn nui em li cho gia nh ch ngun thu n nh. Hin nay ngoi vic chn nui ti gia nh ch Yn cn i ch bun bn rau. Anh Mnh chng ch ngoi thi gian i lm th xy cng dnh thi gian gip ch chm sc hai con nh v th ch Yn cng c iu kin hn chn nui v bun bn. Vi ngun thu nhp n nh 3.000.000/ thng kinh t gia nh ch Yn ngy cng n nh v pht trin, anh ch cng c iu kin hn u t nui dy hai con. Vng vn ti ch mong mun dc vay 19.000.000 u t cho chn nui v bun bn nhm tng thm thu nhp cho gia nh.
texts.en:
Mrs. Y., 25 years old, became a member of the TYM Fund when she was very young. As a woman living in the rural area, after she was married her family's income came mainly from farming and raising livestock. In 2002, she joined the TYM Fund and obtained loans to invest in rearing pigs. With the readily available pig feed at home and the experiences passed down from her parents, Mrs. Y. has been successful, and raising livestock has become a stable source of income for her family. Currently, beside rearing pigs, Mrs. Y. also sells vegetables in the market. Besides working as a construction worker, her husband, Mr. Manh, helps her take care of their two young children so that Mrs. Y. has more time for business. Her family's monthly income is now 3,000,000VND (about 187USD). As such, their financial situation is improving and Mrs. Y. is able to send her children to school. This time, she would like to borrow 19,000,000VND (1,150USD) to invest in raising livestock and selling vegetables, so as to increase her family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Raising livestock

loan.name: Mrs. Toek Hoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank which consists of sixteen people is located in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and Mrs. Toek H. is the village bank president. She owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Sam Nhich, raises one cow and twenty chickens in his house which can assist his wife to support the household. Mrs. Toek H. is 42 years old and the mother of a child, 13, who is enrolled in the local school.
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainL. end-of-term loans. Twelve members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

loan.name: Mr. Youn Im Village Bank Group

texts.en: ElevE. people in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province are involved in a village bank loan. Mr. Youn I. is the village bank president and a firewood merchant in the local village. Since his business is going well, he is requesting a loan to buy more fire wood to re-sell. His wife, Mrs. Hao Sary, raises two cows and thirty chickens. Aside from this business, she owns a small rice mill which brings in some income as well. Mr. Youn I. is 37 years old and the father of four childrE. who are all attending school. Mrs. Mich S. does not come to take a loan, but her husband requests a loan; therefore, she is shown in the picture. This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fire wood to re-sell.

loan.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila Nooren baji, the widow of F. H. Shahzad, lives in Kausr, Pakistan, a city famous for its sweetmeats and its decorative embroidery. She is the mother of four children, three sons and one daughter, all enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.
Having completed her education until 14th standard, she has concentrated on household work and taking care of her children since the death of her husband. Shumailia baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to buy merchandise (soaps, toothpaste, and shampoos) for her elder brother, shown on the right in the photo, a wholesaler by profession.

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia baji, a housewife in Kasur, Pakistan, has lived in her two storey house for the last 55 years. Her husband is retired, having worked for many years as a Circular Officer in the Agriculture Department. They have two sons and two daughters, one son a wholesaler (shown on the left in the photo) and the other a Textile Engineer. Their elder daughter is married with four children while their younger one is getting an education.
Safia baji fully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to buy more merchandise (soaps, shampoos, and edible products) to expand her son's wholesale business.

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela baji is the wife of E. A. and lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats and decorative embroidery. She owns a two-room decorated house. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her daughter is in 3rd standard. Her elder son is in 2nd standard and her younger son is in kindergarten.

Nabeela baji's husband has as a business Installment Corporation. He has in this business various stock (fridges, televisions, mobile sets). He has been in this profession for the last 5 years. Nabeela baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family.

Nabeela baji's husband is a well-known businessman in the community. He keeps good quality stock in his shop. Nabeela baji has successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more stock (television, CD's and specifically handsets) for her husband's business.

loan.use: To buy stock (fridge,CD's and specifically handsets) for her husband's business

loan.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina baji, the wife of G. H., has lived in Kasur, Pakistan, a city famous for its sweetmeats and decorative embroidery, for the past 30 years. She is the mother of six children: five sons and one daughter. Her elder son completed his education until 10th standard and learned how to make decorative embroidered dresses. After making this his profession, he taught his siblings this art. Now they all embroider dresses and sell them in a big market. Sakina baji's husband runs a PCO named "G. H. PCO".
Sakina bajis main job involves household work, and any leisure time is spent helping her children embroider dresses. She has fully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and now is applying for a loan to buy more embroidery materials (clothes, sketches, colored thread and beads) because the Muslim Festival named Eid-ul-Fitar is coming and this is the season for the purchase of embroidered dresses.

loan.use: To buy material needed in the embroidery of dresses

loan.name: Arafa's Mama Imarisha Group

texts.en:
Arafa is 40 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 20. She has been a charcoal and chapati seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7AM to 8PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Arafa now requests a loan to improve her business by increasing her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with charcoal sales, a retail shop, firewood and banana sales.

loan.use: To improve her business by adding her current stock.

loan.name: Sania's Mama Imarisha Group

texts.en: Sania is 29 years old and married with two children, aged 5 and 7 years old. She runs her own shop and she has been a khanga seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales. Sania is now looking for a loan to increase her inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with tailoring, charcoal and firewood sales khanga sales and other businesses.

loan.use: Sania would like to increase her inventory for her business.

loan.name: Maryam's Mama Imarisha Group

texts.en: Maryam is 30 years old and married with two children, aged 5 and 10 years old. She has run her own shop since 2003. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales. Maryam is looking for a loan to buy more more commodities for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with charcoal sales, bites sales and firewood sales.

loan.use: Maryam would like to buy more items for her business.

loan.name: Saiyod

texts.en:
F. Saiyod is 30 years old. He is married with 3 children. Saiyod is an optimistic, hardworking father. He works in his vineyard with love and dedication every day so that it produces excellent fruit.
Saiyod has been in agribusiness for more than 6 years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. Though growing grapes is a very difficult and a time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix the house and save enough money to pay for his kids at school. With this purpose he is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) which he has committed to repay within 9 months. With the desire to realize his plan, Saiyod appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

loan.use: Purchasing of the mineral fertilizer and paying labour power for growing vineyard

loan.name: Kholmurod

texts.en:
L. Kholmurod is 50 years old. He is married with five children. Kholmurod works in the cultivation of rice, wheat and other seasonal vegetables, something he has done since he was young. Thanks to his work, he's been able to provide an adequate education for his beloved children. Kholmurod has a big family. He is also supporting his parents.
This year Kholmurod hopes to get a rich harvest as he is planning to arrange the wedding of his younger son. With this purpose he is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni (900 USD) for the term of 9 months in order to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing wheat, rice and onions. With your help he can grow his business and achieve his goal in a short time.

loan.use: Seeds and mineral fertilizer

loan.name: Behara

texts.en: Behara Jamakovi was born in the town of Stupari in 1964. Behara works in the agriculture and cattle business. Her husband is also employed, earning 400 KM monthly. This is her first loan from WWI in amount of 1000 KM. Behara will use this loan to buy extra fodder to feed her cow during the winter time. She hopes this will help her cow stay healthy as she is waiting for a calf to be born from her cow.

loan.use: To buy food for the cow

loan.name: aha

texts.en: aha Kotori is 50 years old and she is from Tesanj. She is married with two children, and her husband is retired. aha works in a manufacturing company, and she earn 250 KM per month. She also has a cattle business and she is requesting a loan to buy another cow for her cattle business. This is her third loan from WWI in the amount of 1,200 KM.

loan.use: To buy a cow

loan.name: Suvada

texts.en: Suvada Kotori was born in 1959 in the town of Tesanj. She is married with one child. Her husband is employed in manufacturing company and earns 400 KM monthly. This is her third loan from WWI in the amount of 1,200 KM. Suvada will use this loan to buy chickens to resell. Her wish is for her poultry business to be successful so that her family can have a better standard of life.

loan.use: To buy chickens to resell

loan.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba H. lives with her family in the center of Bohtarskiy region. She had been in the business of textile sales for the last 15 years. She has a space in a central market that she uses to sell different textiles. She is married and has 2 children. Matluba plans to obtain a loan for 6 months and use the money to increase her inventory. This will help her to attract new customers and improve her business.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To increase inventory

loan.name: Rummi

texts.en:
Rummi Davlatova lives in the town of Kurgan-Tube. She is 47 years old, married, and has one child. She owns a grocery store "Obi toza." She has been in this business for 20 years. She plans to expand her business, and for that reason, she would like to obtain a loan for $1,000 for 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To expand business

loan.name: Abdumanon

texts.en:
Abdumanon N. is a resident of Bohtar region. He is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children. He has secondary education. Abdumanon is in the business of buying and selling bicycles. He has been in this business for 11 years. This activity is the single main source of income for his family. At this point in time, Abdumanon would like obtain a loan to increase his inventory.

He plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To increase inventory

loan.name: Abdusamad

texts.en:
Abdusamad D. is a resident of Kurgan-Tube. He is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children. He has secondary education. He owns a space in a food market that he uses to sell veggies. At this point in time, he would like to expand his business by purchasing additional supplies for preservation of fruits and vegetables. Then, his customers will be able to purchase not only vegetables, but also other supplies. He plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase jars and lids for food preservation

loan.name: Mrs. Men Leat Village Bank Group

texts.en: The Village Bank which consists of twenty-one people is located in Kandal Kraom Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Men L. is the Village Bank President. Her husband, Mr. S. Sareth, is employed in a small position in Cambodia Public Bank where he makes $150 per month. But, with this income he cannot support his family well because the inflation in Cambodia is too high and he cannot save enough money. Mrs. Men L. is 35 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Since Mrs. Men L.'s house does not have a gate and some of her vegetables are damaged by cattle. She needs a loan to buy wood to make a fence in order to protect her garden. Two men among seven come to take a loan instead of their wives. Mrs. Em Sok K. and Mrs. Son K. are shown in the picture.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to buy wood to make a fence in order to protect animals.

loan.name: Imomkul

texts.en:
Imomkul B. lives in the J. Rumy region. He is 42 years old, is married and has 3 chidren. Imomkul has a high school education. He owns a small sales location at the local market where he sells video and audio tapes. This business is the sole source of income for his family. At this moment, Imomkul would like to increase the product selection at his sales location. He has decided to take out a 12 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase product selection

loan.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
Gavhar J. lives in the J. Rumy region. She is 27 years old, is married and has 5 children. Gavhar has a high school education. She has a sales location at the local market, where she sells childrens clothing. She purchases products from wholesalers and resells them at retail prices. This business is the main source of income for her family. Gavhar would like to purchase seasonal clothing for sale. She has decided to take out a 12 month loan in order to do this.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase seasonal clothing

loan.name: Hosiyat

texts.en:
Hosiyat N. lives in the J. Rumy region. She is 42 years old, is a widow and has 4 children. Hosiyat has a high school education. She has a sales location at the local market where she sells bicycle parts. This business is the main source of income for her large family. Right now, she would like to purchase products from wholesalers. Hosiyat plans to pay back her loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase additional products for sale

loan.name: Mrs. Meas Sophea Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-two people in Kandal Kraom Village in Kandal Province have formed a village bank loan and plan to use the loan for different purposes.
