Mrs. Meas S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Leng Yi, is an ice-cream seller in the local village. In his business, he now faces a small problem because his ice-cream box is too old which can affect his products so he wants to buy a new one. Therefore, his wife, Mrs. Meas S. decided to ask for a loan to buy it for her husband. Mrs. Meas S. is 42 years old and the mother of five children two of whom are employed in a garment factoR. while other two are attending. The youngest one is too young to work or study at three years old.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to buy ice-cream box to replace the old one.

loan.name: Sohib

texts.en:
Sohib K. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 63 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a secondary education and grows melons for a living. Every year he grows watermelons and cantaloupes on his plot of land. This years harvest was especially good. This is why Sohib wants to rent a truck and bring his harvest to the city. He plans to obtain a loan and repay it within 12 months. If he sells his harvest in a timely manner, then he will be able to sow wheat.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To rent a truck

loan.name: Mrs. Nuon Ret Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nuon R. is the group leader of four who live in Phum Thmei Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. For instance, Mrs. Nuon R. is a farmer and she will use the loan to purchase fertilizers to support her plantation because her rice field now has infertile soil. Besides this business, she also sews palm leaves together to process into thatches to sell. Mrs. Nuon R. is a 56-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a motorbike taxi driver who can generate $3 per day. The other one, 16, is attending the local school.
Four members have end-of-term loans and these members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizers to support her plantation.

loan.name: Diouf

texts.fr: A. diouf est ne le 10 mars 1956 Kandiar dans le dpartement de Bambey.Elle est marie et vit dans la commune de Bambey.Elle s'active dans le commerce de lgumes depuis trois ans.Avec ce pret elle renforce son capital pour une meilleur rentabilit.
texts.en:
Diouf A. was born on March 10, 1956 in Kandiar in the Bambey department. She is married and lives in the Bambey village. She has been in the business of selling vegetables for three years. With this loan, she will reinforce her capital for better profitability.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Vegetable sales

loan.name: Tuhtashkul

texts.en:
Tuhtashkul M. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 51 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a vocational education and is an accountant by trade. He works at a secondary school. Since his salary is very low, Tuhtashkul has been involved in agriculture. He plants corn on his plot of land. He utilizes part of the harvest as food for his domestic animals and chickens, and sells any excess at a local market. Currently, Tuhtashkul wants to purchase corn and wheat seeds needed for fall sowing. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy corn and wheat seeds

loan.name: Roziya

texts.en:
Roziya A. lives in the Khuroson district. She is 32 years old, married and has 4 children. She grows vegetables with the help of her husband. She sells her harvest at a local market for profit. This business helps her support her family. Currently, Roziya wants to purchase seeds and vegetable seedlings. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase vegetable seedlings

loan.name: Mr. Khut Khum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people in Chrey Kaong Lich Village in Kampong ChhnA. Province make up the village bank loan and they plan to use it for multiple purposes. Mr. Khut K. is the village bank president and he is a palm juice collector who gathers palm juice to process into palm wine or sugar. Aside from this business activity, he is a fisherman in the local lake. His wife, Mrs. Suong Mom raises three cows and two pigs. Since her cows and pigs grow bigger every day, Mrs. Suong does not have enough money to buy grass for the cows and pig food for the pigs. Thus, Mr. Khut K. decided to ask for a loan for his wife. Mr. Khut K. is 26 years old and the father of a four year old child who is too young to work or attend school. Mr. Phon S. and Mr. Chea P. could not come to take the loan but their wives came to take the loan instead so they are in the picture.
Twelve members have end-of-term loans and these members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main policy because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To buy grass for the cows and pig food for the pigs.

loan.name: Dioum

texts.fr: M. Dioum est ne le 03 mars 1955 bambey.Elle vit au quartier DVF avec sa famille et s'active dans le commerce de chaussures depuis six ans.Ce pret lui permet de mieux prparer la ftes de Korit et la Rentre des Classes.
texts.en:
Dioum M. was born on March 3, 1955 in Bambey. She lives in the DVF district with her family. She has been in the business of selling shoes for six years. This loan will allow her to be better prepared for the Ramadan Holiday and the start of the school year.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Shoe sales

loan.name: Thi Huong's Group

texts.vi:
ch C. th Hng Ms 01030017 nm nay 32 tui, ch l mt ph n rt nng ng v ho ng vi mi ngi, cng vic bn hoa ti nn lc no cng bn rn, cng vi vic chm sc 2 con i hc, chng ch lm cng an x nn khng gip ch c nhiu trong cng vic ga nh. Nhng mi khi ngi dn n mua hng, u nhn thy v my lun ti ci cho n, v vy ca hng nh ch lc no cng ng khch n mua nht l vo dp l tt. Thu nhp ca gia nh ch ngy cng n nh hn trc t 150.000 VND n 170.000 VND/ ngy. Ch cng nhm tham gia vay vn qua 2 C. k v hon tr rt tt, ln ny ch ng k vay tip C. k III vi mc vay 5.152.000 VND mua hoa, giy trang tr m ci, m rng hng knh mt nhm thu ht nhiu khch hn. Cc thnh vin trong nhm ch :

  • ch Nguyn th Minh Ms 01030018 vay mc 5.152.000 VND kinh doanh in thoi
  • ch L th H Ms 01030019 vay mc 5.152.000 VND kinh doanh chn ga gi m
  • ch ng th Hoa Ms 01030020 vay mc 5.152.000 VND kinh doanh in thoi di ng
  • ch Tng hng Xuyn Ms 01030021 vay mc 5.152.000 VND kinh doanh o ci
  • ch Nghim th Thnh Ms 01030022 vay mc 5.152.000 VND u t vo ca hng giy dp.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. Thi Huong (ID: 01030017), aged 32, is a very active and sociable woman. Mrs. Huong is very busy, as she sells flowers in the farmer market as well as takes care of her two children. Her husband is a local police, so he is very busy too and isnt able to help her much with all the family work. Mrs. Huongs flower shop is relatively popular in the area, especially during the Lunar New Year and festivals. The daily income of the family is about 150.000-170.000 VND. Mrs. Huong and her groups members have been very on time in paying back the loans of the previous round. In the next round of loan, Mrs. Huong would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to buy more flowers, decoration papers for wedding to expand her business. Other members in her group include: -Mrs. N. Thi Minh (ID: 01030018) would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to open a small shop selling telephones. -Mrs. Le Thi Ha (ID: 01030019) would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to open a small shop selling blankets and pillows. -Mrs. Dang Thi Hoa (ID: 01030020) would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to open a small shop selling cell phones. -Mrs. T. Hong Xuyen (ID: 01030021) would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to open a shop selling wedding dresses. -Mrs. N. Thi Hanh (ID: 01030022) would like to borrow 5.152.000 VND to open a shop selling footwear.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Vay vn bun bn

loan.name: Mrs. Ngen Saroeurn Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen members in Phlov Veay Village in Kampong Chhnang Province makeup the village bank loan. Mrs. Nhen S., 59, is the village bank president. She is a rice and palm sugar middleman who buys rice and palm sugar to keep in stock and sell later at a better price. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice and sugar to keep in stock. Her husband, Mr. Vong Soeurn, is a village chief who can make a small income to support his famiL.. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main policy because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To buy more rice and sugar to keep in stock than re-sell later at a better price.

loan.name: Mr. Neum Vannak Group

texts.en: Mr. Neum V. is the group leader of four entrepenuers who are all live in Trapaing Orn Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mr. Neum V. is a cow breeder who raises four cows to sell at market. His wife, Mrs. Chea Phearun, owns a small store where she sells pots in the local village. Her business is thriving, and she wants to expand, so part of the loan will be used to buy more pots for her business. This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans which means they will repay the loan in a single payment at the end of the loan term. However, most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To buy more pots for re-selling.

loan.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena S. is 38 years old. She is married and has two children. Two of her kids are still in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, pastries which she prepares herself, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits etc. to people from her neighborhood.

With the loan, Abena wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc., to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. Abena S. belongs to the Trust group called Lydia Mma Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to the loan and support one another to repay the loan. (Her picture was taken when she was visited at her shop.)

loan.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water, and boxes of biscuits, etc.

loan.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Saliou N. est n le 14 janvier 1988 Bambey.Il est clibataire et vit avec ses parents.son activit consiste vendre des produits alimentaires en boutique.Son souhait c'est de pouvoir renforcer une boutique d'alimentation gnral dans les prochains jours avec ce financement.
texts.en:
Saliou N. was born on January 14, 1988 in Bambey. He is single and lives with his parents. He is in the business of selling general food products in a store. His wish is that he will be able to strengthen his general food store within the coming days with this loan.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Sale of general food items

loan.name: Mrs. Lach Yen Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twelve people in Chrolong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province make up the village bank. Mrs. Lach Y. is the group leader and she is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. She is a 45-year-old widow with five children who are all attending the local school. Mrs. Lach Y.'s family now lives in poor conditions. In order to improve her standard of living, Mrs. Lach Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income with this new loan. All of the members have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main policy because they are most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary D. is a widow and mother of six grown-up children, with four of them fully independent and the other two currently in school. She is fifty-three years old and an energetic businesswoman who sells charcoal, cooking oil, bags of rice, etc.

Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. With her 22 years of experience in her business, she has supported four of her children to complete senior high school.

Mary obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Obuasi and retails it to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more charcoal, cooking oil, and bags of rice, etc. to increase her stock. She believes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to provide for the educational needs of her children. She belongs to the trust group called "Odo ne Asomdwei" meaning Love and Peace Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support to one another to repay the loan

loan.use: To buy more charcoal, cooking oil, and bags of rice, etc.

loan.name: Allanazar

texts.en:
Allanazar A. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 53 years old, is married and has 7 children. Allanazar has a high school education. For over 15 years he has been purchasing and reselling livestock. He purchases young calves at the local market, fattens them over 45 days and sells them for a profit. This business helps Allanazar to support his large family. Allanazar would like to purchase two calves and has decided to take out a 12 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase two calves

loan.name: Tanjigul

texts.en:
Tanjigul H. lives in the Khuroson region. She is 60 years old, is married and has 2 children. Tanjigul has been raising livestock for 20 years. Right now she does not own a dairy cow. She has decided to take out a 12 month loan to purchase a cow in order to provide her family with fresh milk and dairy products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loan.name: Mamuna

texts.en:
Mamuna S. is married with five children who have completed school. She is a 44-year-old businesswoman. She started in commerce six years ago, and she enjoys selling goods. She sells clothing materials and used clothes.

Mamuna believes in hard work and dedication. She has gained lots of marketing experience, making her one of the more successful traders in Obuasi market. She believes the loan would provide her more with capital to purchase more stocks of clothing materials to serve her customers. Mamuna S. belongs to the group called Gift Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide support for one another to repay the loan.

loan.use: To purchase more stocks of clothing materials and used clothes.

loan.name: Mrs. Hur Tonn Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Hur T. is the president of the village bank. This village bank consists of nine people who are all live in Chrolong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Hur T. is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Toem Sareth, is a fisherman in the local lake. Aside from this business, he breeds pigs and cows. In Mr. Toem Sareth's fishing business, he does not have enough money to buy fishing equipment so his wife, Mrs. Hur T., decided to ask for a loan for her husband to buy the equipment. Mrs. Hur T. is a 54-year-old mother without any children. This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fishing equipments to catch fish.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T. is 36 years old and a mother with three children. The children are currently in school. Selling of used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothos, shoes and other materials are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, selling of used clothing and shoes has created a market for many women like Mary.

With the loan, she wants to buy more bales of used clothing and shoes to increase her inventory. She believes this loan could help her save for her children's future and also to rent a store to sell out of. She is a member of the trust group called Winners. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loan.use: to buy bales of used clothing, used shoes, etc.

loan.name: Urozali

texts.en:
Urozali B. lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 54 years old, is married and has 5 children. Urozali has a high school education. He plants wheat on his plot of land. Every year he has a decent harvest, which he then sells at the local market. Right now, Urozali would like to take out a loan to purchase wheat seeds and to get the land ready for planting. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, to pay for a tractor rental and to pay for fuel. He plans to pay back the loan over 10 months. Urozali has a big family and in addition to growing wheat they also have an orchard and grow apples. This provides them with an additional source of income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase wheat seeds and prepare land for planting

loan.name: Mrs. Ban Sok's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people in Chrolong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province form a village bank [solidarity group]. The group members will use the loan in different ways. Mrs. Ban S. is the village bank president, and she raises three pigs and four cows. Because her animals are growing very fast now and she does not have enough money to purchase more food to feed them, Mrs. Ban S. decided to ask for a loan. Her husband, Mr. Kong Teng, helps his wife with the business. Mrs. Ban S. is a 34-year-old woman without any children.

Mrs. Yin G. L. did not come to receive her loan. Her husband came for her instead, so he is presented in the picture.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Ten members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. The product allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK [Kivas Field Partner] has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loan.use: To buy pig food to feed her pigs

loan.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul S. lives in the Vakhsh region. She is 28 years old, is married and has 4 children. Jumagul grows vegetables. She has a small plot of land where she plants vegetables and greens every year. Jumagul sells her harvest at the local market. This business helps her to support her family. At the moment, Jumagul want to purchase vegetable seedlings. She will pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase vegetable seedlings

loan.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika is an entrepreneur from the small town of Korolyovo. She owns a nice little store selling souvenirs and gifts. Erika makes a good profit and always has many clients as there is little competition in the area. Erika has been in this sphere of trade for about 5 years. Presently, she is getting about US$ 1000 in income. Over US$ 10,000 is invested in inventory.

One of the most positive characteristics of her venture is stability. Financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine has added much to growing the sustainability of her enterprise. Today Erika is hoping to get a 3000 Grivna loan to increase the assortment of merchandise and earn extra profit as a result. The loan will be a big help to Erika as she is a widow and has to rely on herself alone in terms of providing a decent living.

loan.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loan.name: Kenjagul

texts.en:
Kenjagul E. lives in the Vakhsh region. She is 25 years old, is married and has 3 children. Kenjagul grows wheat. She has more than 2 years of experience in this area. After harvesting the wheat, Kenjagul does not need to purchase flour from the market for an entire year. At the moment she would like to purchase seeds for wheat planting. Kenjagul plans to pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase wheat seeds

loan.name: Radhika

texts.en: Radhika S. is 52 years old and lives in Kritipur, Kathmandu. Kritipur is a developing city of Kathmandu. She lives with her husband, Ram Krishna S., and their two daughters. Their eldest daughter is studying BBS second year and another daughter is studying in 10+2 class. Radhika's husband works in a private office, but the family's income is not enough to meet their basic needs. Radhika opened her grocery business 8 years ago and seeks a loan of Rs. 30,000 ($425 USD) to buy more rice, biscuits, noodles and other items to meet the demand of her customers. She wants to earn money for her daughters' education and also to raise the standard of living for her family.

loan.use: To purchase grocery items for her shop

loan.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina runs a small enterprise in a local market of Shidnitsya, Western Ukraine. She sells sportswear and underwear. Galina has been actively involved in this business for the past two and a half years. Currently, she has over $5000 in gross income.

Galina has an enterprising spirit. She is a thorough planner, very punctual and active. One of her long-term plans is to open another vending stand in the market. Galina believes a current increase of assorted merchandise will help her develop her trade consistently and move her one step further in her business progress. Galina is now requesting a 3000 Grivna loan.

Note: This is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loan.use: To re-stock inventory

loan.name: Narayan Devi

texts.en:
Narayan Devi M., 40 years old, lives in Kritipur, Kathmandu. She lives in a nuclear family with her 45-year-old husband Sri Krishna M. and two sons who are studying in grades 11 and 12 respectively. Her husband works in a private office.

Her economic condition was so weak that she could hardly fulfill the basic needs of her family. So she opened her tailoring shop five years ago. Other tailoring shops are not available near her shop. The number of her customers is increasing by day, so she seeks a loan of Rs. 25000/- to buy another machine and employ a tailor to meet the demand of her customers. She will be happy if she earns more to spend for her children's education and for the betterment of her family.

loan.use: To buy another sewing machine

loan.name: Jasminka

texts.en:
Jasminka is 54 years old and she is from Lukavac. She is married and her husband is employed. Her husband helps her with paying for household expenses and school for their daughter. He earns 680 KM a month. Jasminka sells milk and milk products and in this way she earn about 150 KM monthly.

This is her first loan with Women for Women International in the amount of 600 KM. She will use this loan to buy a calf for reselling. She has her own food for cattle, which she produces in her field. Her wish is to buy more cattle for reselling.

loan.use: To buy a calf

loan.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Kanchi L., 40 years old, lives in Kritipur, Kathmandu. She lives in a single family with her husband, Hira Lal L., and two sons. They are studying in grade 9 and BBS 1 year respectively. Her husband has no work and is also not educated.

She opened her vegetable shop 3 years ago. Both of them work in her small vegetable shop. Her condition is miserable and she is unable to run her house smoothly. She seeks a loan of RS.20000/- to invest in her vegetable shop. She wants to earn money to provide a quality education for their sons and fulfill their basic needs.

loan.use: To invest in her vegetable shop

loan.name: Nigina

texts.en:
Nigina M. lives in the Vakhsh region. She is 38 years old, is married and has 5 children. Nigina has a high school education. She grows wheat and her large and united family helps her. At the moment, Nigina is getting ready for the next wheat planting. She needs to borrow money to purchase quality seeds. Nigina plans to pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase wheat seeds

loan.name: Bobomurod

texts.en:
Bobomurod H. lives in Vakhsh. He is 51 years old, married, and has five children. The client is engaged in agriculture. He has a field near his home where he grows vegetables and herbs. The income he receives from this supports his large family. Currently, he wants to buy mineral fertilizers in order to harvest a high-quality crop. He needs money for this. He plans to pay off the loan in ten months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: buying fertilizer

loan.name: Laxmi

texts.en: Laxmi Chitrakar, 40 years old, lives in Kritipur, Kathmandu. She lives in a joint family with 7 members and her husband, Dhumi Chitrakar, their mother, two daughters, and two sons. She opened a small tea and snack shop. She and her husband work together in her shop. Her family's income is not enough to fulfill their needs. She needs a loan to expand her business to earn more and supply her family's basic needs. She seeks Rs. 20000/- to purchase more chairs, tables and utensils for her shop. She wants to to earn more to provide a quality education to her children.

loan.use: To purchase more chairs, tables and others

loan.name: Mastura

texts.en:
Mastura T. lives in the Vakhsh district. She is 35 years old, married and has 5 children. She has a secondary education. Mastura has been practicing agriculture for more than 2 years. Her family has a plot of land where they grow wheat. They store the harvest to last through the year and barter any excess for food products, such as butter and grains. Currently, Mastura wants to buy wheat seeds for the upcoming sowing season. She plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase wheat seeds

loan.name: Kamala

texts.en: Kamala T. M., 40 years old, lives in Kritipur, Kathmandu. She lives in a single family with her husband, Khim Bhadur M., and two daughters who are studying in grade 10 and 2. Her husband went abroad for work last year. Her family condition is very weak, so she opened a tea and snacks shop a year ago. She plans to buy a refrigerator for cold drinks like Coke and juic , as well as snacks. She seeks loan of Rs 30000/- for her shop.

loan.use: To buy a refrigerator

loan.name: Adolat

texts.en:
Adolat H. lives in the Vakhsh district. She is 38 years old, married and has 5 children. She has a secondary education. Adolat, like many Vakhsh citizens, practices agriculture and grows wheat, which is a very valuable product to her people. Every year she sows wheat on her small plot of land. Once she gathers the harvest, Adolat grinds wheat into flour. Throughout the year, she bakes flatbread and feeds her children. Currently, Adolat wants to obtain a loan in order to purchase wheat seeds. She plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase wheat seeds

loan.name: Sobirjon

texts.en:
Sobirjon A. is a resident of the Vakh region. He is 40 years old, married and has 5 children. Sobirjon has a high school degree and has been growing wheat for more then 5 years for a living. As the market price for flour is very high and bread is the main food staple in Sobirjon's household, he has been growing his own wheat. In years when he has a good harvest Sobirjon is also able to sell some of the grain to his neighbors, which supplements the family's income. Sobirjon wants to ensure a good harvest and would like to purchase good quality seeds for the next year. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of wheat seeds

loan.name: Mahmadali

texts.en:
Mahmadali H. is a resident of the Vakh region. He is 25 years old, single and has a high school degree. Mahmadali lives with his retired parents. He owns a small plot of land where he grows wheat every year and then sells the grain at the local market. By growing his own wheat he can also avoid buying flour at the market. Currently Mahmadali wants to take out a loan to finance the purchase of quality wheat seeds and fertilizer to assure a good harvest next year. He is planning to pay back this loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of wheat seeds and fertilizer

loan.name: Senada

texts.en:
Senada Salki was born in 1983 and she is from Lukavac. She produces vegetables in a greenhouse, together with her mother. Now is the season of tomatoes and they are expecting good income from selling this produce.

Also, Senada sells cosmetics and she earns about 100 KM monthly. This is her first loan through WWI in the amount of 600 KM and she will buy a new nylon for the greenhouse. In this way, her greenhouse will be ready for the new season. Her wish is to create conditions for producing vegetables the whole year round and not just in season.

loan.use: To buy nylon for her greenhouse

loan.name: Ibrohim

texts.en:
Ibrohim S. is a resident of the Vakh region. He is 37 years old, married and has 5 children. Ibrohim has a high school degree and for the last 3 years has been making a living repairing trucks. This business is the main source of income for his large family. Ibrohim's repair equipment has become old and he would like to purchase new, more modern tools. To finance this purchase Ibrohim wants to take out this loan which he plans to pay back in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of equipment

loan.name: Hosiyat

texts.en:
Hosiyat K. lives in Vakhsh. She is 51, married, and has four children. She has a high school education. The client has, for the past fifteen years, cultivated wheat. After harvest, she stores a years worth and takes the rest to market. Agriculture is the fundamental source of income for this big family since baked bread is very expensive at the market. Currently, Hosiyat wants to buy high-quality wheat seed and petroleum products (gasoline and motor oil). She plans to pay off the loan in twelve 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: buying high-quality wheat seed and petroleum products

loan.name: Achetou

texts.fr: Achetou A. est ge de 41 ans, marie et mre de 4 enfants. Revendeuse des lgumes et dpices, elle habite Kpalim, une ville situe environ 120 kilomtres de Lom la capitale togolaise. Achetou dsire, par ce crdit, sapprovisionner en diverses lgumes afin de rpondre aux besoins pressants de la clientle
texts.en:
Achetou A., 41, is married and the mother of 4 children. She sells vegetables and spices and lives in Kpalim, a town situated about 120 km from Lom, the capital of Togo. Achetou wants to use this loan to stock up on various vegetables so as to meet the pressing needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy vegetables and spices for resale

loan.name: Nassirou

texts.fr: Nassirou O. est g de 39 ans, mari et pre de 3 enfants tous lcole. Revendeur dhuile moteur et de ptrole lampant depuis plus de 3 ans, Nassirou habite Kpalim, une ville situe 120 kilomtres de Lom, la capitale togolaise. Il aimerait par ce troisime crdit de FECECAV, augmenter la capacit de son commerce en achetant des bidons de carburant afin de pouvoir satisfaire la demande de la clientle. Il compte sur cette opportunit pour amliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
At 39 years old, Nassirou O. is married and the father of three (3) children who all attend school. He has been a retailer of motor oil and kerosene for the last three (3) years. Nassirou lives in Kpalime, a town located approximately 120 Kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. This is his third loan from FECECAV and with it he would like to increase the size of his business, buying drums of fuel to meet his customer demands. He is expecting with this opportunity to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of motor oil and kerosene for resale

loan.name: Claire

texts.fr: Claire B. est ge de 38 ans, marie et mre de 2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse ambulante de pagnes Kpalim, une ville situe environ 120 kilomtres de Lom, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce crdit sapprovisionner en pagnes afin de rpondre aux besoins de la clientle et aussi louer une pice afin de pouvoir exposer ses marchandises. Cette opportunit lui permettra de mieux gagner sa vie
texts.en:
Claire B. is 38 years old, married and the mother of two (2) children. She sells "pagne" (decorative cloth) door-to-door in Kplime, a town located about 120 kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. With this loan she plans to purchase sufficient pagne to meet the needs of her customers and to rent a stall to exhibit her merchandise. This opportunity would allow her to improve her income.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of "pagne" (decorative cloth) and fabrics for resale

loan.name: Tamir Group

texts.en:
Tamir Group is composed of two dedicated women living in a small village in the area of Hasbaya, located in the South of Lebanon. The women of Tamir make "Saj" (traditionA. Lebanese bread). This delicious bread is very popular with their clients. Typically, it is made fresh on a large dome-shaped grill. It is used by families and businesses alike to make many types of famous Lebanese sandwiches or it is dipped in spreads like hummus or baba ghanoush. The work of these women is therefore vitA. to the day-to-day lives of Hasbaya residents. Each woman of the group has requested a loan of $300 in order to finance the purchase of more raw materials for their bread-making businesses.

Hanyah is 63 years old and is a member of the Tamir group. Hanyah has requested a loan of $300 to finance the purchase of more flour and other ingredients for her bread-making business. This purchase will allow Hanyah to increase the amount of bread she can produce. This is a second time Hanyah has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

Abir is 31 years old, single, and is also a member of the Tamir group. Abir has similarly requested $300 to improve her business. This is the second time Abir has asked for a loan from A. Majmoua.

loan.use: To purchase new machinery and supplies for making bread

loan.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa S. est revendeuse de pagnes depuis 3 ans Kpalim, une ville situe environ 120 kilomtres de Lom, la capitale togolaise. Age de 38 ans, elle est marie et mre de 3 enfants. Awa espre avec ce deuxime crdit, acheter des pagnes et des tissus pour la revente. Ceci va lui permettre daugmenter son chiffre daffaire et par consquent ses profits, source damlioration de conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Awa S. has been selling "pagne" (decorative cloth) for three (3) years in Kpalime, a town located about 120 kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. Awa is 38 years old, married and a mother of three (3) children. With this second loan she plans to buy pagne and other fabrics for resale. This will allow her to increase her business volume and therefore her profits and improve her lifestyle.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of "pagne" (decorative cloth) and other fabrics for resale

loan.name: Camilia

texts.en: Camilia is 53 years old, single, and lives in a small village near Habaya in Southern Lebanon. Camilia is an active member of the group A. Namla, which means "the ant" in Arabic. Camila's ambitions, however, are certainly not ant-like. She has requested a loan of $200 to open a new business selling clothes. This is the first time Camila has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loan.use: Purchase stock of clothes to open retail business

loan.name: Ewoevi

texts.fr: Ewoevi K. est ge de 45 ans, marie et mre de 4 enfants tous lcole. Elle est revendeuse, de puis plus de 7 ans, de crales Adeta, un village situ environ 150 kilomtres de Lom, la capitale togolaise. Elle dsire par ce troisime crdit de FECECAV, augmenter la capacit de son commerce en achetant des sacs de mas, de mils, dharicots et darachides pour viter les ruptures de stocks. Ces tonneaux dans la vue lui permettent de stocker ses marchandises. Elle compte sur cette chance pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ewoevi K. is 45 years old, married, and a mother of 4 children, who all go to school. She has been a reseller for more than 7 years, in Adeta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lom, the capital of Togo. She would like to use this third loan from FECECAV to increase the capacity of her business by buying bags of corn, millet, beans, and peanuts in order to avoid running out of stock. Having these barrels on hand will allow her to stock her merchandise. She is counting on this chance to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to buy bags of corn, millet, beans, and peanuts

loan.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta tiene 5 hijos de 16, 13, 7, 5 y 3 aos de edad, su esposo trabaja en el rea rural como agricultor. Ella y los nios viven en la calle Sgto de Munaypata de la zona villa Cooperativa en la ciudad de El Alto.
Su oficio es la compra de ovejas en el rea rural, animales que luego vende en la feria semanal de la zona, igualmente, realiza tejidos a mano para obtener mayores ingresos.
El crdito lo destinar en la compra de ganado.
Es su segundo crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada la califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Modesta has five children of 16, 13, 7, 5, and 3 years of age. Her husband works in a rural area as a farmer. She and the children live on Sgto de Munaypata street in the "villa Cooperativa" zone in the city of El Alto.

Her craft is the purchase of sheep in rural area, animals that she later sells in the weekly market in the area, also, she makes textiles by hand to make more income.

The loan will be allocated to the purchase of livestock.

This is her second loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Business Capital

loan.name: Maritza Maxima

texts.es:
Maritza Q. vive en la zona de villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto con sus padres e hijos de 18, 12 y 9 respectivamente los cuales estudian en una escuela fiscal de la zona. No tiene casa propia.
Tiene un puesto frente a un colegio de la zona donde vende dulces por las maanas y por las tardes tiene un trabajo en la misma zona donde confecciona chamarras.
El crdito lo destinara como capital de trabajo.
Es su segundo crdito con Impro, dado que ambas ocupaciones le reportan beneficios, es una persona apta para recibir un crdito.
texts.en:
Maritza Q. lives in the area of Villa Cooperativa in the city of El Alto with her parents and children of 18, 12, and 9 years of age, respectively. They study in the local school. She does not have her own house.

She has a stand in front of a high school in the area where she sells sweets in the mornings and, in the afternoons, she has a job working in the same area where she makes jackets.

The loan will be allocated as capital for her work.

This is her second loan with Impro, given that both jobs give her profits, she is a person likely to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Business Capital

loan.name: Maria Claudia

texts.es: Maria B. tiene dos hijos de 14 y 12 aos de edad respectivamente. Vive en la calle 24 de junio de la zona villa Esperanza, ciudad de El Alto. La familia paga el alquiler de una habitacin, por lo que no tienen suficiente comodidad, no obstante, su negocio de compra-venta de ropa usada y comercializacin de animales le permiten subsistir. Por lo que solicita capital de trabajo. Es su primer crdito con Impro y es apta para recibir su ayuda.
texts.en:
Maria B. has two children of 14 and 12 years of age, respectively. She lives on "24 de junio" street in the villa Esperanza zone, city of El Alto. The family pays rent for a room and because of this they don't have sufficient comfort. Nevertheless, her business of buying-selling used clothing and the sale of animals allows her to survive. It is for this that she requests capital for her work.

This is her first loan with Impro and she is likely to receive her help.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Business Capital

loan.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene G. es casado, tiene dos hijos de 4 y 2 aos respectivamente. La familia vive en la calle Sucre de la zona Rio seco en la ciudad de El Alto. Rene es conductor de minibs y tambin se dedica a la carpintera. Solicita crdito para comprar repuestos para su vehculo. Es su primer crdito en Impro y nuestras evaluaciones indican que puede recibir su ayuda.
texts.en:
Rene G. is married and has two sons, who are 4 and 2 years of age respectively. The family lives on Sucre Street in the Rio Seco neighborhood in the city of El Alto. Rene is a mini-bus driver and also works in carpentry. He is applying for a loan to purchase parts for his vehicle. It is his first credit in Impro and our evaluations indicate that he can receive your help.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Mini-Bus Maintenance

loan.name: Rosario Alejandra

texts.es: Rosario M. es soltera y vive en la avenida Santsima Trinidad de la zona villa Cooperativa en la ciudad de El Alto, junto a sus padres. Es enfermera en un hospital de la ciudad. Solicita crdito para pagar sus estudios de post grado. Es su primer crdito en Impro, pero a diferencia de otros clientes, su ocupacin laboral es ms estable por lo que aseguramos todo tipo de garanta.
texts.en:
Rosario M. is single and lives with her parents on Santsima Trinidad Avenue in the Cooperativa neighborhood of the city of El Alto. She is a nurse in a city hospital. She is applying for a loan to pay for her post-graduate studies. It is her first credit with Impro, but her occupation is more stable than other clients, which is why we are sure of her collateral.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Payment of Post-Graduate Studies

loan.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children. She is part of the "Yamen" solidarity group, a lending group of women living in Hasbaya, which is situated in the South of Lebanon. Leila sells Tupperware items to the families and businesses of the surrounding region. The larger the stock purchase that she makes, the bigger the discount she will receive, and thus Leila has requested a loan of $500 to finance this investment in her business. Her children describe her as a courageous mother and her entire family has confidence in her ability to successfully expand her operations. This is the third time Leila has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loan.use: Purchase new supply of Tupperware for retail

loan.name: Veronica

texts.es: Vernica B. vive en la calle Sgto de Munaypata de la zona villa Cooperativa en la ciudad de El Alto, junto a sus padres y su marido quien actualmente esta prestando el servicio militar. Vernica se dedica a la compra de ovejas en el rea rural, las cuales ella vende en las ferias semanales. Por lo que requiere crdito para comprar ms ganado. Es su segundo crdito en Impro, pueden confiar plenamente en ella.
texts.en:
Vernica B. lives on the Sgto de Munaypata Street in the Cooperativa neighborhood of the city of El Alto together with her parents and her husband who is currently serving in the military. Vernica works purchasing sheep in the rural area, which she sells at the weekly markets. She requires a loan to purchase more livestock. This is her second loan with Impro and you can trust fully in her.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose A. vive en la zona de villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto con sus abuelos, su madre y sus hermanas de 12 y 9 aos respectivamente.
Trabaja en un taller de tallado de muebles de lunes a sbado desde las 8:30 hasta las 17:00.
El crdito lo destinara para compra de maquinaria de carpintera, lo cual le permitir tener su propio taller en su domicilio.
Es su primer crdito con Impro, el emprendimiento de Jos no tiene riesgo, al contrario, le presenta la oportunidad de completa independencia, por lo que esta calificado para recibir el dinero.
texts.en:
Jose A. lives in the Cooperativa neighborhood of the city of El Alto with his grandparents, his mother and his sisters, who are 12 and 9 years old respectively. He works in a furniture carving workshops Monday to Saturday from 8:30 - 17:00. The loan will go towards the purchase of carpentry machinery, which will allow him to have his own workshop in his home. It is his first loan with Impro. Joses enterprise does not have risk, but instead presents the opportunity of complete independence, which is why he is qualified to receive the money.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. As part of the Yamen solidarity group, Samar sells lingerie to the women of her region. Samar has requested a loan of $600 to purchase more merchandise and to diversify her inventory of goods. Samar has been a micro-credit client of A. Majmoua for the past 3 years and has always repaid her debts on time.

loan.use: Help to diversify her stock of clothing

loan.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa M. vive en la zona de villa cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto con su hijo de 12 aos, el cual estudia en una escuela fiscal de la zona. Tiene su casa propia hecha de adobe.
La Sra. Comercializa chuo y tunta en la poblacin de Senkata los fines de semana en la feria, adems vende queso el cual elabora todos los das de la leche de sus ganados.
El crdito lo destinara para capital de trabajo.
Es su segundo crdito con Impro, los exhortamos a confiar en ella
texts.en:
Luisa M. lives in the Cooperativa neighborhood in the city of El Alto with her 12 year old son who studies in a local school. She has her own house which is made of adobe. She sells products derived from potatoes, chuo and tunta, in the Senkata weekend market in addition to cheese that she makes everyday with the milk from her cows. This loan will goes towards working capital. It is her second loan with Impro and we urge you to trust her.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto I. es divorciado, vive solo y paga el alquiler de una habitacin ubicada en la avenida Unin Ftima de la zona villa Cooperativa, ciudad de El Alto.
Se dedica a la compra-venta de moneda extranjera en el centro de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crdito lo destinara para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
Es su primer crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crdito.
texts.en:
Alberto I. is divorced. He lives alone and pages to rent a home located in Unin Ftima Avenue in the zone Villa Cooperativa, in the city of El Alto. He works buying and selling foreign money in the center of the city La Paz. This loan would be used to increase his working capitol. This is his first loan with Impro, the test evaluated him as qualified to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working Capitol

loan.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana Q. C. es casada y tiene dos hijos (3 y 6 aos de edad). Vive en un pequeo departamento en la C. 3 de la zona 23 de Marzo en la ciudad de El Alto.
Trabaja como ayudante en el minibs, el cual conduce su esposo.
El crdito ser destinado para adquirir llantas para el vehiculo.
Es su primer crdito con Impro, los resultados de nuestra evaluacin indican que puede acceder al prstamo.
texts.en:
Juana Q. C. is married and has two children (3 and 6 years of age). She lives in a small district on street "3" in the "23 de Marzo" zone in the city of El Alto.

She works as an assistant in the minibus that her husband drives.

Her loan will be allocated to acquire tires for the vehicle.

This is her first loan with Impro. The results of our evaluation indicate that she is qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Vehicle Maintenance

loan.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentn M. tiene casa propia en la zona de Munaipata, ladera norte de esta ciudad. Valentin es casado y tiene 3 hijas.
Su ocupacin laboral es la de albail en obras particulares de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja junto a su esposa que tambin es ayudante. Con anteriores prstamos realizaron la construccin de una loza de hormign armado y la estructura para una habitacin nueva en planta alta. Ahora solicita crdito para la construccin de una habitacin de ladrillo sobre la loza ya construida. Esta es la sptima vez que solicita prstamo y el anlisis socioeconmico realizado lo califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Valentn M. has his own house in the Munaipata zone on the north side of the city. Valentn is married and has three daughters. His job is as a bricklayer in certain jobs in the city of La Paz. He works with his wife who is also a helper.

With previous loans, they completed the construction of a reinforced concrete floor and the structure for a new room on the second floor. Now he requests a loan for the construction of a room made of brick on the already constructed floor.

This is the seventh time that he has asked for loan and the completed socio-economic analysis qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Construction

loan.name: Wared

texts.en: "Al Amal," which means "hope," is the name of a solidarity group of several women living in Hasbaya in the South of Lebanon. Wared is a 36-year-old single woman who is part of this lending group. Wared sells beautiful handbags and shoes. Wared has requested $US500 to improve her business by adding to the diversity of her offerings. This will be the third time Wared has borrowed from Al Majmoua.

loan.use: Diversify shop inventory

loan.name: Dania

texts.en: Dania is a 28-year-old woman who lives in Hasbaya, Southern Lebanon. Dania sells cosmetic creams and makeup to local women. Dania is part of a solidarity group called "Gardenia," and has asked for a loan of $300 to purchase new cosmetics for her burgeoning retail business.

loan.use: To help expand her makeup stock

loan.name: Victor Eduardo

texts.es:
Victor se dedica a la cra de ganado vacuno, cuya produccin de leche Comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
Vive. en la comunidad de Vilaque de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.. Es casado y tiene tres hijos de 8, 4 y 2 aos respectivamente.
El crdito lo destinara en la compra de ganado de raza mejorada para incrementar su produccin y por lo tanto sus ingresos..
Es su segundo crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada le califica para otorgarle el prstamo
texts.en:
Victor raises cattle whose milk he sells to the PIL Andina milk plant.

He lives in the Vilaque de la Provincia Los Andes community in the state of La Paz, located two hours from the city of La Paz. He is married and has three children, 8, 4, and 2 years-old, respectively.

The loan will be allocated to the purchase of a better breed of cattle to increase his production and therefore his income.

This is his second loan with Impro, his completed evaluation qualifies him to be granted this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of Livestock

loan.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia vive en la calle San Bartolom de la zona Villa Cooperativa en la ciudad de El Alto. Es casada y tiene un hijo de 12 aos.
Se dedica a la confeccin de polleras y venta de golosinas en la puerta de una escuela de la zona.
El crdito lo destinara en la compra de lmercaderias.
Es su segundo crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada la califica para otorgarle el crdito.
texts.en:
Virginia lives on San Bartolom Street in the Villa Cooperativa zone in the city of El Alto. She is married and has a twelve-year-old son. She prepares poultry and sells sweets at the entrance of a school in the area. This loan will be used to buy merchandise. This is Virginias second loan with Impro. The assessment carried out qualifies her to be awarded the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: Garden Of Hope Group

texts.en: Garden of Hope is a support group for people living with HIV/Aids with its main offices at Coast Provincial General Hospital. The group has a membership of 25 active members. Its activities include nutrition support, psycho-social support, home-based care and income generating activities. Fifteen members have applied for US $3000 to support their income generating activities.

loan.use: Improve their income generating activities.

loan.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio vive en la calle Portocarrero de la zona Franz Tamayo en la ciudad de El Alto. Tiene esposa y dos hijos. Se dedica al transporte publico en su minibs durante toda la semana.
El crdito lo destinara en la compra de repuestos para su vehiculo.
Es su primer crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada lo califica ptimamente.
texts.en:
Emilio lives on Portocarrero Street, in the Franz Tamayo zone, in the city of El Alto. He has a wife and two children. He uses his minibus for public transportation during the whole week. This loan will be used to buy spare parts for his vehicle. This is his first loan with Impro. The assessment carried out rated him optimally.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Maintenance of his vehicle

loan.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
Miguel Angel is a 28-year-old man who lives in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. Miguel Angel's wife is currently in Spain. Miguel rents out several rooms and four motorcycles. Motorcycle rentals are very lucrative, since this is the most common form of transportation in Santa Cruz, and Miguel's prices are very reasonable. He charges 2 bolivianos (about 28 cents) per leg of each trip by motorcycle, and US $120 per month for the rooms he rents.

Miguel has years of experience renting motorcycles, and though there is a lot of competition, his business is doing well. He will use this loan to buy another motorcycle. Miguel currently has another loan out with Fades, another Bolivian microcredit institution, but his loan officer has determined that he has the capacity to repay both loans simultaneously.

loan.use: Buy a motorcycle to rent out

loan.name: Estefania Lesly

texts.es:
Estefana vive en la avenida Unin Ftima de la zona villa Cooperativa en la ciudad de El Alto. Junto a su madre y sus hermanos, ella es soltera. Actualmente continua sus estudios, tambin se dedica a la venta de artculos de belleza por lo cual recibe un porcentaje sobre ventas. Las ganancias son invertidas en la compra de material de estudio
El crdito lo destinara en la compra de mercadera con el fin de aumentar sus ganancias
Es su primer crdito en Impro, es una colegiala pero a su edad ya es bastante emprendedora y por lo tanto se debe fomentar a esta persona
texts.en:
Estefana lives on Unin Ftima Avenue in the Villa Cooperativa zone in the city of El Alto with her mother and siblings. She is single. At present, she is continuing with her studies. She also sells beauty products, for which she receive a percentage of the sales. The earnings are invested into the purchase of materials for school. Estafana will use this loan to buy merchandise with the goal of increasing her earnings. This is her first loan with Impro. She is a schoolgirl, but at her age, she is already quite enterprising and, as a result, you should support her.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina vive en la calle Antonio Arze de la zona villa Ingenio en la ciudad de El Alto. Ella es casada (su marido es transportista) y tiene 3 hijos. Se dedica al la venta ambulante de golosinas en las diferentes ferias de la cuidad de El Alto.
El crdito lo destinara en la compra de mercaderia en mayor cantidad.
Es su segundo crdito con Impro, la evaluacin realizada la califica para otorgarle el crdito
texts.en:
Celestina lives on Antonio Arze street in the Villa Ingenio zone of the city of El Alto, Bolivia. She is married (her husband works in transportation) and has three children. She is a street vendor and sells sweets at different markets in El Alto.

She will use the loan to buy bulk merchandise. This is her second loan from Impro, and according to a review of her credit history she is qualified to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy sweets in bulk to resell

loan.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is a 46 year old man who lives in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. He lives with his wife and their son, who helps him with his work as a contractor. Angel also builds cabins and stables. Angel has many years of experience and is very well known in the area. He has very little competition, since most of the contractors in his area moved to Spain to look for better paying jobs. Contractors are in high demand where he lives, so Angel has lots of work, and the prices he can charge have risen substantially due to the lack of contractors in the area.
Angel will use this loan to buy a motorcycle for personal use. He has no negative credit history, according to his credit report.

loan.use: To buy a motorcycle

loan.name: Khodr

texts.en: Khodr, 53 years old, is married and has eight children. He lives in the region of Nabatiyeh in the South of Lebanon. Khodr is a taxi driver. Income from the business helps him and his wife provide for the needs of their family. Khodr needs a loan of $US1,000 for the maintenance of his taxi, which will allow him to keep on being a taxi driver. This is Khodr's second time requesting a loan from Al Majmoua.

loan.use: To assist with taxi repairs

loan.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah M. sells groceries like milk, Milo, and different kinds of canned products at Elmina. Sarah has received no education. She is a widow and has 5 children. She is responsible for paying the utility bills and her children's school fees. She plans to use the loan to buy more product to resell to increase her income. She hopes to use the increased profit from her business to improve her children's education.

loan.use: Buy more products to sell in the grocery store to increase income

loan.name: Maria

texts.en:
Dona Maria is from the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. She lives in her own home with her husband and her 17-year-old son. This photo was taken of her husband, Filiberto C., because Dona Maria was out running errands when her loan officer went to visit her.

The couple has two sources of income: 1) an automotive workshop in their home and 2) food and drink sales from a lunch counter they run on the weekend. There is little competition in car repairs, since they have regular customers who drive big rigs and other large automobiles. There is a lot of competition with other lunch counters, but there is also high demand, and Dona Maria and Don Filiberto have many regular customers.

The couple would like to use this loan to buy more drinks for their lunch counter as well as some additional tools for their repair shop. This is Dona Maria's third loan, and she is considered an excellent client since she has always been very punctual with her repayments.

loan.use: Buy drinks for re-sale and car repair tools

loan.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Kokouvi A. est g de 28 ans, clibataire sans enfants. Il tient une cabine de traitement de texte depuis 2 ans Adeta, un village situ environ 150 kilomtres de Lom, la capitale togolaise. Il dsire par ce crdit acheter un nouveau copieur , puisque le premier est us engendre beaucoup de frais pour les rparations, ainsi que des fournitures de bureau. Cette chance lui permettra de rpondre aux services de la clientle et les fonds lui serviront de rembourser son crdit et aussi de dgager des profits afin de subvenir ses propres besoins et ceux de ses petits frres.
texts.en:
Kokouvi A. is 28 years old and single with no children. He has been running a word-processing office for 2 years in Adeta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lom, the capital of Togo. He would like to use this loan to buy a new copier, since the first one is worn out and requires a lot of money for repairs, as well as office furniture. This chance will allow him to respond to the clienteles service needs, and the funds will help him repay his loan and to make some profits in order to provide for his needs, as well as the needs of his little brothers.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to buy a copier and office furniture

loan.name: Betty Petrona

texts.en:
Betty and her husband live in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. They have one 18-year-old son, whom they support financially, and they are taking out this loan together to pay for repairs on the taxi they own. The couple earns income by renting the taxi to the driver at a fixed daily rate, and Betty's husband also works as a salesman, for which he receives a set monthly wage. They have five years of experience renting the taxi and working for the company. Since they are experienced in both areas, competition does not present a major problem.

Betty and her husband are taking out this loan to repair the taxi's motor, which will cost $400. They are refinancing a previous loan of $3,010 in order to take out their current loan. They have $1,336.86 left to repay on the previous loan, and have always made their payments on time and in full.

loan.use: Taxi repairs

loan.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro lives in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. He and his partner have four children, who are 14, 11, 8 and 3 years old. Pedro has been working as a gardener and growing fruit for about 20 years. He works out of his home, and his partner sells his fruit according to the season. He has many clients who know of his work, and he is easy for them to find since he is always working from the same location. He has been able to position himself well in the market thanks to his partner, who has been selling fruit for a long time and is very experienced.

Pedro will use this loan to buy some machinery that he needs for gardening. This is his third loan from AgroCapital, and he has always been very punctual with his repayments. Pedro only has loans out with our institution, according to his credit report.

loan.use: Buy machinery for gardening

loan.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama S. sells soup, rice, sugar and other goods at Abrobiano in Elmina. Mariama has received junior high school education. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a driver.

Mariama has been selling soup, rice, sugar, etc. since 2002. She is responsible for paying for school fees and food for the family. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to buy more grocery items for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loan.use: to buy more grocery items for re-sale

loan.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati S., a 48-year-old woman, is married and has five children. She runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. She needs the loan to enable her to restock her shop with more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil and roasted groundnuts, etc. to scale up sales.
She is hopeful that she would be able to raise enough income to sponsor her kids' education. She would be thankful for that support; she is a member of the group called "Hakuri" group Trust, meaning Patience's. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loan.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, boxes of cigarettes, cartons of vegetable oil, evaporated milk etc.

loan.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. has been doing business in the local market in Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is a 46-year-old woman, a widow and mother of five children who are currently schooling. She is a busy petty trader who sells foodstuffs like beans and yams. She is also a manufacturer of palm oil and she sells these items on top of a table in the market.

Lydia does not have sufficient working capital to run the business, a fact which retards her business progress. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to purchase increased stocks of palm kernel to process into palm oil to revive that aspect of her business.

She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be most grateful for your assistance. She is a member of the group called "Nkwaredea" meaning Truthfulness. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loan.use: To purchase increased stocks of palm oil, yams, and beans, etc.

loan.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 39 years old and lives in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. She lives in her 34-year-old brother's house along with her family and her three-year-old son. She and her brother are taking out this loan together

Flora sells groceries out of her home with the help of her mother. She also works at the ALG poultry farm giving vaccinations to the animals. Her brother works on the "Inacruz" poultry farm, where he works as a mechanic and welder. He also owns a stand on 25th of May St. (the main street in the area where they live) where he sells drinks. Both Flora and her brother have many years of experience in their respective activities. Though there is some competition both in grocery sales and drink sales, Flora and her brother never lack customers, since they both have experience running high-quality operations. Each has a steady source of income, as well, so their earnings are fairly stable.

Flora plans to use her loan to buy more groceries. This is her third loan with AgroCapital, and she has been an excellent client in the past. She does not have any outstanding debts with any other financial institutions.

loan.use: Buy bulk groceries to sell

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret G. is thirty-nine years old. She is a wife and mother of three children. Margaret is a resourceful mother and a successful businesswoman. She works hard to support her children in school. At the moment, her first-born child is in senior high school.

Margaret sells women's slippers, ladies' shoes, children's shoes and ladies' bags in Obuasi town. Margaret does personal selling, that is she moves from house to house to sell her goods to her loyal customers. She has inadequate working capital to support business growth. She believes that with the loan, she will be more able to supply her customers with quality shoes and slippers. She hopes to raise good income to support her family.

Margaret wants to use the loan to buy more women's slippers, ladies' shoes, children's shoes and ladies' bags. She belongs to the community group called 'Judah Abusua Kuo' (meaning, Judah's Family) Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loan.use: To buy more inventory for her business

loan.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael A. is 31 years old. He is married and expecting his first-born child any moment. He has been sewing for seven years. He is a specialist in women's and men's wear. His skills and designs are in a class by themselves. He sews various kinds of styles that give his customers new look, like kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, men's short sleeved shirts, kids' wear, etc. He also sews children's school uniforms for most of the schools in Obuasi as subsidiary to give him extra income to support his family.

Michael wants to use the loan to buy sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc. to increase his output and efficiency. He hopes to increase his savings to provide for his family, including his unborn child. He is a member of the community group called 'Judah Abusua Kuo' Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access and repay the loan.

loan.use: To buy sewing materials such as linen, thread, thimbles, etc.

loan.name: James B.

texts.en: James B. M. is married and has five children. He has received schooling through senior high school. James sells groceries such as biscuits, oats, milk and other canned products at Abrobeano in Elmina, which he has done since 1988. His wife is a trader. James uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and house-keeping expenses. James will use the loan to purchase bags of sugar, boxes of milk and other items for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, James plans to reinvest.

loan.use: James will use the loan to purchase bags of sugar, boxes of milk and other items for resale.

loan.name: Rabi

texts.en:
Rabi S. is 37 years old. She is divorced and the mother of three kids. Rabi S. is very resourceful in provision of food and payment of bills for her family. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey and fish with pepper. She sells kenkey in the mornings and in the afternoon and evening. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Rabi S. wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to pay for her children's education. She belongs to the community group called "Yedada Allah" Trust Group meaning 'believe in God'. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loan.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood etc.

loan.name: Wass Na God Dae Sabe Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu C. is the leader of the Wass Na God Dae Sabe group. She was born in Magburaka and is 37 years old. She is married to a business man and they have 4 children. Two of her children are already in school, and two are still too young to go to school. For 3 years, Kadiatu has been selling cooked rice, cold water, and soft drinks. She added some money to her previous loan to buy the freezer that she is using to sell the drinks. With this new loan, she plans to buy bags of rice and the condiments that she uses for cooking.

The other members of the group are Kadiatu C., Nenneh C., and Adama B.. They are all local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town, the headquarters of the Tonkolili District. They are requesting their third loan from Kiva through SMT. They have repaid their previous loans successfully. However, they are requesting a new loan to add to their current principle. Their previous loans allowed them to make a lot of improvements in their lives, so they are requesting a new loan.

loan.use: Purchase supplies for restaurant

loan.name: Mame Bousso

texts.fr: Mame Bousso est ne le 17 juillet 1971 Kaolack.elle est marie et s'active dans le commerce de crintin (cloture) et des denres alimentaires depuis quatre ans.
texts.en:
Mame Bousso was born on July 17, 1971 in Kaolack. She is married and has been in the business of bamboo fences and general food items for four years.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Sale of general food items and fences

loan.name: Cholitas Marinas Group

texts.en:
The Cholitas Marinas Group is maD. up of eleven women and one man who live in the central Cochabamba region of Bolivia. "Cholita" is a term commonly used to refer to indigenous Andean women who usually dress in skirts with long braids and sometimes wear bowler hats; the group's name, roughly translated, means "Cholitas of the Sea."

The group members have a variety of businesses, mostly food sales: Rosemary has a beauty salon, Maria Macedonia and Giovanna sell groceries, Alejandrina sells bread, Aparicia and Victoria sell prepared meals, Eugenia sells vegetables, Maria Antonieta drives a taxi, Meliza sells comforters, Mercedes sells clothing, and Fredy has a kiosk. Most of the group members have significant experience in their various lines of work, giving them an edge over the competition.

Most of the group plans to use their loans to buy more merchandise, or to offer a wider variety of products and services. Most of the group members have had previous experience with group loans at Pro Mujer and Crecer, other Bolivian microfinance institutions.

loan.use: Buy more merchandise to sell

loan.name: Wague Bakh Group

texts.fr: Nous souhaitons avoir un financement auprs de Kiva pour crer des activits gnratrices de revenu afin de pouvoir avoir des emplois stables et durables. Le projet consiste la cration d'un poulailler dans l'covillage de Louly, qui bien que des initiatives ont t prises par des habitants du village, les besoins en ravitaillement de poulets de chair font toujours dfaut. Ce qui fait que pour combler ce manque, nous avons dcid de mettre sur pied un projet d'levage de poulets. Cela nous permettra de fournir les populations et les diffrents restaurants de la zone touristique ctire situe Mbour. Avec le prt, nous allons construire une poussinire et acheter du matriel dlevage (abreuvoir, mangeoire, pondoir, nichoir)
texts.en:
We would like to have a loan from Kiva to start businesses in order to be able to have stable and lasting jobs. The plan consists of creating a henhouse in the ecovillage of Louly, where although the villagers took initiative, the supply needs of the chicken are lacking. To make up for this shortage, we have decided to set up a plan to raise chickens. This will allow us to provide for the population and the different restaurants in the touristic area located in Mbour. With the loan, we are going to construct a henhouse and buy poultry-farming supplies (drinking trough, feeding tray, laying place, nest box).

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to raise and sell hens

loan.name: Rokel Group Ii

texts.en:
Yeabu S., who is the leader of the Rokel Group II group, was born in Magburaka. She is 50 years of age, a widow with 5 children; 4 of whom are already grown ups. Yeabu is a farmer and also sells dishes. She has been doing this for over 20 years. With her previous loans, Yeabu was able to pay for one of her sons, who wanted to learn welding as a trade, and also paid school fees for her youngest son. She plans to use this loan to buy more dishes to sell and invest in her farm.

The Rokel Group II includes Yeabu S. and Beintu S.. They are small-scale business women in Magburaka, the headquarters in Tonkolili District. This is their third loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans meant a lot in the lives and businesses of these people. They were able to expand their businesses, and consequently, their profits also increased. Today, these people are thankful for those loans because their livelihoods have improved over the days before the loans.

loan.use: Invest in farm and purchase more dishes to sell

loan.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte O. is 38 years old. She is a wife and the mother of three kids. Charlotte O. is very resourceful in providing food and paying bills for her family. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey and fish with pepper. She sells kenkey in the mornings and in the afternoon and evening. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has a very strong customer base since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper.

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. She belongs to the community group called St. Paul's Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loan.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loan.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M. is a single parent and has 2 children. She has never received schooling. Ama sells a variety of local dish like Banku (a product of maize and cassava dough), Wakye (acombination of rice and beans) and Fufu (a combination of cassava and plantain pounded together). These are the most popular meals in the country.

Her chop bar is located in Abrobiano in Elmina, where she has worked since 2007. Ama uses her income to pay utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase food stuffs and ingredients such as rice, beans, oil, cassava, fish, meat, maize and others. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest.
