loan.use: Ama will use the loan to purchase food stuffs and ingredients such as rice, beans, oil, cassava, fish, meat, maize and others.

loan.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora group is maD. up of eleven women and two men who live in the Villa Mexico neighborhood of Cochabamba. The group members have limited resources and work hard to repay their loans.

The group members are mostly ambulatory vendors, with the exception of RuD. and Ines, who sell clothing and underwear, Maria Elena, who is a seamstress, Amalia, who sells crystal dishes, and Omar, who drives a bus. About half of the group has around five years of experience, and the other half has more than 10 years of experience. Clara Julia has been working as a vendor for 35 years!

Most of the group plans to spend their loan to buy more wares to sell. This is the group's fourth loan cycle. Their previous three loans were repaid without problems.

loan.use: Buy more bulk merchandise to retail

loan.name: Jess Alberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Jess Alberto y su esposa la Sra. Alicia tiene dos hijos que estn en la edad escolar pero tiene un problema en est momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para la comprar de tiles escolares y los uniformes de la escuela.

El Sr. Jess trabaja en una compaa de agua el est en el puesto de repartidor de agua por varias colonias de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo y su esposa la Sra. Alicia se dedica a la venta de ropa usada afuera de su casa los fines de semana estos son sus ingresos familiares.

Cuando fuimos ha ser la visita a la casa de la familia M. el Sr. Jess no se encontraba en su casa el estaba trabajando solo estaba su esposa la Sra. Alicia y sus dos hijos.

El sr. Jess nos est solicitando un prstamo de $475.00 dlls para la compra de los tiles escolares y los uniformes ya que en la escuela se los estn exigiendo a los nios por seguridad de ellos mismos
texts.en:
Mr. Jess Alberto and his wife Mrs. Alicia have two school-aged children but, at this moment, they have a problem in that they dont have the money that is necessary to buy supplies and uniforms for school. Mr. Jess works in a water company. He is a water distributor for various neighborhoods in the city of Nuevo Laredo. His wife Mrs. Alicia sells used clothes outside her house during the weekends. These activities contribute to their household income. When we went to visit their home, only Mrs. Alicia and her two children were home, as Mr. Jess was working. Mr. Jess is requesting a loan for $475.00 to buy school supplies and uniforms since the children are required to go to school for their own security.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy school supplies and uniforms for his children

loan.name: Tamaraneh Iii Group

texts.en:
Musa (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group, called Tamaraneh III. This is a Temne word meaning: "Let's help one another." He was born in Magburaka, and he is 30 years of age. Musa is married to a business woman who sells pastes, toothbrushes, creams, and so on. Musa sells cigarettes. They have two children; one is in primary school and the other is still a baby. Musa was able to feed his children and mum, and pay school fees for his child out of the proceeds from his business. With this new loan, Musa is expecting a boom in his business because of the increase in capital the loan will provide.

The members of this group are all business people in Magburaka town, the main town in the Tonkolili District. They now request a new loan to further strengthen their businesses. This is their third loan from Kiva through SMT. They have completely and successfully repaid their previous loans.

loan.use: Purchase more goods to sell to expand their businesses

loan.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia O., a 34-year-old trader, is married with two children. Among these children, one has high school completed and the other one is still in school. Emelia supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing and lace materials. Selling used clothing is lucrative in Ghana, because many people purchase it, especially the economically active poor. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing and lace materials to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children's education. She would be grateful for that assistance. She belongs to the group called St. Paul's Trust Group. In this group, members also guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loan.use: To buy increased bales of used clothing and clothing materials.

loan.name: Petty-Traders Group

texts.en:
These are Jariatu K., Aiafu K. and Isatu S.. They named their group Petty Traders. They want a loan of Le 1,500,000.00.

Jariatu, who is the leader of this group, was born in Sanda about 30 miles from Makeni. But she now lives with her husband here in Makeni where she also does her business. She is 32 and has 4 children. She sells slippers and has been in this business for the past 10 years now. Previous loans have helped Jariatu a lot. They have helped her business grow. She was able to pay her children's school fees and also handles most of her numerous problems. With a new loan, Jariatu's stock of slippers will increase from 6 cartons to 12 cartons.

Aiafu also sells slippers. Previous loans have now helped him get a total of 4 cartons of slippers. He used to have only 2 cartons. With a new loan, he is expecting to get 6 cartons.

Isatu sells items like gum, biscuits, batteries, mints, lollipops etc. She thanks God for the previous loans she got with SMT. Such loans have helped her business grow and out of the proceeds, she is able to make a livelihood.

loan.use: Buy more cartons of slippers for re-sale

loan.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali Y. sells cell phone credit cards and phone accessories at Elmina market. Ali has received no formal education. He is single and has no children.

Ali has been selling cell phone credit cards and phone accessories since 2007. He is responsible for paying utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more phone credit cards and phone accessories for re-sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to increase his capital base for the expansion of his business.

loan.use: to buy more phone credit cards and phone accessories for sale.

loan.name: Hilda Milda

texts.es: La seora Hilda Milda, tiene 54 aos, est casada, estudi la carrera de auxiliar de Enfermera en el Instituto San Hilario en la ciudad de Trujillo, no ejerce su profesin porque se cas y despus se dedic a cuidar a sus hijos, tiene 03 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. La empresaria trabajaba en el centro de salud en la Provincia de Julcan, pero despus decidi venir a la ciudad de Trujillo para que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales. Despus tuvo la iniciativa de empezar a trabajar, y por este motivo viajaba a la Provincia de Julcan los das domingos para comprar verduras. Tiene 02 aos trabajando con Manuela Ramos, por una amiga decidi participar en el Banco Comunal MUJERES AL XITO II adems la socia tena poco capital y a veces no le alcanzaba para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio y con el primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibi compr harina, trigo, haba, papa. Con este prstamo de S/. 600.00 que cancelar en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra de papa, porque es lo que se vende ms rpido. La socia suea con tener una tienda de abarrotes en la ciudad de Trujillo, para no viajar a la Provincia de Julcan.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda MIlda is 54 years old and married. She studied nursing at the Institute San HIlario in the city of Trujillo, but does not currently work in nursing because she decided to get married and dedicated herself to raising her children. She has three children, all of whom are in school. Hilda lives in the Trujillo District in the province of the same name in the department of La Libertad. She used to work in the health center in the Julcan Province, but decided to move to the city of Trujillo so that her children could study and become professionals. She later decided to start to work, and began traveling to Julcan Province each Sunday to buy vegetables (which she then resells in Trujillo). She has been working with Manuela Ramos for two years; she first started by participating in the "Women Towards Success II" Communal Bank (a group loan), thanks to a friend. She had little money at the time, and sometimes did not have enough to keep investing in her business. With her first loan of 300 soles (a little more than US $100), HIlda bought flour, wheat, broad beans and potatoes. With this loan of 600 soles (slightly more than US $200), which she will repay in four months, she is considering buying potatoes, because that is what sells the fastest. Hilda dreams of having a store in Trujillo to buy vegetables from so that she does not have to travel to Julcan Province any more.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy potatoes in bulk

loan.name: Orlando

texts.es:
El Sr. Orlando es padres de familia tiene un hijo de 5 aos de edad el y su esposa estn preocupados ya que el casa no esta nada protegida para seguridad de su hijo.

El Sr. orlando est preocupado por su familia ya que por su trabajo casi no est en su casa y teme que les pueda pasar algo a ellos cuando el no est en casa con las bardas y protecciones a su casa la familia estar ms segura cundo el no est en su casa.

El trabaja en una compaa de paquetera en el aria de entregar paquetera (papeles o documentacin) y mercanca a diferentas partes de la republica Mexicana (Por ejemplo a Monterrey, Veracruz, Guadalajara, Mxico.) este es su ingreso familiar.

Ellos estn solicitando un prstamo de $750.00 dlls a Kiva para la comprar de material ya que a su casa le est haciendo falta las bardas y protecciones ya que por el momento no cuenta con el capital que necesitan.
texts.en:
Mr. Orlando and his wife, who have a five-year-old son, are worried because their house isnt protected for the security of their son. Mr. Orlando is worried for his family since he is rarely at home because of his job. He fears that something will happen to his family when he isnt there. With walls and protections for the house, the family will be safer when Orlando isnt home. Orlando works in a packaging company where he delivers packages (papers or documents) and merchandise to different parts of Mexico (for example to Monterrey, Veracruz, and Guadalajara). This makes up his familys income. They are requesting a loan for $750.00 from Kiva so that they can buy materials for walls and protections that they lack outside their house because they dont have the capital at the moment.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: The construction of walls and protections

loan.name: Felicity

texts.en:
Felicity A. started her local restaurant 17 years ago in Tutuka, a suburb of Obuasi where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 41 years old and married with six children, who are all currently in school.
She serves many kinds of local dishes, like fufu, rice and stew, rice balls, and banku with okra stew, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantains and taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and taken with hot peppers or soup.
Felicity wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, and firewood. She also hopes to use part of the proceeds to finance her children's educations. She is a member of the group called "yehowa nemewhefo" Trust Group meaning "God is my Shepherd." In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loan.use: To buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood.

loan.name: Irma Marleni

texts.es:
La seora Irma Marleny, tiene 43 aos, est casada, estudi la carrera de Contabilidad en el Instituto Trujillo, nunca lo ejerci porque se dedic al negocio y cuidar a sus hijos, tiene 04 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse econmicamente, opt por poner negocio estable de suelas, plantas de PVC cuando sus hijos crecieron, tiene 03 aos en este negocio, anteriormente viajaba a Lima para comprar ropa, despus dej ese negocio. Tiene 02 aos en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, una amiga la recomend en el Banco Comunal ESPERANZA DEL MAANA ella decidi pertenecer a este Banco porque necesitaba capital para tener un negocio slido y con el primer prstamo de S/. 500.00 que recibi compr plantas de PVC a sus proveedores.
Con el prstamo de S/. 1,100.00 que cancelar en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra de plantas, suelas de PVC.
La empresaria suea con seguir creciendo dentro de sus posibilidades. En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece tiene el cargo de presidenta, cuya funcin es dar bienvenida, animar a las nuevas socias para que paguen puntualmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma Marleny is 43 years old, married, and she studied Accounting in the Trujillo Institute. She has 4 children who are students, and she lives in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo province in La Libertad state. To help herself economically she opted to open a stable business of insoles and soles of PVC while her children were growing up. She has had this business for 3 years, previously she would travel to Lima to buy clothing but she left this business. She has been involved with Manuela Ramos for 2 years as a friend recommended the Communal Bank Esperanza del Maana and she decided to join this Bank because she needed the capital to have her business be solid. With the first loan for S/. 500.00 that she received she bought PVC insoles from her suppliers. With the loan for S/. 1,100.00 which will be repaid in 4 months, she is thinking of investing in the purchase of insoles and soles of PVC. This businesswoman dreams of continuing to grow the possibilities of business. She is the president of the Communal Bank to which she belongs, her function is to welcome and inspire new members to pay punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy soles and insoles for shoes

loan.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha Q. vive en casa de sus padres (calle 23 de marzo, zona de Obispo Bosque, ciudad de La Paz), junto a su hija y el abuelo (el esposo que es polica esta trabajando en el Chapare, una zona tropical del departamento de Cochabamba, pero su salario es mnimo). Martha solicita crdito para cubrir los gastos mdicos de su padre quien no puede caminar debido a un doloroso accidente.
Es cliente antigua de Impro, tiene un buen historial y puede acceder a un nuevo crdito.
texts.en:
Martha Q. lives in her parents house (23 de marzo Street, Obispo Bosque zone, La Paz) with her daughter and grandfather. Her husband, who is a police officer, is working in the Chapare, a tropical zone in Cochabamba, but his salary is minimal. Martha is requesting this loan to cover her fathers medical costs. Marthas father cannot walk because of a painful accident. Martha is an old client of Impro. She has a good record and can manage a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To cover medical expenses

loan.name: Herlin

texts.es: El Sr. Herling tiene 31 aos de edad, y habita en el Barrio Waspan Norte de Managua, es casado, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 9 aos de edad que estn cursando la primaria, su esposa es comerciante, vende productos varios los cuales oferta de manera ambulante y tambin los clientes llegan a su casa de habitacin. Don Harling trabaja en topgrafo y tiene un ao de estar laborando en esta rea. La solicitud que est haciendo es para hacer mejoras en su vivienda en la instalacin de un servicio higinico y tuberas de aguas negras, esto es debido que en la parte donde vive ya estn instalndose los tubos de aguas negras para el barrio, l piensa que es un gran avance para el barrio donde habita ya que ahora podrn tener ms higiene en sus viviendas, sobre todo porque ya no ser necesario el uso de letrinas.
texts.en:
Herling, 31, lives in the Waspan Norte barrio in Managua. He is married and has two children, 7 and 9, who attend elementary school. His wife sells various products on the street and out of their home. Herling has been working as a topographer for a year. The loan he is requesting will be used to improve his home by installing a toilet and sewage, since a sewage system is being installed in his barrio Herling believes this new sewage system will be a great improvement to the hygiene in his neighborhood, because latrines will no longer be needed

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Installing toilet and sewage

loan.name: Dolores Aleyda

texts.es: Dolores es una joven de 24 aos de edad, labora en un instituto de educacin, desempendose como docente de ecuacin primaria, es madre soltera de una nia de 6 meses, por la que debe luchar muy duro ya que todos los gastos familiares recaen sobre ella. Vive la casa de su familia y son ellos quienes le apoyan con el cuido de la menor, desde muy joven le ha tocado trabajar ya que apoya a su familia, y ahora tiene que mantener a su pequea hija. Mientras est trabajando su madre cuida del beb. Actualmente el techo de su casa de habitacin est en muy malas condiciones, y las lluvias les estn afectando mucho, es por eso que solicita el crdito para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, y as asegurar la salud de su familia sobre todo la de su beb, ya que la casa est hmeda y cuando llueve tienen que estar pendientes de que no se mojen los bienes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dolores is a 24 year old young woman, she works in school as an elementary teacher. She is a single mother and has a 6 month old daughter, for whom she works very hard as meeting all the household expenses fall to Dolores. She lives in her family's home and they support her by taking care of her daughter. She has worked ever since she was young to support her family, and now she has to support her small daughter also. While she works her mother watches the baby. Today the roof of their home is in poor condition. Rain is affecting them a lot, and therefore she is seeking a loan to change their home's roof and thereby ensure her family's, and above all her daughter's, health. Their home is very humid an dwhen it rains they have to be careful that their belongings do not get wet.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Repair the roof on her home.

loan.name: Fary

texts.fr: Fary B. est ne le 01 janvier 1959 Bambey. Ellee vit au quartier lona avec son mari.Elle vend du petit djeuner depuis cinq ans.
texts.en:
Fary B. was born on January 1, 1959 in Bambey. She lives in the neighborhood of ------- with her husband. She has been selling breakfast for the last five years.

Translated from French by Vronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Breakfast sale

loan.name: Victoria Gladis

texts.es:
La seora Victoria Gladis, tiene 34 aos, actualmente es conviviente, estudi la carrera de obstetricia, no la culmin porque sali embarazada, despus tuvo una amenaza de aborto y como no poda subir las gradas del instituto Alexander Fleming porque estudiaba en el 3er piso, es por este motivo que decidi retirarse, tiene 03 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse econmicamente empez vendiendo productos cosmticos de belleza, una amiga le hizo la propuesta para que ofrezca estos productos, ella acept porque quera trabajar, adems en tiempo de verano vende cremoladas, arroz con leche, mazamorra. Tiene 02 aos en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su amiga la recomend en el Banco Comunal MUJERES AL XITO II ella decidi pertenecer en este Banco porque quera incrementar el capital y con el primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibi compr hielos, vasos, cucharas, maz, chuo, azcar, arroz, leche.
Con este prstamo de S/. 1000.00 que cancelar en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra de productos cosmticos ms cmodos tales como: perfumes, labiales, aretes, relojes, cremas, para despus venderlos a otro precio.
En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece tiene el cargo de fiscal, cuya funcin es informar a las nuevas socias, explicarles en que consiste la ONG Manuela Ramos. La socia suea con comprar un local para vender ropa, calzado o tener una pequea juguera y a parte seguir vendiendo productos cosmticos.
texts.en:
Miss Victoria Gladis is 34 years old, at present she is a domestic partner. She studied the career of midwifery, but she didn't finish because she became pregnant, and later she had an abortion threat and since she couldn't go up the stairs to the third floor of Alexander Fleming Institute, she had to stop. She has 3 children who are all in school. They live in the District of Trujillo in the Department of La Libertad.

In order to help herself economically, she started selling beauty cosmetic products. A friend suggested her to sell these products, she accepted because she wanted to work. Also during the summer she sells smoothies, rice with milk, and maize with honey.

She has been with the Manuela Ramos for two years, a friend recommended her to the MUJERES AL XITO Communal Bank. She decided to belong to this Bank because she wanted to increase her working capital and with the first loan of $115 she bought ice, glasses, spoons, corn, potato flour, sugar, rice, and milk. With this loan of $350 that she will repay over a period of 4 months, she plans to buy cosmetic products that are easier to sell such as: perfumes, labials, earrings, clocks, creams. In the Communal Bank where she belongs she has a legal role where she informs to the new partners what Manuela Ramos is about. The partner dreams of buying a retail space to sell clothes, footwear or to have a small toy store and still be able to sell cosmetic products.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy wholesale cosmectic products.Compra de productos cosmticos al por mayor.

loan.name: Martina Sabina

texts.es: Doa Martina a sus 48 aos de edad, ha podido sobresalir de tantas dificultades pues es madre soltera de su hija de 15 aos de edad, est separada, pero el padre de su hija la apoya econmicamente, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene que velar por su hija para que pueda salir adelante en sus estudios, actualmente est en secundaria y se requiere de muchos gastos y atencin personal. Doa Martina trabaja en un comedor y es la que prepara los alimentos que ah se ofrecen, tiene cinco aos de estar laborando en el comedor, aunque no es fcil por que desde muy temprano llega a su trabajo y sale tarde, y tiene que estar pendiente de su hija, su abuelita cuida de la adolescente para que ella no est sola en la casa. Con la solicitud de prstamo es para poder hacer reparacin en el techo que est en mal estado para eso necesita comprar perlines y zinc. A largo plazo es poder cambiar de trabajo para tener ms tiempo para su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Martina at 48 years of age has been able to overcome many difficulties. She is the single mother of her 15 year old daughter, and is divorced, but the father supports his daughter financially. Martina lives in the North Laureles neighborhood. She has to monitor her daughter so that she comes out ahead academically, as she is currently in high school and requires many things and personal attention. Ms. Martina works in a cafeteria, and is the one who cooks the food that is offered there. She has been working there for 5 years, although it is not easy because she arrives early and leaves late, and has to be available to her daughter. Martina's mother looks after her daughter so that she doesn't have to be home alone. The loan is to repair the roof of the house, as it is in bad shape. To do this, Martina needs purlins and zinc. In the long run, Martina would like to change jobs to have more time to spend with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase zinc sheets to roof her house.

loan.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria habita en un barrio de Laureles Norte, tiene 42 aos de edad, su esposo trabaja de cadete de taxi. Tiene 2 hijas de 13 y 16 aos de edad quienes estudian la educacin secundaria. Doa Maria trabaja todos los das lavando y planchando ajeno y tiene dos aos de estar lavando y planchando y no le ha ido tan mal cada da que pasa tiene mas clientes que requieren de su servicio, ya que admiran su labor y cuido de la ropa. Algunas veces para ella es muy cansado pero tiene que apoyar a su esposo en la manutencin de su familia. La solicitud del prstamo es para hacer mejoras en su vivienda en la construccin de un porche para poder disfrutar las tardes ms cmoda con su familia. A largo plazo es poder estar mejor econmicamente, poder tener las fuerzas y salud para apoyar a sus hijas en los estudios.
texts.en:
Maria lives in a neighborhood of North Laureles. She is 42 years old. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Maria has two daughters, ages 13 and 16, who are currently in high school. Maria works every day cleaning and ironing for others. She has worked in the cleaning business for two years, and things have gone fairly well for her, as she has more clients every day. Her clients admire her hard work and how careful she is with their clothes. Sometimes Maria is tired, but she has to support her husband in maintaining the family. She is seeking the loan to make improvements in her house, such as a porch so that the family can enjoy the afternoons together. In the long term, Maria hopes to be in a better financial situation and have the strength and health to support her little girls in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Build a porch in her house.

loan.name: Khady Sy

texts.fr: Khady Sy Sall est ne le 14 mars 1964 Bargny. Elle habite au quartier de lona dans la commune de Bambey.Elle s'active dans le commerce de produit d'entretien depuis cinq ans.
texts.en:
Khady Sy Sall was born on March 14, 1964 in Bargny. She lives in the city of Bambey. She's been selling cleaning products for five years.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy and resell cleaning products

loan.name: Lizbeth Aimet

texts.es:
La seora Lizbeth Aimet, tiene 29 aos, est casada, estudi Dental Tcnico y corte y confeccin, tiene 03 hijos, se encuentran estudiando, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse econmicamente, empez trabajando en un taller de costura, como no le daba el tiempo para cuidar a sus hijos, decidi trabajar en su casa porque tiene libertad de escoger horario de trabajo adems tiene 01 mquina de coser y 01 remalladora, la socia tiene 05 aos en este negocio, elabora buzos deportivos, ropa sobre medida, arreglos de basta, cierres. Tiene 01 ao trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su sobrina la recomend en el Banco Comunal MUJERES AL XITO ella decidi pertenecer a este Banco porque necesitaba un prstamo para ampliar el pequeo taller y con el primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibi compr tela polar para hacer buzos.
Con este prstamo de S/. 200.00 que cancelar en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra de cintas para buzos, cierres, hilos de colores. En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece tiene el cargo de secretaria, cuya funcin es llenar el libro de actas, pasar lista a las socias. La empresaria suea con ampliar el taller para tener mercera y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Miss Lizbeth Aimet is 29 years old, she is married, she studied Dental Technician and dressmaking. She has 3 children who are in school. She lives in the District of Trujillo, Province of Trujillo in the Department La Libertad.

In order to help herself economically, she started working at seamstress workshop, since she didn't have time to look after her children, she decided to work from home because she would have the freedom of choosing her own work schedule. She has a sewing machine and a overlook machine. She makes track suits, made to measure clothes, hems and zippers. The partner has had this business for 5 years.

She has been working with the Movement Manuela Ramos for one year. Her niece recommended her to the MUJERES AL EXITO Communal Bank. She decided to belong to this Bank because she needed a loan to expand the small workshop. With the first loan of $115 she bought polar cloth to make the track suits.

With this loan of $ 675 that she will repay over a period of 4 months, she plans to buy ribbons for the track suits, zippers and threads of different colors. She is the secretary at the Communal Bank. Her role is to do the minutes book, and take roll call of the partners. The businesswoman dreams are extending the workshop to have a notions store and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy zippers, threads, ribbons, and other materials.

loan.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El Sr. Domingo solicita un prstamo para cambiar el techo de su casa ya que el que tiene actualmente es de madera y con las lluvias y el sol se a maltratado mucho el quiere poner le un techo de concreto (Losa) ya que cuando llueve le entra agua a su casa y los muebles tambin se estn maltratando. Por su trabajo el casi no se encuentra en su casa y le preocupa que les pueda pasar algo a su familia por lo maltratado que esta el techo.

El Sr. Domingo trabaja en una compaa de trasportes en el aria de chofer este es su ingreso familia.

Cuando se realizamos la visita a la casa del Sr. Domingo no se encontraba en su casa andaba trabajando y solo se encontraba su esposa la Sra. Mara Victoria y sus hijos.

El Sr. Domingo no cuenta por el momento con el dinero para ser el cambiar el techo de su casa es por eso que se acerca a nosotros a solicitar un prstamo de $ 800.00 dlls para poner el techo de concreto (losa) en su casa y su familia estar mas protegida del clima.
texts.en:
Domingo is seeking a loan to change the roof of his home as the one he has is made of wood and the rain and sun have taken their toll and he wants to put on a concrete roof. When it rains the water enters his home and the furniture is also damaged. Because of work he is almost never home and he worries that something could happen to his family because of the roofs poor condition. Domingo works for a transportation company as a driver, and this is his familys income. When we visited Domingos house he wasnt at home as he was working and we met his wife Mara Victoria y sus hijos. Domingo doesnt have the money at the moment to replace his roof so therefore he approached us for a loan of $800 to put a concrete room on his home so his family will be better protected from the weather.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Replace the home's wood roof with a concrete roof

loan.name: Ndella

texts.fr: Ndella S. est ne le 26 janvier 1978 Rufisque.Elle habite au quartier DVF dans la commune de Bambey avec son mari. Elle fait de la couture depuis trois ans.
texts.en:
Ndella S. was born on January 26, 1978 in Rufisque. She lives with her husband in the DVF quarter in the city of Bambey. She's been a seamstress for three years.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Sewing

loan.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La seora Mara Elena, tiene 46 aos, est casada, estudi secundaria completa, no contino estudiando porque tuvo su compromiso, tiene 04 hijos, se encuentran trabajando, vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse econmicamente, empez hace 23 aos a vender cebiche, papa rellena, cachanga, en el verano vende raspadillas, como la socia tena un restaurante donde su esposo se encargaba de vender cerveza, pero como el seor se tomaba la cerveza, trajo como consecuencia que el negocio cierre. Tiene 03 aos trabajando en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, una amiga la recomend en el Banco Comunal ESPERANZA DEL MAANA ella decidi pertenecer a este Banco porque quera incrementar el capital y con el primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibi compr aceite, fideo, arroz, etc.
Con el prstamo de S/. 600.00 que cancelar en 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra de arroz, azcar, fideos, etc.
La empresaria suea con seguir adelante en su trabajo, como su esposo es alcohlico, ella es padre y madre para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mara Elena, is 46 and married. She completed her secondary education, but did not continue studying because she was engaged. She has 4 children who are working. She lives in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo Province, La Libertad department. In order to help herself economically, she began 23 years ago selling cebiche (a popular shrimp dish), stuffed potatoes, and cachanga (a type of bread), and in the summer she sells shaved ice. She had a restaurant where her husband took care of selling beer, but as he also drank the beer, consequently the business failed. She has been working for 3 years with the Manuela Ramos Movement. A friend recommended the communal bank ESPERANZA DEL MAANA (Hope for Tomorrow) to her and she decided to join this bank because she wanted to increase her capital. With the first loan of $110, she bought oil, noodles, rice, etc. With this loan of $225, which she will repay in 4 months, she intends to invest in rice, sugar, noodles, etc. This businesswoman dreams of getting ahead through her work--since her husband is an alcoholic, she is father and mother to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of food supplies

loan.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.en:
The San Cayetano group is made up of twelve women and two men who live in Oruro, a small mining city in southwestern Bolivia. The group members are involved in different businesses: Marcela and Elizabeth sell baked goods, Norka Jasmine has a hair salon, Neidy, Tania, and Nery sell clothing (both used clothing and new, trendy clothing). Primitiva sells prepared meals, Virginia sells groceries, Ingrid sells cosmetics, Norka sells meats, and Walter has a hardware store. The group members have a range of experience levels with their respective businesses, anywhere from three to eighteen years. The group meets every other Friday at the group president's house in the Pedro Ferrari neighborhood at 2:30 in the afternoon.

Most of the group members plan to use their loan to purchase more goods or merchandise to sell. In the photo, each group member is holding their check.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El grupo San Cayetano esta compuesto de 14 personas dentro las cuales existen dos varones y 12 mujeres de las cuales en su mayora las seoras se dedican a la repostera y en otros casos a la venta de diferentes artculos y las reuniones de recuperacin se realizan en casa de la presidenta ubicada en la urbanizacin pedro Ferrari los das viernes a las 14:30 Hrs.

loan.use: Purchase bulk merchandise to sell

loan.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna T. est ne le 11 juin 1949 Dakar.Elle habite au quartier DVF de Bambey avec son mari et ses enfants.Elle s'active dans vla vente de bijoux depuis six ans.
texts.en:
Sokhna T. was born on June 11, 1949, in Dakar. She lives with her husband and her children in the DVF quarter in Bambey. She's been selling jewelry for six years.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Jewlery sale

loan.name: Sucrenses Group

texts.en:
The Sucrenses group is made up of ten women and two men who live in Sucre, Bolivia. Most of the group members are mothers. The group is involved with various businesses and is very entrepreneurial. On average, the members have five years of experience in their respective businesses: Magali, Shirley, and Mariela sell cosmetics, Maria Luisa and Jhonny work in transportation, Johnny repairs cell phones, Jhonatan has a neighborhood store, Jovana sells prepared meals, Virginia sells vegetables, and Mirna and Angelica sell party favors.

Most of the group members will use their loans to buy more merchandise to sell, and thus increase their income. Most of them did not have access to credit before they joined this group.

loan.use: Buy bulk merchandise to re-sell

loan.name: Clavelitos Group

texts.en:
The Clavelitos ("Little Carnations") group is made up of six men and eight women from Oruro, a small mining city in southwestern Bolivia. Most of the group sells food: Julia, Eugenia, Gladys, Sabina, and Hilda sell prepared meals, Clemente and Maximo sell potatoes, Gregoria sells coffee, Filiberto sells meat, and Jorge sells beer. Of the remaining group members, Juan Alvaro sells replacement parts, Beatriz and Florentino sell clothing, and Jacinto sells pants. Most of the group members have 5 years of experience or less in their respective businesses, though four of them have more than 10 (and Beatriz has 25!). Their meetings are held every other Monday at 5pm at Clemente's house.

Most of the group members plan to use their loans to buy more ingredients to prepare food or more merchandise to sell.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

el grupo los clavelitos consta de 14 integrantes, la mayor parte de los integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de comida, tambien comercio como ser venta de verduras, carne, ropa usada y de abarrotes.las reuniones son cada lunes a las 17:00 en casa de Clemente H. C..

loan.use: Buy ingredients to prepare meals and other merchandise to sell

loan.name: Estrellas Group

texts.en:
The Estrellas ("Stars") group is made up of five men and eight women who live in Oruro, a small mining city in southwestern Bolivia. Most of the group members sell clothing: Jose Manuel, Rocio, Venancia, Shirley, Elvis, Luis, Reyna, Suzana, Carolina and Griselda. Of the remaining group members, Javier is in another type of commerce, Milfred sells prepared meals, and Carlos sells boards. Most of the group members plan to use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell.

Most of the group members have five years of experience or less in their respective businesses, though three members have more than ten years' experience and Venancia has 25 years of experience.

The group was originally made up of 15 people, but two group members did not show up for the loan disbursal so they were excluded from the group.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

esta fotografia corresponde al banco comunal las estrellas constituido por cuatro varones y ocho mujeres o este desembolso no asistieron dos socias quienes fueron escluidas del banco.

loan.use: Buy bulk clothing to resell

loan.name: Zaki

texts.en: Zaki is 57 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in a small village close to Nabatieh located in Southern Lebanon. Zaki owns a small bakery that attracts many clients from the region. He has requested a loan of $US1,000 to fund his purchase of ingredients for his tasty treats. This is Zaki's seventh time requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. Zaki has consistently repaid his monthly installments in full and on time.

loan.use: To purchase ingredients for bakery products

loan.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: Don Juan tiene 51 aos de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, es casado, tiene dos hijos de 13 y16 aos de edad, que estn estudiando. Su esposa se dedica a lavar y planchar ajeno para ayudar en los gastos de su familia. Don Juan tiene una zapatera llamada Rumbin y lleva veintids aos de experiencia, la zapatera est ubicada en un mercado de la capital, a veces el negocio esta mal, poco trabajo, entonces se va atrabajar a su finca para no dejar de percibir ingresos para su familia. Con la solicitud del prstamo quiere invertir en materia prima, en compra de productos varios para la zapatera, para mejorar la oferta y atraer ms clientes. A largo plazo es fortalecer el volumen de inventario de su negocio, invertir ms en la finca para ver mejores resultados, as como ayudar a sus hijos a prepararse profesionalmente
texts.en:
Mr. Juan is 51 years old and lives in the North Laureles neighborhood. He is married and has two children ages 13 and 16, who are students. His wife cleans and irons for other people to help cover the family's expenses. Juan owns a shoe store called "Rumbin" and has 22 years of experience. The shoe store is located in a market in the capital. Sometimes business is bad and there is little work to be done, but other times it is great and Juan works hard to make money for his family. Juan is seeking the loan to purchase raw materials for making shoes to increase his offerings and attract more clients. In the long run, Juan would like to increase the store's inventory and invest more in the business to make more money so that he can help his children prepare themselves professionally.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase raw materials to make shoes.

loan.name: Elbira

texts.es: Doa Elvira tiene 44 aos de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte es madre soltera, con tres hermosos hijos de 24, 25 y 27 aos de edad, los cuales son independientes a ella, le cost mucho sacar adelante a su familia, ya que nunca cont con el poyo del padre de sus hijos. Con el apoyo de todos sus hijos y con el de ella propio lograron poner una pulpera que tiene ya tres aos de tenerla la cual ha podido mantenerse ya que a travs del tiempo ha podido captar clientes al mismo tiempo ha ido creciendo su inventario. Ahora pretende captar nuevos segmentos de mercado y por eso solicita el prstamo para comprar productos de belleza y del hogar y as ofertarlos en su pulpera. Espera poder mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia a travs de este negocio porque ella dice que el negocio es de toda la familia. Ella ha dedicado el tiempo y amor necesario para que mis hijos sean buenos hombres ante esta sociedad.
texts.en:
Ms. Elvira is 44 years old and lives in the North Laureles neighborhood. She is the single mother of three beautiful children, ages 24, 25 and 27, who now live on their own. It was difficult for Elvira to maintain her family because she was never able to rely on the support of her children's father. With all of her children's support, and with her own fortitude, the family was able to open a general store, which is now 3 years old. The family has been able to maintain it by attracting clients and increasing the inventory. Now Elvira is ready to attract new segments of the market, which is why she is requesting the loan. The loan will be used to purchase beauty products and household goods to sell in the store. Elvira hopes to improve the quality of her family's life through this business because she considers it a possession of the entire family. She has dedicated the time and love so that her children are good members of society.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase beauty products and household goods.

loan.name: Luca Adelaida

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia vende repostera y cosmtico desde hace tres aos. Negocio que puso con capital propio y ha ido sacando adelante poco a poco. Comenta que ha tenido tiempos difciles debido a la cara que est la vida actualmente, pero no a perdido las esperanzas y ha logrado mantener el negocio. El uso del prstamo es para comprar materia prima para elaborar las reposteras y tambin invertir en la compra de cosmticos y as poder fortalecer su negocio. Lucia habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene 49 aos de edad, y con tres hijos mayores de edad, de 18, 24 y 30 aos, su esposo trabaja y siempre ha estado pendiente de las necesidades de la familia. A largo plazo es establecer su negocio en un local amplio y poner una cafetera ya que eso le generara mas ingresos, ayudar a su hija de 18 aos a salir a delante y a que se prepare ya que es la nica que esta a su cargo porque los otros estn casados.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucia has sold baked goods and cosmetic products for three years. She started the business with her own capital, and has continued moving forward little by little. She has had difficult times as a result of the high cost of living, but has not lost hope and continues running her business. Mrs. Lucia will use the loan to purchase raw goods from which she will make her baked goods. She will also use the loan to purchase cosmetic products, and strengthen her business in this way. Lucia is 49 years old and lives in the Laureles North neighborhood. She has three children, ages 18, 24 and 30. Her husband works and has always been sensitive to the family's needs. In the long term, Lucia would like to move her business to a larger location and add a cafeteria, which will increase her profits. With the additional income she will support her 18 year old daughter, as she is the the only one currently living in the house because Lucia's other children are married.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase raw materials to make baked goods, and purchase cosmetic products to sell.

loan.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es: El Sr. Hermenegildo es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 52 aos de edad. Toda su vida ha trabajado en la preparacin y venta de rosquillas. Son cuarenta aos de experiencia ya que su familia de eso subsista, y as aprendi a trabajar y hacer las ricas rosquillas que son elaboradas a base de maz, queso y manteca, actualmente est soltero, sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. El prstamo lo necesita para comprar un caballo y as facilitar sus ventas y poder moverse con rapidez.
texts.en:
Mr. Hermenegildo is 52 years old and is a hard working man. His entire life he has worked in the preparation and sales of hot cakes. He has 40 years of experience. His family used to live off the hot cakes, and as a result Mr. Hermenegildo has refined a delicious recipe, combining corn, cheese and butter. Currently, he is single and his children are grown up. Mr. Hermenegildo is requesting the loan to purchase a horse which will help him sell his product and move more quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase a horse

loan.name: Yehya

texts.en: Yehya, 26 years old, is married and has one child. He lives in a small village close to Nabatieh in Southern Lebanon. Yeyha, an ambitious young man, owns an automobile electronic maintenance business. Yehya's enthusiasm and will power have helped his business grow. He has requested a loan of $US1,000 to purchase a more diverse supply of automobile parts. His new inventory will allow him to respond to a wider range of his clients' vehicle troubles. This will be Yehya's second loan with Al Majmoua.

loan.use: To purchase and diversify inventory

loan.name: Yolanda Bertha

texts.es:
La seora Yolanda Bertha, tiene 44 aos, est casada, estudi laboratorio clnico, hizo sus prcticas en Huamachuco durante 07 meses, despus tuvo su bebe, renunci a su trabajo, vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse econmicamente empez a trabajar hace 02 aos en el negocio de cosmetologa, la socia estudi 01 ao cosmetologa y trituracin. Tiene ao y medio trabajando en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su hermana la impuls para que inicie un negocio para que salga adelante por ella misma, ella decidi participar en el Banco Comunal ESPERANZA DEL MAANA porque quera implementar el negocio y con el primer prstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibi compr tintes, secadora, lquidos, mquina para cortar el cabello, etc.
Con el prstamo de S/. 600.00 que cancelar en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la implementacin del negocio. La empresaria suea con comprar mnibus, medios de transporte porque es ms rentable adems contratara personal y ella lo administrara.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yolanda Bertha is 44 and married. She studied Clinical Laboratory Science and did 7 months internship in Huamachuco. After she had her baby, she quit work, and now lives in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo Province, La Libertad department. In order to help herself economically, she started work 2 years ago in cosmetology. She studied one year of cosmetology and has worked in the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year and a half. Her sister gave her the impetus to start a business so she could get ahead by herself. She decided to participate in the communal bank ESPERANZA DEL MAANA (Hope for Tomorrow) because she wanted to start her business. With the first loan of $110, she bought dies, hair products, a hair dryer, a hair cutter, etc. With this loan of $225, which she will repay in 4 months, she plans to invest in the running of the business. This businesswoman dreams of buying a bus, a means of transportation that is more profitable, she would rent it personally as well and administrate it.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Running the business, including tools and products

loan.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 44 aos de edad, es casado, y habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliacin. Su esposa trabaja en una casa particular en servicios domsticos, quien se levanta en horas de la maana para poder hacer sus labores en su hogar, atender a su esposo e hijos ya que estudian dos por la maana en la primaria y los otros dos cursan la secundaria por la tarde, y despus ella sale para su trabajo. El negocio de don Juan, es la reparacin de radios, TV, equipos, entre otros, tambin brinda servicio de acarreo, y as se ayuda con otros ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar, lleva dieciocho aos en el negocio, desea tener mas publicidad para captar mas clientes, el trabajaba en soldadura metalrgica y estudio un curso de electrnica as fue que tuvo la idea de tener su propio negocio el cual ha sido una fuente de ingreso para subsistir con su familia. La solicitud de prstamo es para infraestructura va a terminar de construir su porche, har el enverjado, para tener un poco mas de seguridad ante la delincuencia.
texts.en:
Juan, 44, is married and lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood. His wife works as a maid; she gets up very early to do her own housework, take care of her husband's and their four children's needs, and then she goes off to work. Two of the children go to elementary school in the morning, and the other two attend middle school in the afternoon. Juan's business is a TV, radio, stereo repair shop. He also has a delivery service on the side to increase his family income. Juan used to work in welding, and after taking an electronics course, he got the idea of starting the repair business eighteen years ago, and it has become the main source of income for his family. He would like to reach more customers for his business, but the purpose for this loan is to finish building a gated porch to stay a little safer from theft and vandalism.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Finish home's gated porch

loan.name: Carmen Dora

texts.es: La seora Carmen Dora, tiene 56 aos, es V., estudi secundaria completa, no continu estudiando porque se C., tiene 05 hijos, 04 trabajan y 01 est haciendo tesis, vive en el Distrito D. El Porvenir en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad. Antes ha trabajado 08 aos administrando un grifo en la ciudad D. Trujillo, despus ha trabajado 05 aos administrando un grifo en la ciudad D. Piura, hace 02 aos que vino a Trujillo y tuvo la iniciativa D. tener un negocio propio porque siempre haba trabajado, ella empez a tener una bodega en el momento que le hizo el prstamo a Manuela Ramos, gracias a su sobrina pertenece en el Banco Comunal ESPERANZA DEL MAANA y con el primer prstamo D. S/. 300.00 compr harina, huevos, leches, etc. Con el prstamo D. S/. 1100.00 que cancelar en 4 cuotas, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra D. productos D. limpieza, fideos, aceite, ace, arroz. La empresaria suea con tener una hamburguesera y pollera.
texts.en:
Seora Carmen Dora is 56 years old. She is a widow. She finished secondary school, but didnt continue studying because she got married. She has 5 children, 4 who are working and 1 who is doing a thesis. She lives in the District of El Porvenir in the Province of Trujillo in the Department of La Libertad. She worked for 8 years running a petrol station in the city of Trujillo. After this she worked for 5 years running a petrol station in the city of Piura. It has been 2 years since she came to Trujillo and took the initiative to have her own business. Because she was always working, she began with a neighbourhood store at the very moment she got the loan from Manuela Ramos, thanks to her niece she belongs to the Community Bank Esperanza del Maana (Hope of Tomorrow). With the first loan of S/.300.00 she bought flour, eggs, milk, etc. With this loan of S/. 1100.00 that she will repay in 4 installments, she wants to invest in the purchase of cleaning products, vermicelli, oil, and rice. These businesswoman dreams of having a hamburger and chicken restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy various household products for resale

loan.name: Najib

texts.en: Najib, 41 years old, is married and has 6 children. He lives in a small village in the area of Nabatieh located in Southern Lebanon. Najib owns a home furniture retail store. This can at times be a very capital-intensive business, and Najib has requested a loan of US$ 1,200 to purchase more furniture and decoration items for his constantly expanding stock. This will be Najib's second loan with Al Majmoua.

loan.use: To purchase new products for a home furniture retail business

loan.name: Erick David

texts.es: Don Erick tiene 38 aos de edad, habita en el barrio Sierra Maestra, es casado y tiene una nia menor que est estudiando en la primaria, su esposa trabaja en una tienda en el Centro Comercial Metrocentro se desempea como encargada de limpieza de esa forma apoya a su familia para salir adelante. Don Erick vende fritanga desde doce aos se ha dedicado a las venta de comida, el comenz los das domingo vendiendo sopa y luego se proyect a la venta de comida lo cual le ha resultado. Con el dinero que est solicitando es para invertir en las mejoras del local as como invertir tambin en la materia prima del negocio para ofrecer a sus clientes sus ricos platos y poder mantener la variedad de alimentos.
texts.en:
Erick, 38, lives in the Sierra Maestra barrio, is married and has a young daughter who attends elementary school. His wife works as a janitor in a store at the Metrocentro shopping mall to contribute to the family's income. Erick has a food stand where he sells traditional fried food. He started twelve years ago selling soup on Sundays, and from there his food sales business took off. The loan he is requesting will be invested in improvements for the stand, and in purchasing additional ingredients to offer his customers his delicious dishes and maintain variety in his menu.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Improving food stand and purchasing ingredients

loan.name: Silvia Soledad

texts.es: La seora Silvia Soledad, tiene 48 aos, es divorciada, estudi secundaria completa, no sigui estudiando porque se cas, despus estudi cosmetologa, artesana, tiene 03 hijos, vive en el Distrito D. El Porvenir en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad. La empresaria trabaja en artesana en hilos y cueros, empez como distraccin, tambin se dedica a la venta D. cosmticos, D. ropa, trabaja por campaas. La socia tiene 02 aos trabajando en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su hermana la recomend en el Banco Comunal ESPERANZA DEL MAANA ella decidi participar en este Banco porque siempre se le cerraban las puertas para adquirir el prstamo en otra entidad, porque tena que tener la garanta D. su esposo (AVAL), era un reto, porque siendo capaz, poda desenvolverse adems salir adelante sin el apoyo D. otra persona y con el primer prstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibi compr hilos, agujas, palillos, agujas D. tejer. Con el prstamo D. S/. 1200.00 que cancelar en 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra D. plantas PVC, docenas D. polos. La socia suea con seguir trabajando, porque es un estimulo como mujer ser independiente. En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece, tiene el cargo D. tesorera, cuya funcin es llevar la contabilidad y ver que todo est conforme.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia Soledad is 48 years old, divorced, and has completed her secondary education. She did not continue her studies because she got married, but she later studied cosmetology and folk art. She has 3 children and lives in the El Provenir district in Trujillo Province in the La Liberdad department. This businesswoman works in folk art, both needlework and leather, which she began as a hobby. She also sells cosmetics and clothing, and works for campaigns. She has been a working member of the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her sister recommended her to the communal bank ESPERANZA DEL MAANA (Hope for Tomorrow). She decided to participate in this bank because the doors were always closed to getting a loan elsewhere because she needed her husband, Aval, as a guarantor. This was a challenge, because being a capable person, she was able to cope and even get ahead without anybody else's help. With the first loan of $1000 that she received, she bought threads, needles, knitting needles, and weaving needles. With this loan of $425, which she will repay in 4 months, she intends to invest in artificial plants and dozens of poles. This member dreams of continuing to work, because it is stimulating to be an independent woman. She is the treasurer of the communal bank that she belongs to, whose function is to do the bookkeeping and see that everything is proper.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of artificial plants and poles.

loan.name: Guillermina De Los A

texts.es: Guillermina habita en el barrio La Primavera, vende cosmtico desde hace un ao, ha captado clientela y son productos accesibles de vender por su calidad y precio, inici con esfuerzos propios, actualmente tiene 23 aos de edad, casada y con una nia de 3 aos de edad, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de zona franca desempendose como operario de lnea, Guillermina es activa y con deseo de superacin con el prstamo que esta solicitando es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de lneas de cosmticos para ofrecer al publico en general as como a sus clientes. Alargo plazo es alquilar o hacer un establecimiento donde pueda desarrollarse mas solidamente con sus ventas, tambin espera tener salud y suficiente capital para apoyar a su hija con los estudios.
texts.en:
Guillermina lives in La Primavera neighborhood. She has been selling cosmetics for a year, and thanks to the quality and price of her products, her clientele has been steadily increasing. Guillermina is 23 years old, married and has a 3-year-old daughter. Her husband works in an industrial free zone as an assembly line operator. Guillermina is a very active go-getter. The loan she is requesting will be used as a work capital in her cosmetic business to offer a wider variety of products to her clients. Her long-term goal is to rent or build a small store to expand her business, and she hopes to stay healthy and have enough money to provide for her daughter's education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchasing cosmetics

loan.name: Erick Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Erick habita en la II etapa del barrio de Hialeah, tiene 27 aos de edad, su esposa es ama de casa, ya que tiene que cuidar a sus dos pequeos hijos. Don Erick trabaja como conductor de las rutas urbanas de las cooperativas de esta ciudad de la Capital de Managua, el cual se levanta temprano ya que comienza a dar la primera vuelta en las primera horas de la maana, y son cinco vuelta las que realiza por das, ya son diez aos los que tiene de andar en las rutas pues le ha permitido hacer su pequea casa as como subsistir. Con la solicitud que est haciendo es para terminar de construir una habitacin, para eso necesita comprar materiales como arena, cemento, piedra. A largo plazo es tener su propia ruta de transporte para trabajarla y tener mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Erick, 27, lives in the Hialeah barrio in Managua. His wife is a stay-home mother, who cares for their two small children. Erick works as a bus driver for the cooperatives in Managua. He gets up very early each day, because the first trip begins in the early hours of the morning, and makes five trips throughout the day. He has been at this job for ten years, and has been able to build their small home and make a living. The loan he is requesting will be used to finish an additional room in his home; he needs sand, cement, and stone. His long-term goal is to own a bus, work his own routes and have a better income to provide for his children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Finishing the construction of a room

loan.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia tiene 34 aos D. edad, estudi tercero D. secundaria, es casada, madre D. cuatro hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Machacmarca.
Es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal Ciudad Nueva D. la Comunidad D. Machacmarca, Distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia del Collao-Puno, con su primer prstamo D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles compr 03 ovinos para su posterior venta, Doa Flavia manifiesta que desD. los 15 aos D. edad empez a vender gaseosas en la feria D. Pilcuyo, desD. que convive con su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno, ovino, los das martes compra D. Huacullani y venD. los das domingos en la feria D. Ilave.
Con este crdito D. S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagar en 04 cuotas, comprar 01 toro para su posterior venta.
Su mayor sueo es que sus hijos sean profesionales, comprar una casa en la ciudad D. Puno y seguir con su negocio aumentando ms ganado para su comercializacin.
texts.en:
Flavia is 34 and studied through her third year of secondary education. She is married and the mother of 4 children, they live in the Machacmarca community, Pilcuyo District, Collao-Puno Province. With her first loan of $110, she bought 3 sheep for future sale. Doa Flavia has proven herself, since at the age of 15, she started selling soft drinks in the Pilcuyo street market. Since she has been living with her husband, she has supported herself by buying and selling sheep. She buys on Tuesdays in Huacullani, and sells on Sundays in the Ilave street market. With this loan of $575, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy a bull for future sale. Her biggest dreams are that her children would become professionals, to buy a house in the city of Puno, and to continue to grow her business by purchasing more livestock for market.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy livestock (a bull)

loan.name: Jose Benito

texts.es: El seor G. tiene 42 aos es casado padre de tres hijos todos en edad escolar 1 nia en primer nivel , la otra en segundo grado y el mayor en cuarto grado su esposa es ama de casa y el se dedica a la venta de huevos por cajilla entregando en las diferentes pulperias de leon su credito que se le otorgo fue para capital de trabajo el, seor G. con los creditos otorgados por fundacion ha logrado mejorar su negocio ya que pudo comprar un triciclo para poder visitar las pulperias ya que anteriormente lo que tenia era un carreton de mano , uno de sus sueos es poder comprar una camioneta y asi salir a distribuir y poder ir diversificando sus productos tambien es lograr formar con una carrera universitaria
texts.en:
Mr. G., 42, is married and has three school-age children: a daughter in first grade, a daughter in second grade and a son in fourth grade. His wife is a stay-home mother. Mr. G. sells eggs by the box and delivers them to small grocery stores in Leon. The loan he is requesting will be invested as work capital. With previous loans, Mr. G. has made steady improvements to his business: he bought a tricycle to be able to visit more stores than he was able with the push-cart that he used to have. One of his dream is to buy a truck that will allow him to make deliveries in a wider area and to diversify the products he sells. He also dreams with obtaining a college degree.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: work capital

loan.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La seora Alicia, socia D. Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas y domiciliada en el Jr. 7 de junio N 649, distrito de Callera, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 51 aos, es madre de 5 hijos y su esposo es Tcnico en petrleo. Alicia con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/.300 decide invertir en venta de comida.
En la actualidad cuenta con una ferretera en la cual se siente muy contenta ya que da a da ve crecer ms el negocio.
Con el prstamo de S/.1,500, el cual ser pagado en 4 meses, invertir en la compra de 5 rollos de alambre de diferentes nmeros, 6 docenas de interruptores, 3 docenas de focos, 7 docenas de fluorescentes, 15 martillos y otros.
Alicia se siente muy agradecida de poder contar con una institucin como es Manuela Ramos, ya que gracias a ello ha podido crecer en el negocio y en su estabilidad econmica. Y su gran deseo es seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia is a partner in the Talented Women Communal Bank. Alicia lives at Jr. 7 of junio, Number 649, in the Callera district of Ucayali. She is 51 years old, and a mother of five. Her husband is a petroleum technician. Alicia used her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos to invest in food sales. Now Alicia has a hardware shop, and shes happy to see it growing day by day. With a loan of 1,500 soles, Alicia will invest in five rolls of barbed wire of various grades, six dozen light switches, three dozen lightbulbs, seven dozen fluorescent lights, 15 hammers, and other supplies. Shell repay the loan in four months. Alicia is very grateful to be a member of an institution like Manuela Ramos. Thanks to her participation, shes been able to grow her business and improve her economic stability. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as a micro entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: She will invest in barbed wire, light switches, light bulbs, hammers, etc.

loan.name: Ana Maria Lisette

texts.es:
La seorita Ana, socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en Jr. Salaverry N 597, distrito de Callera, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 21 aos de edad y es soltera. Tiene 2 aos trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decidi invertir en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor para implementar el negocio bodega.
Ana contina atendiendo el negocio de abarrotes y golosinas para as poder solventar sus gastos. Ana estudia contabilidad y al mismo tiempo trabaja en el Banco de Crdito.
Con el prstamo de S/.2,300, el cual ser pagado en 4 meses, invertir en la compra de abarrotes y golosinas, comprar 1 saco de azcar, 1 caja de leche, 2 paquetes de fideos, 2 cajas de gaseosas y 2 paquetes de frugos.
Ana es una joven y una mujer luchadora con ganas de salir adelante. Ella quiere aprovechar su soltera para cumplir algunos de sus sueos, esperando terminar su carrera para tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana is a member of the Communal Bank of Talented Women located at Jr. Salaverry No. 597, Callera district, Ucayali department. She is 21 years old and single. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years, deciding to invest the first loan of $100 that she received from Manuela Ramos in the purchase of wholesale groceries in order to start a grocery shop. She is still working in the grocery and candy business in order to cover her expenses.

Ana is studying accounting and at the same time she is working in the Banco de Crdito (Credit Bank). With the loan of $775, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of groceries and sweets. She will buy 1 sack of sugar, 1 case of milk, 2 cases of soft drinks, and 2 cases of fruit beverages. Ana is a young woman who is a born fighter yearning to get ahead. She wants to take advantage of her unmarried state in order to accomplish some of her dreams, hoping to complete her degree course in order to have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of groceries and sweets

loan.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta tiene 49 aos de edad, estudi primaria completa, es casada madre de 05 hijos, vive en el barrio 24 de Noviembre del Distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia del Collao Puno.
Por falta de capital decidi integrar el Banco Comunal Ciudad Nueva hace 09 meses, con su primer crdito de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles compr 01 saco de arroz, 01 quintal de papa, verduras y otros para preparar comida que vende en la feria de Pilcuyo los das jueves. Ella manifiesta que, desde los 17 aos de edad empez a tejer llicllas, frazadas, fajas y trensillas los que venda en la plaza de Ilave, la mayora de las veces entregaba pedidos, tambin hacia negocio de compra y venta de animales menores: ovinos, porcinos. A la venta de comida se dedica hace 19 aos, anteriormente venda en las ferias de Ilave, Desaguadero.
Con este prstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos Soles el que pagar en 04 cuotas tiene planificado comprar animales menores: 03 porcinos, 03 ovinos y con S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles comprar vveres para preparar comida y vender en la feria de Pilcuyo.
Doa Vicente siempre pens en tener un restaurante y una tienda de abarrotes en el Distrito de Pilcuyo y ayudar a sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Vicenta is 49 years old, completed a primary education, and is a married mother of 5 children. She lives in the neighborhood 24 of November in the Piculyo district, province of Collao Puno. For lack of capital, she has paid the Bank Communal Ciudad Nueva for 9 months. With her first loan from Nuevos Soles, she purchased 1 sack of rice, 1 quintal of potatoes, and vegetables to prepare the food that she sells at the fair in Pilcuyo on Thursdays. Since the age of 17, she has woven blankets, belts and hats which she sells in the key plaza. Most of the time, she delivers orders, and she also is in the business of buying and selling small animals (sheep and pigs). Nineteen years ago, she devoted herself to the sale of food which she previously sold at the Desaguadero fair. With this loan of $350 from Nuevos Soles, which she will repay in four months, she plans to buy smaller animals: 3 pigs, 3 sheep and groceries to prepare food and sell at the fair in Pilcuyo. Dona Vincent always dreams of having a restaurant and a grocery store in the District of Pilcuyo and helping her children until they are professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: For the purchase of animals and food

loan.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La seora Aurelia, socia del Banco Comunal Las Lomas de Yarina, ubicado en AA.HH Los Rosales Fonavi, distrito de Yarina, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 34 aos y 3 hijos. Su esposo es electricista. Aurelia con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decidi invertir en venta de condimentos.
Aurelia, en la actualidad contina con la venta de especera. Ella vende en el mercado N 2, en la cual est muy contenta de ver crecer el negocio.
Con el prstamo de S/ 3,000, el cual ser pagado en 4 meses, invertir en la compra de 1 saco de aj panca, 2 bolsa de ajinomoto, 1 galn de aceite, 1 saco de laurel y otros, as como tambin ayudar a su esposo en su taller comprando algunos materiales.
Aurelia est muy contenta por el apoyo que le brinda el banco comunal de Manuela Ramos ya que gracias a ello ha podido sobresalir en el negocio, as mismo tambin puede darles educacin superiores a sus 2 ltimos hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Aurelia H. is a member of the Las Lomas de Yarina microfinance institution located in AA.HH Los Rosales Fonavi, in the Yarina district of the department of Ucayali. She is 34 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is an electrician. Aurelia decided to invest her first loan from Manuela Ramos (300.00 PEN) in the spice business. Aurelia currently sells spices at the number 2 market. She is quite happy seeing her business grow. With this loan of 3,000.00 PEN, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase 1 sack of panca chili peppers, 2 bags of chili pepper seasoning mix, 1 gallon of cooking oil, 1 sack of bay leaves, and she will help her husband with his workshop by purchasing some supplies. Aurelia is very satisfied with the support that the Manuela Ramos microfinance institution gives her. Thanks to their support, she has been able to excel in her business, as well as provide a higher education for her 2 younger children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase chili peppers, cooking oil, etc.

loan.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 74 aos D. edad, estudi primer ao D. primaria, es casada y madre D. seis hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Machacmarca, Distrito D. Pilcuyo Provincia del Collao.
Es socia del Banco Comunal Ciudad Nueva Machacmarca, su primer crdito fue D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles aumentando a su capital compr 01 ganado vacuno. Ella desD. los 14 aos D. edad se dedica a la venta D. gaseosas, vendiendo en la plaza D. Pilcuyo todos los jueves, tambin hace negocio D. compra y venta D. ganado vacuno con el apoyo D. su esposo, generalmente compra D. la feria D. Pilcuyo y lleva a la ciudad D. Arequipa y Lima.
Con este prstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles el que pagar en 04 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar 01 cabeza D. ganado vacuno, el que enviar a Arequipa Lima para su venta.
Su mayor sueo es que sus dos hijos menores sean profesionales ya que los hijos mayores tienen su familia y no pudieron estudiar por falta D. medios econmicos.
texts.en:
Agustina is a 74-year-old married mother of 6 children. She was only able to attend first graD. in elementary school. She lives in the Machacmarca community, in the District of Pilcuyo in the Collao Province.

She is a member of the microfinance institute Nueva Machacmarca. Her first loan was for 500.00 Peruvian soles. Upon increasing her capital, she was able to purchase cattle. From the age of 14, she has been selling soft drinks at the Pilcuyo plaza every Thursday. With her husbands support, she also buys and sells cattle for a living. She generally buys her cattle at the Pilcuyo market and takes it to Arequipa and Lima.

With this loan of 1,500.00 Peruvian PEN, which she will repay in 4 installments, she plans on purchasing 1 head of cattle, which she will send to Arequipa and Lima to sell.

Her biggest wish is to see her two youngest children become professionals since her older children have their own families now and did not have a chance to study to due lack of financial resources.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase cattle

loan.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La seora Bertha, socia del Banco Comunal Indo Amrica, ubicado en el Jr. Fiscarral # 246, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 42 aos y es madre de 9 hijos, su esposo es motokarrista. Bertha con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decidi invertir en la venta de frutas.
Bertha, en la actualidad tiene un motokar que es trabajado por su esposo y ella trabaja de ama de casa.
Con el prstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual ser pagado en 4 meses, invertir en el mantenimiento de su motokar.
Bertha, est muy agradecida por la confianza y el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos, ya que de esa manera puede apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su familia y en la educacin de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Indo American Communal Bank, which is located at #246 on Jr. Fiscarral in the Calleria district of Ucayali. Bertha is 42 years old and lives with her husband and nine children. Her husband owns and runs a moto-taxi and Bertha is a housewife. This is the first loan that Bertha has requested from the bank. She is requesting 1,300 soles (apx. $450) which she will invest in the maintenance of the her family's motorcycle. The loan period will be for four months. Bertha is very grateful for the confidence and assistance the Manuela Ramos provides. It is through these means that Bertha will be able to assist her husband in payment of the familial expenses and provide for the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Maintenance of the family's moto-taxi.

loan.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Isabel a sus 54 aos de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora que ha podido salir adelante con su familia, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Edgar Munguia, procre tres hijos de 9, 15 y 16 aos de edad, los cuales estn estudiando la secundaria, actualmente doa Isabel trabaja en un comedor, y en sus horas libres vende cosmticos, pues se vio en la necesidad de tener ms ingresos ya que es madre soltera, son tres aos de estar laborando en la cocina. Sus hijos la apoyan en la cobranza ya que vende los cosmticos al contado y al crdito. Con la solicitud que esta haciendo es para infraestructura en la construccin de un cuarto para estar ms cmodo, para eso necesita comprar piedra, arena cemento y hierro. A largo plazo es tener mas productos que ofertar a sus clientes, lograr mejores condiciones para seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa as como ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios a que puedan seguir preparndose para que sean hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel, in her 54 years of age, is a working woman and an activist who has been able to move forward with her family. She lives in a neighborhood called Edgar Munguia in the capital city of Managua. She has three children, who are 9,15 and 16 years of age and are studying high school. Mrs. Isabel currently works in a diner and sells cosmetics in her spare time for the additional income, as she is a single mother. She has worked for three years in the diner. Her children rely on the collection of money because she sells the cosmetics for cash and credit. The loan application is to help with the construction of a room to make it more comfortable. For this, it is necessary to purchase stone, sand, cement and iron.

In the long run, her goal is to offer more products to her customers, achieve a better position to continue making home improvements, and help her children with school to enable them to continue preparing to be honest and good men.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Construction of a room

loan.name: Girasoles Group
